loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is 31 years old and lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Nidal owns a mini market and is applying for a loan because he needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Al Chams Group

texts.en:
A. Chams group, whose name means the Sun in Arabic, is composed of three married women from a small village in the Bekaa. Hanadi, 37 years old, works as promoter for a speciA. brand of herbA. medicines; Touffaha, 52 years old, is a promoter of cosmetic goods, and, Malak, 19 years old, wants to start a new business. These three motivated women need a loan for an amount of USD 300 each as working capitA. to expand their respective business. This is the first time that A. Chames group requests a loan from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a veil on the picture (2nd from left) is A. Majmoua credit officer who monitors A. Chams group.

loans.use: USD 900 (300 per woman) as working capital for their individual business

loans.name: Silma

texts.es:
Silma is a young woman with three daughters. Her partner's name is Higinio Brizuela. Silma works selling all kinds of merchandise such as sugar, noodles, oil, cheese, etc.

Silma has been working in this line of business for over two years and has her store right in her home. She had to make some modifications to the house to be able to have the store there.

The money that Silma makes in her store goes towards the cost of running her home, so she and her partner can pay for what their family needs.

Silma says that she makes a lot of sales and this is why she would like to increase the amount of merchandise she has for sale. This will allow her to meet the demands of her customers in the area where she lives and works.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Silma, es una señora joven, esta acompañada con el señor Higinio Brizuela y es madre de tres nenas. Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercaderías como, azúcar, fideo, arroz, aceite, queso, entre otras cosas.

Silma se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de 2 años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa. Ella tuvo que hacer algunas modificaciones a la casa para poder tener su propio salón comercial.

Silma, con los ingresos que consigue de su despensa aporta al mantenimiento de la casa, de esa forma con su compañero hacen frente a los gastos familiares.

Silma, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona donde vive y tiene su salón comercial.

loans.use: Purchase of various kinds of merchandise such as sugar, noodles, oil, herbs, rice, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. is 55 years old. She is a widow with nine children. Unfortunately, she has lost three. The remaining six are currently in school. She is a local manufacturer of soaps and bleaches and sells used clothes as well. Yaa has been in business for ten years, and she sells to support her family with income.  Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business to scale up. With the loan, Yaa wants to buy more materials to increase the production of her soaps and bleaches. She is with Harmony Group Trust, and the group members guarantee for each other as collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To be able to purchase more raw materials for her soap manufacturing, and to also buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more goods to restock her small business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is a 30-year old entrepreneur. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and four children.

Veronica runs a food kiosk where she prepares and sells local foodstuffs. She specializes in making the local favorites, chapattis (fried flat bread) and mandazzis (fried sweet dough), normally served with bean stew and tea. She started this business in 2007.The location of her business and her reputation for doing good business within the community has gained her a wide customer base.

Previous KMET loans were instrumental to the success of her business; she combined the loan money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and build a successful, income-generating business. She has applied for US $500 to further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah T. is a courageous business lady aged 39. She runs a retail shop in Mbarara Taxi Park that sells mainly clothes and groceries. She is married with 4 children and has basically been running her business for a period of 10 years.

Dorah is using the loan to purchase clothes for her shop because she expects increased sales, especially during the festive season. As her business grows and profits increase, her ambitions are to see her children through all levels of education successfully.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for her shop

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib A. is a good son to his old parents, a hard-working farmer, and is steadfast in his endeavor of raising animals. Thanks to his father, who gave him good education in farming, he is able to raise and feed the animals and prepare them for sale at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns. Sahib lives in a small village of  Imishli city. He has two years of experience in this field. His dream is to get married and have children, he also believes that additional funds will help to increase his income and improve his current situation.  Sahib would now like to increase the amount of cattle and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. He promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 42 años, vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en su casa propia. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que toda su familia tenga su negocio propio de venta de productos lácteos y otras variedades de alimentos, es por ello que juntos preparan el yogurt que es todo un proceso de aproximadamente 60m litros por semana, tienen clientes fijos, como una escuela técnica de policías que siempre consumen sus productos por la calidad que han demostrado tener en la producción, esto anima bastante a Rosa que también ha incursionado en hacer néctares y panecillos, lo que es algo difícil por no disponer de un horno panadero, ya que a veces el horno que alquila le envía los panecillos quemados, por lo que Rosa se ha propuesto implementar su cocina. Es la  cuarta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser muy puntual en sus pagos de devolución de  capital, además Rosa tiene gran habilidad trabajar en equipo, como lo hace en su banco comunal. En esta oportunidad, el dinero requerido es para comprar un horno y mejorar su producción de pasteles, así como en la elaboración de los yogurtes y néctares. El horno está valorizado en aproximadamente 2000 soles y  con lo que resta comprará mayor cantidad de insumos e ingredientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 and lives with her husband and children in a house which they own. Through a lot of hard work, the family has succeeded in building their own business, which sells dairy products and other types of foods. They produce about 60 liters of yogurt every week. They have regular clients, including a police academy that always selects their products because they know they are high-quality. Rosa is very inspired by this and now she is also trying her hand at making nectar drinks and baking loaves of bread, which is difficult because she does not have a bread oven. Sometimes the oven she rents burns the loaves, so Rosa is considering installing one of her own. This is the fourth loan Rosa is requesting from MFP, and she has been very prompt with her repayments. Rosa is also very good at working with a team, as she does with her village bank. She plans to use this loan to buy an oven, so she can improve her baking proces, and to support her yogurt and nectar drinks production. The oven will cost about 2000 soles. The rest will go toward supplies and ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an oven to make baked goods

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua T. sells personal products and food supplies like maize at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast. Akua has received junior high education. She is a single parent and has 2 children.

Akua has been selling personal products and food supplies since 2008. She is responsible for paying family expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to developing her farm.

loans.use: additional capital to  increase the sale of food supplies

loans.name: Kibalama Gorreti Group

texts.en:
Gorreti K. is 50 years of age and married with six children. She rents a four-room house together with her family. She also cares for additional family members. Gorreti has three meals a day and her greatest expense is school tuition for her children.

She is a tailor in a shop that she rents in town. She works seven a days a week and she normally receives about two customers a day. Most of her customers are women. She has done this work for over 12 years now. The challenge she faces in her business is that her customers come seasonally, mainly during festive seasons.

Gorreti has worked MCDT for five years now and chose MCDT because it was lending money to the poor. She hopes to use the loan to buy materials for sale and she also wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita G. is 28 years old. She is single and enjoys trading, the business through which she make a living. Rita lives at a family house at Kwahu Da in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run other types of businesses.

Rita trades in second-hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes, including bedspreads, ladies clothing and menswear, from Kumasi, a nearby city. She then sells them in the market square of her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell.

Rita has been in this business for eight years and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales. She also prepares and sells banku (fermented corn dough) in her community to beef up her income. Rita says she prepares her banku in the morning and switches over to the sale of used clothes in the evening through hawking.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually, help improve her finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called ‘Anigyee’ (Happiness) Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee loans for one another and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba, Delia es de la comunidad de Huascahura que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Delia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Delia vende carne, los animales los compra de los pueblos y luego los beneficia, sus ventas los realiza de casa en casa. Además los días sábados y domingos vende comida en su comunidad.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdo, oveja.
Los sueños de Delia son construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Urubamba Community Bank. She is from the town of Huascahura, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Delia is 48 years old, married and has four children. She sells meat; the animals are purchased from small towns and she sells door-to-door. In addition, on Saturdays and Sundays she sells food in her own neighborhood. Delia needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of pork and mutton. Delia dreams of building a house and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork and mutton

loans.name: Decadas 1 Group

texts.en:
The five entrepreneurs applying for this Kiva loan have already paid back two loans to Esperanza International over 6-month terms. This third loan will be used to strengthen their businesses' inventories, which will hopefully produce higher sales volumes.

Milagros P. is the group representative, and her business consists of selling charcoal. In the impoverished area where she lives, many people do not have a stove to cook on or cannot afford gas. Their option is to cook the little food they have in aluminum pots and pans over charcoal fires. Milagros has managed to develop a faithful clientèle and hopes to continue providing charcoal to them by buying more with this loan.

Milagros's greatest ambition is to contribute to the education of her four children attending school by supporting them for as long as they wish to continue studying. Her hopes are that through education they can access better employment opportunities.

Please help us to continue supporting these five micro entrepreneurs. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
D. Béatrice est née à Aplahouè dans le Département du Mono. Béatrice est veuve depuis cinq ans avec cinq (5) enfants. Il y a de cela quinze ans que Béatrice a commencé le commerce. Béatrice vendait des boissons liqueurs a ses débuts. Actuellement, Béatrice vend des tissus à DANTOKPA, grand marché international du Bénin. Béatrice a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a présentement pour développer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Béatrice demande un prêt de la part de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Béatrice D. was born in Aplahouè in the department of Mono. She was widowed five years ago and has five children. Béatrice started up her business 15 years ago. She began by selling alcoholic beverages. Now she sells fabrics in Dantokpa, Benin’s large international market. Béatrice is in need of greater financial means in order to develop her business so that she can better meet the needs of her clientele. That is why she is requesting a loan from Alidé (Kiva Field Partner). The meaning of Alidé in the local Fon language of Benin is, "there is always a path for the poorest of people." Benin is a small country in Western Africa, bordering with Nigeria, where GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 bolts of 'Bazin' fabric

loans.name: Murodboy

texts.ru: Муродбой кредитор в Микроинвесте с  2008 года. Он  получает займ на расширение бизнеса животноводства. Сам Муродбой работает разнорабочим на дому у людей. Ежедневный заработок он тратит на покупку продуктов семьи. Его бизнес развернулся вдвое, у него сейчас 20 баранов и 15 коз. Муродбой хочет получить повторный кредит на закуп корма скота  и покупки одной большой коровы, которая будет давать молоко. Муродбой благодарен инвесторам за доверие и понимание, потому что у него улучшилась проживание семьи и увеличился доход с бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Murodboy has been a MicroInvest client since 2008. He is getting a loan to expand his livestock business. Murodboy works as a laborer at a people’s home. He spends his salary on purchasing food for his family. His business has doubled. He now has 20 sheep and 15 goats. Murodboy would like to get a second loan to purchase feed for the livestock and to purchase one big cow which will produce milk. Murodboy is grateful to the investors for their trust and understanding, because his family’s living conditions have improved and the income from his livestock business has increased.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and a cow

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en: Mrs Arminda M. F. is a long-time client of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. She runs a hair salon where she is hard-working and gives each customer personalized attention. Arminda also provides manicure and pedicure services and sells dyes and cleaning products from her business. Her main customers form a well-established clientele which she has had for many years, but she has casual clients as well. With this job and help from her parents, Arminda has been able to buy a house as well as fund her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase tools and articles for her hair salon

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
“Do not do unto others, what you do not want others to do unto you.” This is the guiding principle in the life of Milagros B.. She is 46 years old and already a widow. She has four children: Jennifer, who is 26 years old and married; Rowena, who is 24 years old and also married; Hazel, who is 22 years and in the third year of college; and Mark Glenn, who is 13 years old and a high school student. Milagros intends to send her youngest child to college; however, lack of financial resources brings her worries. Her family lives in Barangay Palao, Solana, Cagayan.

Milagros is requesting a loan of PHP20,000 from Kiva to use as additional capital for her general store business. She hopes that through the loan, she can further develop her business and make it profitable. She is thankful that two of her children are extending some financial support even though they have their own families. According to Milagros, she will do her best to make her business grow and be productive.

loans.use: To develop her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy condiments and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali-Rwanda,

N. is 47 years old, married to one woman.  He produces a monthly income of 300,000 which he used to support 7 children - ages of 19,16,13,11,9,7, and 5.  On top of these children, he also cares for 9 dependents.

He has 20 years of experience in selling fish.  He works each day from 5:00 AM to 7:00 PM with earns him a monthly profit is 100,000 RWF. 

Now he needs his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will be able to expand his business through purchasing more fish and with that expansion, he has hopes of increasing his monthly profit.

By using this loan, Isaac believes he will be able to pay school fees of his children, build his own house, get more food for his family and even save some money for the future.

loans.use: Fish

loans.name: Kinta

texts.fr: Kinta Y. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Diannah Malary depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle mène une activité de vente de porcs depuis plus de cinq ans, elle achète sa marchandise au Sénégal pour aller vendre en Guinée Bissau. Son objectif est de construire un habitat tout participant au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kinta Y., 43, is married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Diannah Malary for six and a half years. She has had a business selling pigs for more than 5 years. She buys her merchandise in Sénégal and goes to Guinée Bissau to make her sales. Her goal is to build a place to live, while paying the school expenses of her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her pig-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: faire un stock de céréales

loans.name: Sangin

texts.ru: Сангин Назаров проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 45 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сангин имеет среднее образование. Он более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Сангин имеет магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для закупа ассортимента.

loans.use: Пополнение ассортимента

loans.name: Probe Group

texts.en:
Probe is a group of 2 borrowers led by Elitha Quennan,47 years old married with 3 children aged 13-26 years old and their educational levels 5th grade-freshman in university.She also cares for 2 orphans.
Elitha is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to early marriage.
She and her family lives on the Lawazu Road at the out sketch of Voinjama,the capital of Lofa County,northern Liberia.

Elitha Quennan's business is selling used clothing. She buys wholesale from importers and sells retail in the Voinjama Market, Lofa County, Northern Liberia. She is 47 years old and married with three children, ages 13 to 26 years old, in Grade 5 to a freshman in university. She also cares for two orphans. Elitha is a high school graduate but she could not continue in university due to an early marriage. She lives with her family on the Lawazu Road, on the outskirts of Voinjama, the capital of Lofa County, Northern Liberia.

Elitha has been running her business for eight years and hopes to improve her business. She often faces financial problems with her business due to family responsibilities. She handles her customers with care and gives them better prices in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan in order to purchase used clothes wholesale to improve her business. Elitha dreams of giving her children a better education and preparing them for the future.

Probe is a group of two borrowers led by Elitha Quennan.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes wholesale

loans.name: Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo blas lo conforman Elizabeth Eugenia M. G. de 21 años, Rosalinda G. de 54 años y Lucia Emilia G. de 54 años. La joven M. desde hace tres años empezó a vender cosméticos por catalogo con lo cual se ha ayudado con los gastos de sus estudios universitarios. Ella está en cuarto año de administración de empresa y desea tener una tienda de ropas y cosméticos.


La señora G.  desde el 2004 empezó haciendo pan y cosa de horno en pequeñas cantidades y actualmente distribuye en las ventas y   Lucia Emilia G. hace doce años que hace destace de cerdo.
texts.en:
The Blas Group consists of Elizabeth Eugenia M. G. (age 21), Rosalinda G. (age 54), and Lucia Emilia G. (age 54). Young Elizabeth began selling cosmetics by catalog three years ago in order to pay for her college expenses. She is her fourth year studying business administration and hopes to open her own clothing and cosmetics store.

Sra. Rosalinda, since 2004, has been producing and selling bread and other baked goods in small batches. Sra. Lucia has been selling pork for 12 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Usioma

texts.en:
Usioma is 35 years old and married with three children. She sells groceries, juice and drinks to make a living in the Delta state of Nigeria. She sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her immediate family members. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits. She hopes to combine her business with her tailoring skills in the future. 

She hopes for a loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy M. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 26 years old.  He is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Roy owns & operates a business in the services sector operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Roy has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Balyewunya Group 1, Mukono

texts.en: N. Sarah is a determined and hard-working lady with a business selling produce out of her stall in Takajjunge and selling firewood, yet she is a teacher by profession. She is 50 years old and divorced with 5 children out of whom three are still in school, she also takes care of two dependents. She started her businesses 4 years ago and she is happy that they help bring in an extra income instead of having to wait for her monthly salary which is very little, at any rate. This is her 4th loan with the group and she is happy that her businesses are able to give her more savings. She needs a loan to help buy more produce and wood for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce to be sold at her stall, in addition to firewood

loans.name: Meshgan Khomary Group

texts.en: This is the Meshgan Khomary group. This group is made up of three members. Mirwais is the group leader of Meshgan Khomary Group. Mirwais is the first member of Meshgan Khomary Group. He is married. He runs a cosmetics shop. With this loan, he wants to buy more goods for his shop. Khomary is the second member of Meshgan Khomary Group. She is a tailor. She wants to complete her stock. The third member of the group is Meshgan who has a carpet weaving business. She wants to buy materials for her carpet weaving. These three members have requested a group loan of 47,600 Afghani to expand their businesses and complete the requirements. They would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his shop

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth Del Carmen tiene 39 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y CD. Anteriormente ella había solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de materia y le fue de mucha ayuda. Ella inicia este negocio hace 10 años, por lo que ella tiene que buscar el medio de vida para salir adelante. A pesar de la difícil situación que tiene como es la competencia ya que algunas veces sus clientes obtienen los productos de una forma más favorable. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio y para atraer a sus clientes. Su deseo es obtener un puesto en el mercado en donde ofrezca sus productos de manera mas confiable.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Del Carmen is 39. She sells clothes and CDs. Previously she had asked for a loan to buy things, and it was of great help. She started this business ten years ago. She needed to find a way of life to get ahead in spite of the difficulties like competition, because sometimes her customers find products at a more favorable price. The loan she is asking for is to buy the raw material that is necessary for her business and to attract her customers. Her wish is to get a stand at the market where she can offer her products in a more dependable way.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a 32-year-old widow with two children who attend school.  She has been running a salon for four years and employs one person.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her business grow, which raises her family's living standard.  She hopes to open a wholesale beauty shop in the future.  She is requesting a loan to buy a steamer, hair products, and hair weaves.  She is very hardworking.

loans.use: Buy a steamer and hair products

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, tiene 41 años, es casada y  tiene seis hijos, ella forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. Julia se dedica a la confección de ropa de lana como chompas, pantalones, polos, ropa interior y chalinas. Julia nos cuenta que ella produce de forma manual su ropa en su domicilio donde también se vende la ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedican al negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Julia requiere el préstamo de los 1000 soles, que invertirá en comprar lana.  Julia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old, married, and has six children. She is a member of the Asociación Arariwa’s “Once de Mayo – Huancarani” communal bank. Julia makes wool clothing, such as jackets, pants, sweaters, underclothes, and shawls. Julia tells us she makes her clothing by hand in her home, which is also where she sells the clothing. She has been in this business for several years and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Julia needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy wool. Julia is grateful for the opportunity provided through this program and she promises to repay in within the time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy wool.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou G. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère 7 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 17 fois de suite. Elle développe une activité d'embouche ovine, ce qui lui génère de ressources financières lui permettant de se prendre en charge et de participer aux à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou G. is a 52-year old woman who is married and has seven children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for eight and a half years. She has significant borrowing experience, in that she has had 17 consecutive loans. She is developing a beef fattening activity, which generates the financial resources to allow her to take care of, and participate in, the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her beef fattening business

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Don José es un hombre muy trabajador y de pocos recursos económicos, tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de leche agria, y acarreo ya que tiene una camioneta que compro hace mucho de sus trabajos de albañil. Su esposa lo ayuda hacer la leche agria para poder apoyarse mutuamente. Su casa de don José es toda de madera ya muy vieja y lo que desea hacer con este financiamiento es poder comenzar hacerla mitad de piedra y el resto de madera para empezar y poder tener una casa con mejores condiciones Para su familia. Lo cual comprara piedra, arena, cemento para comenzar las mejoras. Las dificultades es que a veces se le daña su vehiculo que es su fuente de trabajo también, y no tiene el dinero en efectivo para repararlo de inmediato. Sus planes es poder aumentar las ventas de leche agria, como captar más clientela para mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Don José is a very hardworking man with little economic resources. He is 38 years old. He makes and transports buttermilk now that he has a truck, which he bought a while ago when he worked as a bricklayer. His wife helps him make the buttermilk so she can help support them. Don José's house is very old and made of wood. With this loan he wants to begin making the house half stone and half wood so that he and his wife can have a house that offers better living conditions. To begin making the improvements, he was to buy stone, sand, and cement. The problem is sometimes his vehicle--the source of his work--gets damaged, and he does not have the money to repair it immediately. The couple's plans is to increase sales of buttermilk and get more customers, so they can receive more benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials for house

loans.name: Artur Carlos

texts.pt:
Artur Carlos M. nasceu no Distrito de Massingue, Provincia de Inhambane, sul de  Moçambique tem 36 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 13, 10 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a mãe enviando algum valor monetário juntamente com outros seus irmãos.
Saiu de Inhambane para Boane devido a transferência dos serviços, saiu com a sua família. Trabalha na Empresa de construção de estradas como operador de máquinas pesadas, tem também pensão mensal, da desmobilização militar. Não possui empregado, em suma consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.800.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material eléctrico (fios eléctricos, contador, tomadas e outros) para electrificar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Artur Carlos M. was born in the district of Massingue, in Inhambane province in the south of Mozambique. He is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 13, 10 and 6 years old. All of his children attend school. Artur only studied through the 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and along with his siblings he helps to support his mother by sending her money. Artur left Inhambane for Boane with his family due to a job transfer. He works for a road construction company operating heavy machinery and has also collected a monthly pension since being discharged from the army. He does not employ any household help and in all he has a monthly income of 4800 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also manages to save some of this income in his bank account. Artur has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is his 2nd loan, for the amount of 8000 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy materials (electrical wires, a meter, and sockets) in order to wire his house for electricity.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for installing electricity (electrical wires, a meter, and sockets)

loans.name: Dolith Adhiambo

texts.en:
Dolith Adhiambo is a 23-year-old tailor who makes and sells clothes, a business she started in 2009 after completing her tailoring course.

With one year of experience, Dolith has been able to get quite a number of customers so that she ends up falling short of supplies. It is for this reason she decided to apply for a loan of Ksh 10,000 to be able to increase her stock and boost her business. This will enable her to achieve her dream of having her own business premises where she will no longer be paying rent.

Dolith is married, has three children. She and her family live in Manyatta, Kisumu.

loans.use: To add more stock to her business

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 40 years old and married with two children, ages eleven and eight. She is a member of the community bank María Auxiliadora, which is comprised of eleven people all hailing from the Cusco area. Clemencia is originally from the city of Juliaca but has been living in Cusco for over 25 years, and here she makes a living working in a small transportation business she has with her husband. The two of them own and operate a combi, a type of shared-ride van common to Peru. While he drives the van, Clemencia’s job is to collect the fare from passengers. 

Clemencia will use the loan she receives from Kiva to repair the old and wearing parts of her combi van. She says that she will also use the money to travel to Juliaca, her hometown, where she sometimes visits and sells clothing items. Clemencia is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Repairing combi van/trip to Juliaca to sell clothing

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en: Yadigar I., 39 years old, has been a breeder of cows, calves, and bulls for the last 10 years. Thanks to the very first loan he received from Kiva, he was able to develop his business. He now has five cows, three calves, and two bulls. Generally, he breeds cows for milk and milk products, and calves for meat production. Milk products are always very popular and can be expensive, which is why Yadigar decided to breed them. Now he would like to purchase more cattle and for this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To buy two calves and fodder

loans.name: Mrs. Peng Lem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Srae Ambil 3 village in Kandal province a village bank loan group of nine people has selected Mrs. Peng L. as the village bank president. All the members will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Peng L. was born in 1961. She and her husband, Mr. Tha Khlout, catch and sell fish to support their family. But now they have some problems because their fishing supplies are too old to use. So to address this, Mrs. Peng L. is applying for a loan to buy fishing supplies and a battery. She is a mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq M. is a 36 year-old farmer who grows pomegranates and seasonal fruits and vegetables. He started his business in 2000 and now has permanent clients who are local traders and restaurants. His monthly income is about 180-250 AZN. 

Sadiq is married and has three children. He lives and works in the small village of Agsu. Due to a good climate, this region has very good planting conditions which gives rich crops. Sadiq has applied for a loan of 1m000 AZN in order to purchase new varieties of fruit. His dream is to one day have a big fruit garden and become a rich person.

loans.use: To purchase new varieties of fruit trees.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Progresista” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas que decidieron agruparse para trabajar dentro del proyecto Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Cada integrantes  se dedica a una actividad diferente,  entre ellas se encuentra la señora Nilda quien se dedica a la cría de animales.
Ella tiene la facilidad para la cría de animales menores como aves y cerdos, ya que cuenta con terreno y al mismo tiempo por el marido le ayuda para la alimentación con la producción de yuca y maíz que el cultiva.
Ella comenta que con la venta de los animales obtiene buena ganancia para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de balanceados que ayudaran  para un crecimiento más rápido de sus animales.
texts.en:
The committee "Mujeres Progresista" (Progressive Women), was formed by various neighbors who united and decided to work together for a project titled: Entrepreneurial Women's Comittee. Each member specializes in different professions and amongst them you will find Mrs. Nilda who raises animals. She can easily raise small animals such as birds and pigs since she has the land and a husband who helps her with feed from the cassava and corn he cultivates. She states that she has a good enough return from the sale of her animals to help her family. The loan she requests will be used towards the purchase of nutritionally balanced feed which help her animlas grow faster.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nutrionally balanced feed

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño ["fighting For A Dream"] Group

texts.es:
Grupo conformado por siete personas seis mujeres y un varón todos ellos muy entusiastas por ello el nombre el sueño es salir adelante cada uno D. ellos con su propio negocio y dar lo mejor a los suyos.

Tal es el caso D. Sonia quien venD. en L. mañanas verduras y tubérculos (espinaca, papa, zanahoria, arveja, choclo, limón, lechuga u otros) en una calle muy conocida y transitada, nos cuenta que desD. niña acompañaba a su padre a vender estas verduras en un mercado, no le agradaba mucho esta idea tenía un poco D. vergüenza; pero esta idea cambió cuando sufre L. separación con su ex pareja debido a ello tuvo que trabajar por su niñita pequeña aún; esto lo hacía soL. porque su papa fallece y esto L. hizo tomar esta decisión D. seguir trabajando como le enseñó su padre. 

No era fácil en un principio porque no había muchos compradores y a veces L. mercadería se malograba en el camino debido a las huelgas nacionales o deslizamiento D. tierra y barro en L. zona (alud) y había pérdida D. mercadería que traía D. L. sierra hasta L. ciudad se malograba, pese a ello persistió y siguió trabajando mucho hasta hacerse conocida en el barrio donD. venD. esto le ayudó a mantener a su madre e hija a quien le da lo mejor para su educación, compró un pequeño terreno en un asentamiento humano que va empezar a construir más adelante, por el momento ha plantado una casita D. madera. Tener un puesto propio en una D. sus metas muy lejanas que espera alcanzar con los ingresos D. este trabajo, necesita seguir invirtiendo en este negocio para lograr uno D. sus objetivos para ello requiere del préstamo.
texts.en:
This group is maD. up of seven people, six women and one man. All of them are very enthusiastic. For them, the name of the dream is getting ahead in the businesses they run and doing their best for their loved ones. This is the case with Sonia, who sells vegetables and root crops in the mornings (spinach, potatoes, carrots, peas, corn, limes, lettuce and others) on a well-known and busy street. She tells us that since she was a girl, she accompanied her father when he sold these vegetables at a market. She didn't like this idea very much because she was a bit shy, but her attituD. changed when she went through a separation from her former partner, and due to this, she had to work for the sake of her daughter who was still very young. She did this alone, because her father had died, and this led her to the decision to work as her father had taught her. It was not easy at first, because there were not many buyers, and sometimes the merchandise was ruined because of the national strikes or landslides and mudslides (avalanches) in the area, so that the products she carried from the mountains to the cities were spoiled. However, she persisted and kept working hard until she became well-known in the neighborhood where she sells her products. This has helped her to support her mother and her daughter, whom she tries to give the best education possible. She has bought a small plot of land in a settlement that will soon be constructed. For the moment, she has set up a small wooden house. Having a sales stand of her own is one of her distant goals, which she hopes to achieve with the income from this work. She needs to keep investing in this business to achieve her goals, and it is for this reason that she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables and root crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Aménagement de boutique pour vente de produits alimentaires

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Mary is 54 years old and is widowed. She has seven children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a proper store for charcoal.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Seakkouy

texts.en:
Mrs. Seakkouy P. (pictured here) is 37 years old and her husband, Mr. San Sorn, is 38 years old. They live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and another one stays at home. 

Sokkouy sells Toek Kork Chhose at home. Toek Kork Chhose is considered a slush or shaved-ice dessert made with milk and sugar. Her husband has been selling ice cream in the nearby village.  

Sokkouy is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin G. is a 54 year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: general store and meat vending. She lives in Prk. Overflow, Brgy. Hilamonan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and meat vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 25,000.

Jasmin is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jasmin aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Motema Mpiko Plus Group

texts.en: Osé is a leader of a Community bank named “Motema Mpiko Plus”, which is composed of 17 microentrepreneurs.  Osé, aged 35, is married with two children and sells pairs of shoes in the north western area of Kinshasa. He has been in business since 2003. He has acquired solid experience and his business has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. He is a loyal client and has already made 4 MFI HOPE DRC loans and repaid them properly. He intends with the next loan to purchase 25 pairs of shoes to increase the inventory of his business in order to increase the business income. Currently, he earns a profit of $70 every week.

loans.use: to purchase 25 pairs of shoes for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 29-year-old married man with two children aged five and two.  He supplies bread and cakes.  Through his business, he is able to take care of his family.  He has been running the business for five years.  He has requested for a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy a bicycle for transporting his bread and cakes.  With the loan, he will also buy cakes, bread and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle, cakes, bread and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth and sewing materials

loans.name: Zara

texts.fr: Zara a 30 ans et est mariée. Elle a en sa charge 5 enfants. Elle est née à Tchamba et vit à Lomé. En effet, pour aider au foyer, elle exerce comme activité la vente du jus et compte dans cette activité près de 10 ans. Elle achète les produits de fabrication au grand marché de Lomé et revient transformé en jus. Ensuite, elle revend les produits finis au marché hedzranawoe. Le crédit demandé permettra d’acheter les nécessaires de fabricatdu jus pour pouvoir faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Zara is 30 years old and married. She has five children in her care. She was born in Tchamba and lives in Lomé. In order to help the household she has a juice selling business and has nearly 10 years experience in this business. She buys her basic ingredients at the large market in Lomé and then transforms them into juice. Afterwards, she sells the finished product at the market in Hedzranawoe. The loan she has asked for will allow her to buy the necessary ingredients to make juice, so that she can face ever increasing demand.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making juice

loans.name: Jey Rolando

texts.es: Jey Rolando tiene 29 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, en donde elabora portones, puertas de hierro, verjas, soldaduras entre otras cosas. Tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad a su cargo pues se preocupa por proporcionarle lo necesario. El motivo del financiamiento es que la demanda se ha incrementado por lo que su capital es poco y tiene que comprar herramientas, protectores, soldador con cable. Sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio y además sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jey Rolando, age 29, provides soldering services in his shop.  He has had this business for over ten years.  He makes large doors, iron doors, gates, and soldering, among other things.  He has a two year old child under his care, and Jey Rolando worries about giving him the necessities.

The reason for the loan is that demand has increased, and he has little capital.  He has to buy tools, shields, and a soldering-iron with cable.

He dreams of getting ahead with his business and of getting his child ahead.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.es:
La señorita Svetlana es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en anticretico ya hace mucho tiempo, en una casa que está ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Svetlana es empleada de TOYOSA, vendiendo autos y realizando comercio exterior; además se dedica a elaborar documentos de transferencia y para esta segunda actividad  necesita una computadora.

El crédito lo utilizara justamente para la compra de una computadora. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Svetlana is single and does not have any children. She lives in an anticrético house (a special rental arrangement available in Bolivia) located in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

Svetlana is employed by Toyosa, selling cars and doing external business. She also creates assignment documents and needs a computer for this second job.

She will use the loan to buy a computer because this is how she obtains her household income.

This is her first loan and the socioeconomic analysis completed qualifies her to be able to receive a loan.

loans.use: To purchase a computer to prepare assignment documents, which is her second job.

loans.name: Ruth Vanessa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Vanessa; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de fruta, ella vende en el mercado de San Sebastian, ella atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas como manzanas, uvas, platanos, naranjas entre otras frutas.                             

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “SUMAC WATA” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Ruth Vanessa.  She is 26 years of age and lives with her partner and child.  The associate alternates her daily activities with the fruit sale business.  She sells in the market of San Sebastian, where she attends her stall from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM.  The associate wants to expand and improve her fruit sale business.  She requests a loan to buy fruits such as apples, grapes, plantains, and oranges, among other fruits.  

The associate is happy to receive the loan and she promises to comply with the payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy fruit to resell, such as apples, grapes, plantains, and oranges

loans.name: Silvia Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia L. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Paccha, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza encerrando un ambiente de paz, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en un taller de latonería (arreglo de latas de vehículos), no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Silvia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también a la cría de animales como: pollos y cerdos a los cuales los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 7 años, tiempo el cual ha logrado consolidar muchas amistades, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Silvia L. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Floreciendo [Women Blooming]. She lives in the community of Paccha, characterized by nature's beauty encircling an environment of peace. Its people raise animals and work in agriculture.

This member is 27 years old, married, and has two children, nine and seven years old, who study in a city school. Her husband works in an autobody shop fixing cars. They do not have their own home, so they lease.

Silvia tends to her household chores and also raises animals like chickens and pigs, which she sells in her own community.
 
She has been in the communal bank for seven years, in which time she has formed many friendships. She will invest the loan in the purchase of chickens and feed. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en: Jenilyn T. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Jenilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jenilyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. Jenilyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Jenilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jenilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jenilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Тешаева Бунафша проживает в районе Яван. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. Сама Бунафша имеет среднее образование. Она предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В основном она покупает разные ткани и шьет национальные платья для молодых девушек на праздник "Навруз" (праздник весны). Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Bunafsha T. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband earns a living by doing for-hire construction work.  Bunafsha has a secondary education.  She provides a service by sewing national dresses.  She primarily buys various fabrics and makes national dresses for young women for the Navruz holiday (holiday of the spring).  She has been involved in this type of business for five years.  Bunafsha is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is a single mother with seven children. She sells fabrics in Kokowada near Elmina, a trade she has been in for the past six years. 

Given that she is solely responsible for providing for her family, she wants to boost her earnings. The loan will allow her to purchase more fabrics for sale. She intends to reinvest the earnings to grow her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for sale

loans.name: Rukundo

texts.en: R. is 47 years old. He has four children between the ages of 7 months and 18 years. He sells green bananas and has done so for three years. This has helped him to feed and look after his family. R. is requesting a loan to buy more green bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas to sell

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité Pyapy Mbarete nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando la misma región.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, en total son 14 mujeres.
La Sra. Anatolia M., presidenta del grupo tiene 55 años, ella esta domiciliada en la ciudad de Capiatá, una ciudad cercana a San Lorenzo, es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora. Se la caracteriza por su buena predisposición y activación dentro del comité.
Ella es una señora muy humilde pero luchadora, cada día se esfuerza por obtener ingresos que puedan mantener a su familia, se dedica a realizar bordados artesanales, únicos en diseños y texturas.
Su clientela es numerosa pero desea poder aumentarla para así generar mayores ingresos que la ayuden a pasar una vejez tranquila y sin preocupaciones el día de mañana.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar telas, hilos, bastidores y agujas, espera contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya.
Todas las miembros de este comité son luchadoras y merecen ser ayudadas por su dedicación y deseo de superar la pobreza en la que viven.
texts.en:
The Pyapy Mbarete committee developed from the effort and help of another committee that worked in the same region.  The present committee is from the City of San Lorenzo, and its principal object is the growth of each of its 14 women.

Anatolia, the group's president, is 55 years old and lives in the City of Capiata, near San Lorenzo. She is an enterprising and innovative woman, with a good predisposition and is very active within the committee.

Anatolia is a very humble but determined person. Each day she attempts to obtain income to maintain her family.  She does artisan embroidery that is unique in design and texture.  Anatolia's customers are numerous but she wants to increase the number to expand her income and give her a tranquil old age without future preoccupations.

Anatolia is requesting a loan to buy cloth, thread, stretchers, and needles. She hopes she can count on the help of investors from Kiva and the Fundacion Paraguaya.

All the committee members are striving and deserving of help for their dedication and desire to overcome the poverty in which they live.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH, THREAD, STRETCHERS, AND NEEDLES FOR EMBROIDERY

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn and sells her harvest to the market. She plans to use her loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. Emma works hard to support her family. She said that one of her priorities is her children's education.

Emma is 53 years old and married. She has three children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from the village of Imbatuhon, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Lilia is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like rice cake or "bibingka" in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like powdered rice, coconut milk & sugar. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like powdered rice, coconut milk & sugar.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her family. She is engaged in farming. She tills her land properly for growing rice and corn crops. Florentina sells her harvest at her town's market.

Florentina's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest with her loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Mr. Chean is a 25-year-old married man who makes a living by selling different types of clay pots in the province of Kompong Chhnang. He and wife have been operating this business since 2006 and earn around $6.75 a day to cover all their family expenses. Mr. Chean will be using his loan to purchase housing materials to mend their house. The couple is blessed with a young child who is not yet enrolled in school and is dependent on their income.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials for house repairs

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 43-year-old married mother of five children. Rehema runs a green grocery in Mariakani, Mombasa. She has been doing this business for the last three years. 

Rehema has been a KADET client and this marks her third loan to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges and avocados for resale. 

She hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her business. Her dream is to become prosperous and to be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges and avocados for resale.

loans.name: Yelba Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, reside doña  Yelba del Carmen, quien labora para la institución de Centro de Mujeres Ixchen desde hace dos años, como Ginecóloga, es casada con un hijo menor es por ellos que trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.
Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando la familia de doña  Yelba es ampliar su casa para la construcción de la habitación de su hijo,  cuenta con parte del dinero de la mejora, pero le hace falta para la compra de bloques, cemento, arena y piedrín es por eso que  se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito para poder terminar de  realizar dichas compras y así por medio de este mejoramiento le dará mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Yelba del Carmen lives in the city of Masaya.  She has been working as a gynecologist at the Ixchen Women's Center for two years.  She is married and has one dependent child for whom she works hard in order to provide him with what he needs.

One of the needs that Yelba's family has right now is the need to expand their home and build a bedroom for her son.  She has part of the money she needs to make this improvement but she needs more in order to buy blocks, cement, sand and gravel.  For this reason, she approached Ceprodel's offices to request a loan so that she can finish making her purchases and, through this improvement, provide her son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand and gravel

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito de 41 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Benito es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su casa.  También comercializa aves de corral.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y de alimento balanceados para sus aves de corral, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Benito es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y que sus hijos tengan algunas comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Benito, 41, lives with his family in his own home, which has only electrical service, located in the district of Tambogrande belonging to the department of Piura. The region is characterized by the farming and livestock business and handicrafts. 

Benito is in the farming business and has his own farmland where he grows limes and mangoes. Once his products are harvested he offers them for sale in the various markets of Piura, so as to obtain income for covering his household costs. He also sells poultry. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy fertilizers to improve his lands as well as his product, and commercial feed for his poultry, with the aim of selling them at a better price to the merchants, and thus improve financially. Benito is a father who would like things to get better for his family and for his children to have some conveniences at home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to improve his farmland and his crops.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn is a 34 year-old married who currently lives in the Reussey commune of Phnom Penh City.  She blessed with only child and still studying in the public school. She has no a life partner because she divorced from her husband she her kid was young.

To make a living, Mrs. Sorn always sells different kinds of product in the local market. Her goods are plastic products, fast foods, cooking ingredients, and soft drinks. From her business, she could be earned about $5 per day. Mrs. Sorn wishes to borrow in amount of $800 in the purpose to buy more necessary goods in order to expand her selling business. 

In the future, she will send a lovely kid to study at higher degree and repairing her old house.

loans.use: to buy more necessary goods in order to expand her selling business.

loans.name: Francisca Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Francisca es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la Fundación Espoir con los créditos. Tiene 63 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y aún viven con ella.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida desde hace 12 años emprendió un pequeño negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda  en su casa, además de víveres también vende cosas de bazar, helados que algunas veces ella misma prepara o que compra en una fábrica de la localidad, allí trabaja todos los días, empezó con poco y que con el paso del tiempo la  ha ido mejorando y mucho mas después que empezó a  recibir los créditos ya que estos le han ayudado mucho.

Este crédito es para surtir aun mas su tienda, quiere comprar varios quintales de arroz y azúcar así como también bisutería y artículos de bazar.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud ya que esto es lo más importante.
texts.en:
The “Jaime Roldos” communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is famous for the beautiful beaches that bathe its coasts.  Most residents here are very hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

Francisca is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she gets from Fundación Espoir with the loans.  She’s 63 years old and her husband died several years ago but she has five children who are all adults now and still live with her.

To earn a living, our friend started a small business 12 years ago.  She has a small, home-based store where besides selling foodstuffs she also sells kitchenware and ice-cream that she makes herself or sometimes buys from a local factory.  She works there every day.  She started out with very little and in time has been improving it and even more so once she started to receive the loans which have been of great help to her.

This loan is to stock the store even more.  She wants to buy several quintals of rice and sugar as well as costume jewelry and kitchenware.  Her dreams are to continue making progress and to enjoy good health which is most important.

loans.use: to buy quintals of rice and sugar and to buy costume jewelry and kitchenware.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio de 44 años es casado y tiene 3 hijos, el cuenta con un pequeño taller de soldadura en su domicilio  desde hace 18 años siendo este negocio la única fuente de ingresos para el y su familia los trabajos mas comunes que el realiza son elaboración de protecciones, puertas metálicas, canceles y todo tipo de trabajo de herrería que le soliciten sus clientes. Antonio requiere el apoyo para compra de materiales para la elaboración de protecciones y puertas para las casas de interés social y salir a venderlas casa por casa.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 44 years old and married with three children.  He has had a small soldering workshop in his home for the last 18 years.  This business is his only source of income for him and his family.

The most common jobs he takes on are making protective barriers, metal gates, folding screens and all types of iron work that his customers request.

Antonio is requesting support for buying materials for making barriers and gates for the publicly subsidized housing, and which he will sell door to door.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear and children's clothes

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora tiene 35 años de edad es soltera vive con la familia y con los tres hijos de catorce, nueve y cinco años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos los productos para la alimentación de los cerdos los compra en  Comercial Murillo. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de cerdos, comprar la alimentación y vacuna para evitar que se mueran los cerdos.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar la alimentación y la vacuna para que el cerdo este en buenas condiciones y poder venderlo.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente son la competencia y los males. El sueño es poder apoyar a los hijos y darles para los estudios y que puedan culminarlos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is a single 35 year old mother of three - of ages 14, 9, and 5 - who lives with her family in the Ventanas Canton of Los Rios Province in Ecuador. 

The Luchar para Triunfar ["Fight to Win"] communal bank is located in the Poza sector of the 10 de Noviembre district of Ventanas. The members of the communal bank engage in various lines of work, ranging from agriculture to retail. 

María raises and sells hogs and she buys her feed at the Murillo shopping center. She is requesting this loan to buy hogs, feed, and vaccines so as to prevent the death of her hogs. This loan will be a great help to her by allowing her to buy feed and vaccines so that her hogs will be in good condition and ready for sale. 

The most frequent challenges facing her are competition and sickness. Her dream is to be able to support her children in their studies so they can graduate. In her free time she likes to listen to music and spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy hogs, feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Habitant dans une commune qui se trouve près de la ville de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Elle est commerçante et s'active dans la vente de fruits comme des mangues, des melons, des mandarines et d'autres fruits. Elle s'active dans la vente de fruits depuis plus de 5 ans, avec ce prêt, elle veut acheté des fruits dans les vergers et particulièrement des mangues pour les revendre. Ce crédit a pour but de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et d'avoir beaucoup de bénéfice afin d'acheter un champ pour avoir son verger et de ne plus se ravitaillé chez les autres.
texts.en: Fatou lives in a community near the city of Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She is a small shopkeeper, and has been selling fruits such as mangos, melons, tangerines and others for the past 5 years. She is asking for this loan in order to purchase larger quantities of fruits, notably mangos, in order to re-sell them in her community. This loan would allow her to have greater purchasing power and increase her profits. She hopes someday to purchase a plot of land and plant her own fruits to sell, rather than stocking up on fruits from other plots.

loans.use: purchase fruits

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida's primary source of income comes from raising hogs to breed and fatten for future sale. She has been raising hogs for almost five years. She usually earns an income of P2,000 for each hog she is able to sell. Zenaida sells her hogs to the butchers who come into her village. 

As of now, Zenaida has four pigs to raise. She is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines to ensure proper growth and nutrition. She wants to improve her hog selling business. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to enhance her business in order to earn enough money for the college education of her only child.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Gina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Ageuni Group

texts.en:
Christine is the facilitator of Ageuni group. Christine and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Christine and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Christine takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to have access to its low prices, to ensure food security for her family, and, later, to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Christine had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Christine was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Christine will educate her children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Ageuni group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land. 

In the picture the person standing on the far right is the field officer.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Diongoma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diongama  a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou. Il est composé de  22  femmes qui vivent dans le même quartier. Elles ont toutes comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame khady (debout à l’extrême droit emmitouflée d'une écharpe blanche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants

Elle est vendeuse de fruits et légumes au marché central de sa ville. Elle a une expérience très avancée dans ce domaine pour y avoir exercé depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en légumes auprès des villages pour la revente au marché.

Elle compte assurer la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Diongama group was formed on November 15, 2006 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois" of Kambeng Doumassou. It consists of 22 women who live in the same neighborhood. They each manage small shops.
