Khady (standing to the far right wrapped in a white scarf) is in charge of the group. She is 51-years-old. She is married and mother to five children. 

She sells fruits and vegetables at the central market of her town. She is very experienced in this field because she has worked in it for several years. 

With this new loan she plans to stock up on vegetables from the towns for reselling at the market. 

She plans to ensure the care of her children.

loans.use: to stock up on vegetables from the towns for reselling at the market

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, 36, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a farmer and motor taxi driver. Ry is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a new motorbike to operate as a motor taxi. In the future, she would like to expand her business of growing rice and support her children to study at a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Dan Michael

texts.en:
At the age of 19, and with two years of farming experience, Dan Michael dreams about having his own land to cultivate. He’s longing to work his own land because he aspires to increase his income, and have the working capital to continue farming. Thus he could help his whole family get ahead in life. He is enthusiastic to work for the sake of his family.

He is now asking for a loan amount of 8,000 pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. With the loan, he hopes to gain high rice production in the next crop, which will enable him to save for his studies, as well as to lift their poor living standard.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Lucy is married and has three children. To make a living, she is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community, such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many others. Lucy has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

Lucy is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2006, Lucy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma, aged 30, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business and a second hand clothes selling business. She sells her clothes from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing clothes at the market for resale. Rahma dreams of expanding and establishing a shop at the market to sell her products.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en: Genevie’s husband is a fisherman. With her greater effort to help her husband in their financial stability, she helps her husband in doing this livelihhod. They have been doing this for 3 years to provide the needs of their family. Thus, they have three children; they are 9, 8 and 6 years old. Genevie’s dream is to uplift their livelihood to have better means of living in the future. She also wants to have enough money to send her children to school and finished their degree. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, fishing weighs and plywood to repair their fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing weighs and plywood to repair their fishing boat.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Mr. Rodríguez has 34 years dedicating to the car and truck repairs.

He likes his work very much.

He is applying for a loan of 1200.00 to buy electric equipment and tools.

His clients recommend him, and that’s why he has more clients.

He wants to expand his business and hire people, who needs to support their families. He would like to pay back in 12 months. Español

El Sr. Rodríguez tiene 34 años dedicándose a la reparación de autos y camiones. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo.

El Sr.Rodrigues solicita un crédito de 1,200 para comprar herramientas y equipo para reparar fallas eléctricas. A medida que más personas lo recomiendan, ha crecido el número de clientes que solicitan su servicio. El desea agrandar su taller y darle empleo a otras personas necesitadas para contribuir al desarrollo de otras familias. Está convencido que con un crédito podrá mejorar la economía de varias familias.

loans.use: buy tools

loans.name: Sessou

texts.en:
Sessou A. was born in 1957 in Anfoin. Widowed mother of four children, she is presently living in Aklakou where she has been in business for some twenty years. The sale of balls of cornmeal porridge is greatly appreciated by the people of her town. For that reason, they call her Mama Akumeto. She has plenty of experience in her work, but she became a widow at a young age and is solely responsible for her family.

She is asking for a loan of $950 so that she can maintain a constant stock of corn and be able to satisfy the demands of her clientele. This will allow her to increase her savings and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Madame A. Sessou est née en 1957 a Anfoin. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle vit actuellement à Aklakou où elle fait ses activités depuis une vingtaine d’années. La vente des boules de pâte est appréciée par la population locale. C’est pour cela que Madame A. Sessou porte le nom de maman « AKUMETO ». Elle possède assez d’expériences en la matière et cernent tous les rouages de son activité. Très tôt, elle est devenue veuve et tout le poids de la famille repose sur elle seule.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite ce crédit de $950 pour faire un stockage consistant de maïs afin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ainsi, pourra t-elle augmenter sa capacité d’épargne et améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: purchase and warehousing of corn  (Achat et stockage de maïs)

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Ms. Juana was born in Monterrey. She is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. One daughter, just eight years old, has serious problems with her heart, and she will have surgery next August. This is the reason that Juana needed to start working, helping her husband in the business of selling snacks.

Juana is requesting this loan of $475.00 to purchase more products, so that she can earn more money. She wants to make her family life better and help her husband. You can help this family, and they will appreciate your help. You can make the difference.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business to include clothing sales

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet N. is a 52 year old widow and mother of 10 children who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells a variety of different types of clothes, shoes and bags. She has 24 years' experience in her business and has been a LAPO client for 3 years. She hopes to expand her business with above loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags & provisions

loans.name: Celeste Celestino

texts.pt:
Celeste Celestino T. lives with her husband and is mother to 5 children. She lives in the Mahotas neighborhood of Maputo. She raises and sells poultry. She also sells plastic kitchenware and various household basics from her home. She began the loan program in February 2007 with a loan of 6,000 MT [meticals, the currency of Mozambique]. She is now on her third loan cycle and is seeking 18,000 MT to pay over a 6 month period. Her business is growing. In previous loan cycles she raised 400 chicks and now intends to raise 700.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Celeste Celestino T. vive maritalmentee é mãe de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro Mahotas em Maputo. Cria e vende frangos, vende loiça plástica e diversos produtos de 1ºnecessidade na sua residência. Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro de 2007 com 6.000MT como primeiro empréstimo.Vai no 3ºciclo e vai tomar 18.000MT em 6 meses. O negócio tem estado a crescer: no ciclo anterior a cliente criava de cada vez 400 pintos e agora pretende criar 700 pintos.

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina is a young 21 year old entrepreneur and her whole family has always worked in the sale of wool, a business that thanks to the sacrifice she has put into the business they began, little by little, to make it a profitable one, to the point where they have established themselves as a reliable business in the local area where they live. This hard-working family has to travel extensively collecting the raw materials, and thanks to this traveling they are able to satisfy a fair share of customer demand where they live. This is why they are asking for a loan: they will increase their income and improve their financial situation business, and will use the profits to pay for higher education for the youngest members of the family. Your loan will be wisely spent in this family.

Toda la familia de Luz Marina, joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, siempre se dedicó a la comercialización de lana, negocio que a fuerza de mucho sacrificio y empeño poco a poco fueron sacando adelante, y que ahora los ha convertido en los comerciantes más solicitados en su campo laboral, permitiéndoles así cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de su hogar.Esta empeñosa familia recorre varias horas en su pequeña movilidad con el fin de juntar la cantidad necesaria de esta mercadería para su comercialización; gracias a su empeño y diligencia van albergando una gran variedad de pedidos y es por esa razón que solicitan un préstamo que les permitirá incrementar y mejorar su situación económica y sobre todo ofrecerles estudios superiores a los dos miembros más pequeños de su familia.Tu préstamo será una inversión sabia en las manos de esta familia.

loans.use:
Purchase of a greater quantity and variety of wool to consolidate the small business of its sale.

Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de lana para consolidar el pequeño negocio de comercialización.

loans.name: Neyza

texts.es:
Neyza started taking care of her neighbors' children because they work and don't have anyone to leave their children with. She started since she moved to the neighborhood where she is living now, one year ago. In the beginning she took care of 3 children, and her business has been growing so now she takes care of 10 children.

Thanks to her effort, her business promises to increase because it is the only daycare service in her neighborhood. Neyza would like to set up her house better to be able to better take care of the children, and because of this she is requesting a loan for US $925 which she is determined to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money, Neyza will be able to buy toys and educational materials for the children. With your help, Neyza will be able to help the working mothers who have nobody to watch their children, and at the same time help Neyza establish well her daycare.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Neyza inició cuidando niños de sus vecinas ya que trabajan y no tiene con quien dejar a sus hijos. Empezó desde que se cambio a la colonia donde actualmente vive desde hace 1 año, al principio cuidaba 3 niños, su negocio ha ido creciendo hasta completar 10 niños actualmente.

Gracias a su esfuerzo, su negocio promete ir incrementándose porque es la única guardería de su Colonia, Neyza desea acondicionar mejor su casa para poder ofrecerles un mejor cuidado a los niños es por tal motivo que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero Neyza podrá comprar juguetes y material didáctico de entretenimiento para los niños. Con tu ayuda Neyza podrá ayudar a las madres que trabajan y no tienen con quién dejar a sus hijos, y al mismo tiempo ayudar a Neyza a crecer su guardería y poder establecerse.

loans.use: Buying toys and setting up a space for children (Comprar juguetes y acondicionar un espacio para los niños)

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
This is the fourh year that Mrs. Cao Thi H., 29 years old, is a member of TYM Fund (Kiva's partner). She lives with her husband and two children in Quang Xuong District, Thanh Hoa Province. Since her two children are still small, Mrs. H. lives at home to breed animals and do farming. Her main family income is from her small motorbike repair shop. Mr. Thanh, her husband is the main mechanic, and she helps out with the job. Most of Vietnamese population use motorbikes, so her job at the repair shop brings a pretty steady income to her family. Each month they earn about 100USD. In order to increase their income, she needs to have more inventories at hand. That is why she applies for a loan of 525 USD to buy more motorbike parts. Mrs. H. hopes to increase their family income to 125-150 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by PH. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị Hương, 29 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Do hai con còn nhỏ nên chị Hương ở nhà chăn nuôi và làm ruộng. Nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị Hương là từ cửa hàng sửa chữa xe máy. Anh Thanh, chồng chị là người sửa chữa chính còn chị là người phụ giúp. Hiện nay việc đi lại bằng xe máy đã phổ biến nên việc sửa chữa, bảo dưỡng xe mang lại cho gia đình một khoản thu nhập tương đối ổn định. Thu nhập từ cửa hàng một tháng khoảng 100USD. Để nâng cao thu nhập cần có nhiều phụ tùng sửa chữa, thay thế khi khách hàng cần nên đến vòng vốn này chị Hương đã xin vay 525USD để mua thêm phụ tùng. Chị hy vọng sẽ nâng thu nhập lên mức 125-150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy motorbike parts

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
The buying and selling of american apparel has been a good business and has provided a good income for Señora Evangelina who's a hard-working and dedicated mother. She's always worked hard to make sure that her family, composed of 4 kids and her husband, is well-taken care of.

She's from the district of Pucara and decided to move to the city of Juliaca about 25 years ago. She began by selling snacks and sweets and drinks from door to door, but the money was not enough to help her husband to take care of the family's expenses and foremost the children's school expenses. This is why she decided to start a business selling used clothing. Thanks to her perseverance and good luck, the business is running very well. Doña Evangelina would like to expand her business and increase her inventory. She hopes you can help her in achieving her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de ropas americanas se ha convertido en el ingreso económico indispensable de la señora Evangelina, madre muy laboriosa y empeñosa que siempre luchó por sacar adelante a su familia, integrada por su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella es natural del distrito de Pucará y decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 25 años, en un principio vendiendo golosinas, galletas y una inmensa variedad de bebidas en forma ambulatoria, pero las ganancias que obtenía por este negocio no eran suficientes para mantener y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, y principalmente con la educación de sus queridos hijos, por esa razón decidió probar suerte en el negocio de comercialización de ropas de segundo uso, gracias a su perseverancia y a su buena disposición para el negocio le va resultando muy rentable, el deseo de doña Evangelina es crecer y ampliar su negocio, con ese propósito recurre a tu persona y a tu buen corazón.

loans.use: To increase inventory of used clothes

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is the mother of six children. She travels throughout Ghana purchasing items such as palm fruits and meats and resells them to local providers in Kumasi. In addition to the cost of the products, she incurs considerable expense traveling to such places as Tamale in the Northern Region of Ghana. She will use the loan to help with transport costs and to purchase additional products. She also hopes to use her profits to help pay for her eldest daughter’s fees at the local polytechnic institute.

Comfort is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (God’s Hand Is in It). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

On the day of the photo, Comfort was meeting with other members of her trust group. Consequently, she was unable to show us her products.

loans.use: To help with transport costs for her products

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat R. lives in the Gissar region. She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has secondary education. Saodat is in the business of sewing custom dresses. In addition, she creates women's clothing and sells it on a market. Saodat's main customers are her neighbors.

Her husband is a construction worker, which is only a seasonal job. For this reason, her occupation is the main source of income for their family. Currently, Saodat is looking to purchase summer fabrics from wholesalers. Since she doesn't have enough funds to cover the purchase, she decided to take out a loan. She plans to pay off the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Расулова Саодат проживает в районе Гиссар .Возраст 27 лет, замужем , имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Саодат портниха , она шьет на заказ национальную одежду. Так же она шьет женскую одежду и реализует ее на рынке.Основными покупателями Саодат являются ее соседи. Муж клиентки строитель ,работа сезонная. Поэтому ее бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. В данный момент Саодат хочет закупить летнюю ткань у оптовых поставщиков. Своих денег у ней не хватает и она решила взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Abam

texts.en:
E. was born in 1949. He is married and a father of four children who are all above the age of 15. Despite being born into poverty, lacking education, and losing his parents at an early age, Emmanual aims to become a very rich man and give his children the good education they need to get ahead.	
       E. became a member of GHAPE in 2006 and has successfully repaid two loans. He invested his loans to sell maize and bought a maize mill which produces flour.

E. started farming crops in 1975, and recently starteed buying and renting a few houses around his neighborhood. In the two years since joining GHAPE, he has dramatically increased his fortunes. His first loan helped him to buy his first corn mill (which costs about 350,000 CFA or $875), and the second loan from Kiva, together with his profits from previous business, helped him to buy his second corn mill. Corn mills are in demand in every community around Bamenda, as corn is sold in kernels and every person must take their corn to be milled before they can prepare “corn fufu” – a local favorite. 

I asked E. how he is able to farm and operate mills in two locations, and like a modern-day businessman, he operates from a distance. He pays the rent for two shops in two busy markets and hires two young men to operate the mills. With the two mills now operating, he says he is able to earn as much as 100,000 CFA ($250) per month. 

His profits from the mills have allowed him to expand his business activities into livestock. Since starting the second mill, he has been able to purchase three piglets and two cattle. His dream for the future is to start a full cattle farm. He says that he already has enough land for a herd of fifty cattle, and he has recently obtained two required grazing permits. A future loan will enable him to begin to build his herd.

E.’s income allows him and his wife, a civil servant working with the government, to give their four children an enviable education. His eldest is studying in a university in France, made possible in part by a scholarship. Two others are in university in Cameroon. And the youngest is in secondary school. Between the four, E. and his wife pay over 500,000 CFA ($1,250) in annual school fees and expenses. 

E. says that without his new business ventures, he and his wife would really be struggling with the expense of providing their children with such an income. Thus, he is very grateful to those who have financed his loan: “It is a pleasure to learn that so many around the world are contributing to my family’s wellbeing,” he says, “and we send them our thanks.”

He plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy a corn mill

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda F. is single and lives with her parents, who also help with her business and attending to her clients. The business has a good location in a highly commercial zone and her general store is one of the most known businesses in the center of Asunción.

It is located at Palma street at Ayola Street, on a busy thoroughfare visited mostly by tourists. She began with approximately 3,000,000 guaranies ($775 USD) in capital, which has increased over time since she has a broad client base given that where the store is located is very populated and busy.

Nilda is withdrawing the loan to buy various items such as various models of silver jewelry and women’s clothing for the fall and winter months.

Some of Nilda’s aspirations are for her business to grow, in terms of equipment or furniture for their future company imports, to distribute clothing and shoes, to offer more jobs, and to offer an environment more comfortable and pleasant for her customers.

loans.use: to buy  various models of silver jewelry and women’s clothing for the fall and winter months

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Mrs. Kolab L. is a villager in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Vy Penh, is a fisherman.

The couple can generate a small income to support their family. Now Mr. Vy Penh’s business cannot run because his boat is too old. In order to start his business again, Mrs. Kolab L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat for her husband's business.

Mrs. Kolab L. is a 27-year-old married mother. She has one child who is too young to work or attend school. Mrs. Kolab L. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new boat for her husband's business.

loans.name: Janneth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Janneth del Socorro R. S. is 34 years old and a widow. She has three children. Fernando Salvador R. is 18 years old and in his first year of university, earning a degree in hotel administration and hospitality. Karen Vanesa is 16 years old and in her third year of high school. Stacy Janeth Lopez R. is 13 years old and in her first year of high school.

Janeth would like to finish her beauty school so that she can educate children from low-income families. The business that Janeth now manages is located on Rigoberto Lopez Perez, Radio Morena 1 1/2c. and offers technical classes in cosmetology and hair styling. Janneth has 15 years of experience as a stylist and 4 years as an instructor. She started this business because there were no beauty academies in her area and the organizations that did offer beauty instruction were not accredited. Janneth would like to use a loan to improve her establishment and pay more attention to her clients. Janneth says that all of her loans have benefited her, including helping her sell products like straighteners, dyes, perms, and manicures.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

su nombre es janneth del socorro R. S. su edad es de 34 años de edad su estado civil es viuda, tiene 3 hijos los cules son:fernando salvador R. de 18 años que cursa 1 año de administracion turistica y hotelera, karen vanesa de 16 años cursa el 3 año de bachillerato, stacy janeth lopez R. de 13 años cursa el 1 año de bachillerato. su estado civil es soltera no tiene conyugue,su sueño es de terminar su academia de belleza para poder preparar jovenes del sector mas vulnerable.el negocio que ella posee es enseñanza tecnica en belleza y estilismo este se encuentra ubicado en el reparto Rigoberto Lopez perez, radio morena1 1/2c. al sur el tiempo que ella tiene de tener su negocio es de 15 años como estilista y 4 años de instructora. ella empezo este negocio porque cuando inicio no habia academia de belleza y la que se encontraba no estaba acreditada. ella piensa usar el financiamineto para mejorar el establecimiento y asi poder brindar una mejor atencion a su clientela. ella dice que a todos sus creditos ha logrado darle buenos provechos,lo que mas logra vender ella es todos los productos para cabello alisado,tinte, permanente y maniquiur.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Kwamina

texts.en: Kwamina S. is married and has three children. He has a Junior High level education. Kwamina sells fishing items at Ayesa in Elmina, which he has done since 2000. His wife is a trader. Kwamina uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and other utility bills. Kwamina will use the loan to purchase more fishing materials like nets, hooks, twain, floats, and other items. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwamina plans to save towards a family house that he wants to build with his wife.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Salama's Group

texts.en:
Salama has been selling charcoal in Zanzibar for three years. Charcoal is the primary fuel used for cooking food in Tanzania, as most people do not own an oven or stove. Food items from rice to cakes to octopus are cooked over charcoal. Salama is currently able to earn approximately 10 USD each month selling this fuel. She is looking forward to receiving her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can increase her inventory and sell a greater quantity of charcoal. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her profit.

Salama is 44 years old, married, and has one 23-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Time, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sogbossi

texts.fr: Née vers les années 1963 à Dogbo dans le département du Couffo, dame F. Sogbossi est mariée à TOSSOU Codjo soudeur de profession. Mère de 04 enfants dont 03 sont scolarisés et un en apprentissage. Elle exerce la vente des céréales depuis 20 ans et aide son mari par les revenus générés par la vente. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite auprès de notre institution un crédit de 180000.
texts.en:
Born around 1963 in Dogbo, in Couffo County, Ms. Sogbossi F. est married to Codjo TOSSOU, a welder by trade. She is a mother with four children, of whom three are in school and one is in an apprenticeship. She has been selling grain for twenty years and assists her husband by the income from her sales. To bolster her business, she is requesting from our institution a loan of 180,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To by sacks of staple foods and some containers of palm wine

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.en:
"Nueva Esperanza" is a group of 20 women from an extremely poor area in the Dominican Republic. In this particular loan, there are 11 women hoping to receive a loan to either start a business or increase the size of their existing small business. The businesses in this group range from clothing stands and beauty salons to small food stands. The one thing that all the women have in common is they are all striving to change their lives and break loose from their poverty.

Teodora D. L. S. is the representative of this group, and is a hardworking mother of four children. She has a very small business selling clothing in her neighborhood. She takes a bus each month to a city called Santiago which is a few hours away, and there she buys all her used clothing for her business. Santiago has the cheapest clothing but it is far away and difficult for her to make the trip. She has been profitable with her first couple loans and is finally at the point where she can save a little money for the future. She is hoping to take this next loan and increase her inventory and hopefully increase her income. She is saving to try and send her children to a university one day and knows that education is something that might help her children break out of this poverty. She is so happy with the way her business is going and hopes to keep on increasing in size. For once she feels like a provider and a person with purpose! She is going to continue working hard to reach her dreams!

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Pien Horm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of nine members, is located in Tropang Tonlorb village in Kampong Chhnang province.  They plan to use this loan for a variety of purposes.  Mrs. Pien H. is the village bank president whom has been selected by the members.  She is a chicken middleman whom buys chickens to re-sell.  In this business, she still does not earn enough income to support her household.  In order to improve her living, she decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start breeding pigs.  Mrs. Pien H. is a 34-year-old widow with a child that helps the mother's business. 

Seven members in this group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans.  Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on their loans until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start making payments several months before the end of their loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three piglets to start breeding pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en casa de su padre en la calle Munaypata de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separada del esposo y tiene una niña de 12 años de edad, que vive con ella.  La actividad que realiza es la venta de juguetes, tiene un puesto en su propia casa pero además tiene un puesto de venta en la calle Uyustus lugar donde se realizan ferias los días miércoles, sábados y domingos.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar más juguetes, aumentar su capital y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir manteniendo a su familia.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito de Impro y en análisis de su flujo de caja y el carácter emprendedor de  su  actividad la califican para obtener dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her father's house on Munaypata Street, in the community of "14 de septiembre" and in the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and she has a 12 year old daughter who lives with her. She makes a living by selling toys. She has a stand that she operates out of her home and another on Uyustus Street where there are bazars on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy more toys and to increase her business' capital. This way she will be able to improve her earnings and continue supporting her family.

This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from Impro. She has been approved for this loan based on the history of her business' profits and her work ethic.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Toys to Sell

loans.name: Sanabar

texts.en:
T. Sanabar is 46 years old. She works purchasing and reselling cows with her children. She has five children.

Sanabar would like to request a loan of $1000 USD for a term of 12 months in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase her income further. She plans to use the increased income to fund her children’s education. You could become an important part in Sanabar family's life, and she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is one of the poorer of the 15 former Soviet republics, with a GDP per capita of less than $600. The civil war, which took place soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., severely damaged the already weak economic infrastructure and caused a sharp decline in agricultural production and the manufacturing sector. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. All of these factors have resulted in a severe lack of jobs and have forced hundreds of thousands to leave Tajikistan to find work in other countries, mostly in Russia. While Tajikistan has experienced some economic growth since the end of the Civil War, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON International's mission is to promote sustainable economic development and improved quality of life in Tajikistan by insuring reliable access to financial services for the economically active members of the population. IMON International has 8 branch offices throughout Tajikistan, and its entrepreneurs work in many parts of the country's economic sector, including trade, manufacturing, agriculture, and services. As of October 2008, IMON International had 27,802 active clients and a total portfolio of $28,405,549. Approximately 44% of these clients are women and 65% are from rural areas. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase the cattle to expand her business.

loans.name: Sopey Naby Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/villages.php?val=2

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui ont été formées pour la transformation des fruits et légumes. C'est pour cela que nous venons solliciter un financement auprès de Kiva pour pouvoir acheter beaucoup un grand nombre de produits de première nécessité( fruits légumes et bocal, produits de consevation)pour en disposer d'un stock qui nous permettra de vendre sans discontinuer durant toute l'année. Cette activité nous permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de nos familles et permet ainsi la création d'emploi pour les jeunes filles du village.
texts.en:
We are a group of women trained to transform fruits and vegetables. We are seeking a loan from Kiva to purchase large quantities of products (fruits, vegetables, glass jars, and preservatives) to constitute a stock that will enable us to sell without interruption throughout the year. This business will enable us to provide for our families, and will also create jobs for the young women of the village.

http://sem-fund.org/villages.php?val=2

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for home canning

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
La señora Lastenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en el Jr. Los Laureles Mza. E – Lt. 12, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 55 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos independientes.

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 motivada por su hija y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendieron su negocio. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. En la actualidad se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y carteras, que los ofrece a los moradores de la comunidad, clientes conocidos.

Con el préstamo de S/1,200.00 cancelara en 06 meses, desea invertir comprando telas en algodón; para confeccionar ropas interiores en tallas y modelos para damas y caballeros, también hilos, blondas, elásticos y materiales para cartera, para así satisfacer los pedidos de su clientela.

Ambos; su esposo y ella, toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, nos cuenta que también desea implementar su negocio con un taller mas grande y establecido.

Lastenia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Señora Lastenia is a member of the Manos Unidas Communal Bank. She lives at Mza. E-Lt. 12 Las Laureles Jr. in the Banda de Shilcayo district, in the region of San Martín. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of 3 grown children, all of whom are independent. Lastenia has been a member of her communal bank for 4 years. She first launched her business, on the urging of her daughter and with her husband's support, with a loan of 300 soles. Today, she makes and sells items of clothing and wallets, which she sells to her regular customers among the community's residents. With this loan of 1,200 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy cotton cloth which she will use to make undergarments in all different sizes and styles for both women and men. She will also buy thread, lace, elastic, and the materials she needs to make wallets. With these supplies, she will be able to meet her clients' demand for her products. Lastenia and her husband make the decisions concerning this business together and are working towards having a larger and more established shop. Lastenia is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their help, which has allowed her to grow both as a business woman and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, lace, thread, elastic and suppllies to make wallets.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La Sra. Delfina T. se encuentra separada de su esposo y vive en la casa de su hijo a quien le paga alquiler, se dedica a la venta de frazadas desde hace 20 años y tambien es albañil pintor en una empresa constructora en la cual tiene clientes a quienes reparte su mercadería.
Ella trabajo con grupo solidario estrella en 7  secuencias, individualizándose el año 2008 solicitando crédito con garante personal, la señora es persona responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Delfina T. is separated from her husband. She lives in her son’s house, and she pays him rent. She has been selling blankets for 20 years. She also is painter for a construction company. She has customers in the company who distribute her merchandise. She worked with the Solidario Estrella group for 7 loan cycles. She started working on her own in 2008. She is asking for a loan, which she personally guarantees. She is a very responsible person about her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blankets and quilts

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr:
G. Philomène est née vers 1959 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Philomène est originaire d'Abomey dans le Département du Zou. Philomène est mariée à AGLAN Daniel, transitaire au Port Autonome de Cotonou. Philomène est mère de trois enfants dont deux filles et un garçon tous scolarisés. L'aîné du nom Germain est en cinquième année du lycée et la benjamine appelée Colette en cinquième année du cours primaire. Philomène vend des glacières, des plats, des fourchettes, des savons et des bois de chauffage. Philomène a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé. Philomène a bien remboursé ses crédits et sollicite un quatrième crédit pour constituer un stock important de bois de chauffage. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
G. Philomène was born around 1959 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She traces her roots Abomey, in Zou County. She is married to AGLAN Daniel, a shipping agent at the autonomous port of Cotonou. She is the mother of three children (2 girls and 1 boy) who are all in school. The eldest, named Germain, is in his fifth year of secondary school; and the youngest, named Colette, is in her fifth year of primary school.

Philomène sells insulated containers, plates, forks, soaps, and firewood. She has already had three Alidé loans and has repaid them. She’s requesting a fourth loan to build up a major stock of firewood.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three truck-loads of firewood, coolers, plates, and soap

loans.name: Carolino

texts.en:
Mr. Carolino R. is fifty years old and married with six children. He lives in Labuyo, Tangub City. Four of his children are married with their own families and the other two are dependents attending school. 

Carolino has a chemical wholesale and repackaging business – he works with hypochloric acid and chlorine. His wife assists in repackaging. They started the business with an initial capital of just $17. They have recently started another line of business selling garlic and onions. They have many loyal customers and friends, and their distribution area is expanding. 

Carolino was interested in joining the Kiva Partner, PAGLAUM MPC, for more than just access to loans – he also values the motivation to save that they inspire in their members.  He is applying for a loan in order to add to his capital for both of his businesses. He hopes to send his children to college and renovate his house in the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for both businesses

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Lopéz formed this committee. The group is made up of 17 participants. One participant is Mrs. Ninfa C. who is 27 years old and has one son that stays with his grandmother while his mother works selling medicinal remedies in the Lambare zone. She purchases her merchandise in Market 4 in Asunción and then sells it in order to gain a profit to pay her living expenses. She has a small house made of pieces of wood and cardboard.

1 Carmen Lopéz de T.- Cleaning product sales 2 Ninfa E. C. M.- Medicine sales 3 Lorena M.D..- Food sales 4 Blanca L.I. C.- Used clothing sales 5 Sirley F. C. C.- Cleaning product sales 6 Gloria R.M. deC. - Cleaning product sales 7 Miguela S. R.- Empanada sales 8 Gladis G. Aranda de L.- Fruit sales 9 Felicia R. D..- Clothing sales 10 Alberta B. P - Recycling 11 Margarita V. L.- Beverage sales 12 Cirila R. de L.- Smalll grocery sales 13 Teresa D. R. P.- Food sales 14 Maria Z. C..- Lottery ticket sales 15 Lourdes P. G. S.- Dressmaker 16 Maria C. S. E.- Dressmaker 17 Lidia C..- Jewelry and accessories sales

loans.use: To buy cleaning products for resale

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар Намозов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Сафар более 6 лет занимавется животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Safar N. lives in the Rumy district. He is 28 years old, married and has no children. Safar has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. He feeds and sells cattle at a market. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and feed

loans.name: Blanca Nieves Group

texts.es:
La asociación Blanca Nieves pertenece al centro focal Villa Tejada, esta formado por doce mujeres, ellas trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace diez años. Varias son las actividades de este grupo, por ejemplo Virginia se dedica a la venta de cámaras fotográficas y relojes, Carmen  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida (hamburguesas y salchipapas), Lindaura vende colchas y sabanas, Encarnación vende desayunos, Catalina vende relojes.
Todas afirman que necesitan aumentar capital a sus negocios, desean comprar mercadería o insumos, con esto obtendrán mayores ganancias
texts.en:
The Snow White Association is a branch of Villa Tejada, and is made up of a dozen women who have worked together at Pro-Mujer for 10 years. The group is involved in a variety of activities: for example Virginia sells cameras and watches, Carmen makes and sells fast food, Lindaura sells mattresses and blankets, Encarnacion sells breakfast foods, and Catalina sells watches. All of them would like to increase their incomes, and want to buy more merchandise or raw materials to make that happen.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanesa trabaja en el Hotel Sucre ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz en el servicio de limpieza, por la noche esta estudiando en la universidad Publica El Alto; vive con su madre y sus dos hermanos menores, su domicilio esta ubicado en la  zona Brasil de la ciudad de el Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para comprar una impresora para la computadora que ella tiene, misma que le ayudará para poder facilitar sus trabajos que tiene   en la universidad.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Vanessa works on the housekeeping staff at the Hotel Sucre in the city of La Paz. At night, she attends classes at the public university in El Alto. She lives with her mother and two younger brothers in their home located in the Brasil district of El Alto.

Vanessa is requesting a loan to buy a printer to go along with the computer she already owns. This will help her with her college studies.

This is Vanessa’s second loan with IMPRO. Her excellent payment history enabled her to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a printer to help with her university studies

loans.name: Ruth Nohemi

texts.es: La Señorita Ruth González de 20 años de edad, habitante de la comarca San Rafael del municipio de villa del carmen departamento de Managua, soltera, vive con sus padres en casa propia, mujer emprendedora que tiene como objetivo ofrecerle lo mejor a sus padres, dentro de sus planes esta construir poco a poco su casa, de profesión secretaria actualmente trabaja en la alcaldía de villa del carmen desde hace ocho meses,  a encontrado dificultades en lo que es hija única y tiene la responsabilidad de su casa, poco ingreso económico y la falta de un financiamiento. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque y zinc para construir un anexo en la vivienda y brindarle seguridad y protección as u familia. Agradeciendo a la institución por el préstamo ya que esta en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Miss Ruth González, 20, single, lives in the San Rafael area in the city municipality of Carmen, department of Managua. She lives with her parents in their own house and is an enterprising woman who wants to offer the best for her parents. She plans to work on their house bit by bit and at her career as a secretary with the Carmen city hall, where she has worked for 8 months. Ruth has had difficulties as an only child, having responsibility for the home, little financial income and a lack of funding. With a loan from Afodenic, she will be able to buy construction materials, such as cement, iron, blocks and zinc to build an annex to the house, which will offer security and protection to her family. She will be very grateful to Afodenic for the loan to improve her conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to build an annex

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. She sells hardware and construction materials in a small store and has been in this business for five years. It is a family business and her husband is involved in it too. Olga decided to start this business because her family lacked money and today she makes enough to take care of the household.

Olga would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. Increased sales will help Olga to receive more profit and take better care of her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina L. is from the village of Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Avelina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Avelina makes and sells a variety of food products in the local community. Avelina has been in business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2,100 PHP a month.

In 2005, Avelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Avelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Geralda

texts.en:
Geralda is 50 year old single mother; her four children are between 20 and 30 years old. Two of her children go to school. She owns a three room house where she resides with three other people. Geralda takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no running water. 

Geralda works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala, to which she takes public transportation. She owns a stall selling rice. Geralda doesn't pay rent per se; rather, she pays daily market dues. She is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of rice and defaulters. Geralda sells to all categories of people and receives about 20 customers a day. She works seven days a week. Her monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family. 

She has been with MCDT for three years. This is her seventh loan with the same group mates. Geralda wants to use this loan to purchase more sacks of rice.

loans.use: purchasing more rice

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Efesios Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Efesios está integrado por Mayra F., Marveli J. y  Ángela de Jesús T.. La coordinadora del grupo es Mayra F. quien en un comienzo solamente prestaba su vehículo para traer pollo crudo del mercado pero luego con las ganancias empezó a vender ella. F. invertirá el crédito en la compra de pollo y su mayor deseo es llegar hacer una distribuidora de pollo.

Marveli J. por medio de su padre quien le regalo 5000 córdobas para que comenzara uno una pequeña venta la cual desea ver convertida en una pulpería. Ángela de Jesús T. Soza tiene una modesta venta con la cual se ayuda para criar a sus cuatro pequeños.
texts.en:
The Efesios village bank is made up of Mayra F., Marveli J. and Ángela de Jesús T.. Mayra F. is the group coordinator who first started by just loaning her vehicle to bring chicken meat from the market. With her earnings, however, she later started to sell it as well. Mayra will invest the loan to purchase chicken, and her greatest wish is to become a chicken distributor.

By means of a gift of 5000 córdobas from her father, Marveli J. started a small shop that she'd like to see become a grocery store. Ángela de Jesús T. has a modest shop which helps her to raise her four children.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicken

loans.name: Celidonia

texts.es:
La señora Celidonia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ankara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, vive en la comunidad de Cahuaya, estudio educación secundaria incompleta.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi un año y su préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado  ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, préstamo que dice lo utilizara comprando ganado ovino para engorde, para luego venderlo en las ferias zonales.

Su mayor deseo es poder educar a su niño y continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las charlas y los encuentros
texts.en:
Sra. Celidonia is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank which is located in the community of Ankara, Ilave Disrict, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 19 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Celidonia lives in the community of Cahuaya and was not able to complete her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost a year. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to increase her business capital for buying and selling sheep.

Celidonia is requesting a new loan of 600 soles to buy additional sheep for fattening. She will sell the animals later at the regional fairs. Her greatest wish is to provide her child with an education and continue working. She enjoys her savings, the seminars, and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela A. is from the village of Inroad located in Aurora, a municipality of Zamboanga Del Sur province, Western Mindanao. She is 58 years old, married and has six adult children. Fidela is a tailor who repairs and sells clothes to local businesses and community members. She has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Fidela joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her fourth from GDMPC, of 6,000 PHP to be used to buy materials to increase her range of inventory. Fidela successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she used to purchase materials to create additional inventory. She plans to use all additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family’s living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anchor Group

texts.en: Gifty is 43 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. She trades in textiles and other materials. Gifty is the leader of a trust bank group called Anchor. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford. Gifty, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Shodi

texts.ru: Шоди Хамидов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 23 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Шоди имеет высшее образование экономиста. Он имеет собственный магазин, в котором занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Shodi H. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 23 years old, married and has 2 children. Shodi has higher education in economics. He owns a store where he is involved in retail sales. Shodi primarily sells food products. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Perez es propietario de una pulpería en el municipio de Telica en el departamento de León donde vende todo tipo de productos tales como arroz, aceite, golosinas, meneítos, entre otros. También vende cosméticos como pinturas de uñas, perfumes, colonias, cremas, desodorantes y más. 
El negocio tiene ocho años de existir y lo ha logrado mantener ya que por medio de este obtiene los ingresos para el hogar. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de comestibles y para la compra de cosméticos para la pulpería. Por esta razón espera que dicho crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y de esta forma logrará vender sus productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos Perez is the proprietor of a small grocery store in the municipality of Telica in the department of León where he sells all types of products such as rice, oil, sweets and chips, among others. He also sells cosmetics like nail polish, perfumes, colognes, creams, deodorants, and more.

The business has existed for eight years, and Carlos has succeeded in sticking with it because it allows him to earn income for his household. For this reason he hopes that the loan is granted. In this way he will succeed in selling his products to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy corn and manioc flour for resale

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Eugenio Ramón O. S.. Es comerciante desde hace cincuenta años desempeñándose como joyero profesional en el sector joyerías del mercado bisne. 

El señor O. es casado tiene tres hijos solo una vive con el por qué es minusválida. el crédito otorgado lo utilizara para compra de materia prima, para cubrir unos encargos que le solicitan sus clientes. El señor O. inicio a trabajar con Ceprodel desde que inicio en el mercado el bisne.
texts.en:
Eugenio Ramón O. S. has been a merchant for 50 years; he has been a professional jeweler in the jewelry section of the El Bisne market. Mr. O. is married and has three children; only one of whom still lives with him because she is disabled. He will use the loan to buy raw materials to fill some orders he has from customers. Mr. O. has been collaborating with CEPRODEL since he started in the El Bisne market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N. est une femme de 52 ans , elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle y a bénéficié de 17 crédits qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique à domicile et son prêt lui permettra de la renforcer en marchandises. Elle y vend du riz, du mil, du sucre, de l'huile etc.. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady N. is 52 years old, married and mother of 10 children. She has been a member of the THILMAKHA “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past 8 ½ years, and has been granted 17 previous loans, all reimbursed without problems. She runs a home-based shop selling rice, millet, sugar, vegetable oil, etc., and her loan will allow her to restock her merchandise. She participates in the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her business activity

loans.name: Maximo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Maximo B. es originario del poblado de Quezalguaque en Telica y por mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la actividad ganadera que es con la que obtiene el capital para el sustento de su hogar para beneficio de su familia.

Actualmente ha atravesado la necesidad de mejorar en la actividad y para ello requiere la compra del ganado para proceder a su crianza y luego extraer la leche o comercializar dicho ganado. Es por esta razón que espera que su crédito sea otorgado de manera inmediata y así comprar dicho ganado para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
This customer is a native of the village of Quezalguaque, working in the Rubén Darío institute as a caretaker. She is a single mother and is economically supported by her children who also work and live together with her in the same house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima sells colorful clothes at retail prices. Her customers are mostly young ladies and married women. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. 

She hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more clothes to sell. 

She is 28 years old and married with two children. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy. Her husband also works to support their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with six children. Some of her children go to school and the rest are working. She rents a two-room house where she stays with eight people. She has one granddaughter. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Helen takes care of additional family members. Helen had an accident and can’t walk easily.  

The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication. Her husband is a peasant farmer in Naguru. Helen owns a retail shop selling sugar, beer and soap and works seven days a week. She rents the shop where she operates. Helen receives at least 10 customers a day and her customers are mainly women and children. She sells at retail. Besides this retail shop business, Helen also sells fried cassava chips and pancakes.  Helen has been in this business for some years and her business challenges include thieves, seasonality and competition. Helen has been with MCDT for many years, servicing her 11th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, more bunches of sweet bananas and crates of beer. She hopes to see her business grow bigger, build her own house and educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, sweet bananas and soap

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is a member of the María Auxiliadora community bank, which is comprised of eleven members, all hailing from the San Sebastian neighborhood of Cusco. Rosa is a 40-year-old mother of three children aged 20, 18, and 17. She lives with her spouse and children in Cusco. Rosa makes a living selling dry goods in one of Cusco’s main plaza markets. She will use the loan to buy more goods to sell so that she can increase her revenue from this business. Rosa is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Dry goods

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Sompiya, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce du bétail, du savon, du pain et le tricotage de la laine.
Ces femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du bétail, du savon kabakourouni, de l’arachide, de tissu et de la laine.
DJELIKA S. du groupe Benkadi compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des tissus et de la laine.
Elle s’approvisionne en tissus et laine avec les commerçants de Wakoro (commune du village de Sompiya) et effectue la vente de ses produits finis sur place et dans les environnants de Sompiya, au comptant, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married and average 34 years of age and two children. They all live in extended traditional families in Sompiya, Dioïla Prefecture, in Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, and sell cattle, soap, bread, and knit wool. The women of the Benkadi group are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan), to be used to buy cattle, "kabakourouni" soap (a locally produced soap), peanuts, fabrics, and wool. DJELIKA S., one of the members of the group, intends to use her loan to buy fabrics and wool. She gets her supplies of fabrics and wool from merchants in Wakoro (part of the Sompiya village), and sells her manufactured products in Sompiya and in the surroundings, for cash, to a clientele comprising mostly women. She expects to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20), to be used for the daily expenses of the family. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and wool

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Born in 1956, Rose N.  is married to Chi Joseph and they have brought forth five children. As a woman who does not like to depend on her husband for all the family needs and finding it so difficult to accomplish this task, Rose N.  joined GHAPE in 1998. Also, she has been having a lot of marital problems with her family.This has made her sad all the time but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small to her children. Her inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for her to meet her children’s needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

Given a loan, she plans to buy a two-wheeled motorcycle. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site and she has a good rider for the motorcycle. She  plans to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to cater for the basic needs of her family.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of a two-wheeled motorcycle

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 38 years old. Rodelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. Rodelyn owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rodelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

In 2007, Rodelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rodelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rodelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: monsieur M. est un homme marié, il réside avecc sa femme dans le quartier de gbenyédi qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, en  2002,il s'est lancée dans le commerce de détail de produits laitiers appelé "FAN MILK". il exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu'il a appelé " COGECO". il voudrait gonfler son stock de produits laitiers qui est épuisé raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits laitiers auprès de la société FAN MILK
texts.en:
Mr. M. is married and lives with his wife in the Gbenyédi district, an outlying area of the city of Lomé. In 2002, he began retailing dairy products called “FAN MILK.” He operates his business in his own shop which he calls “CONGECO.” He would like to replenish his stock of dairy products which is depleted. This is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various dairy products from the FAN MILK company.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of FAN MILK dairy products

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana María se dedica a la venta de verduras en las ferias de la zona sur , cliente que es bastante responsable con sus obligaciones así lo demostró todo este tiempo , también podemos indicar que la cliente es muy trabajadora ya que este ultimo tiempo mostro crecimiento en su actividad con la que sostiene a su hogar conformado por 4 integrantes y es la única que percibe ingresos en su hogar y por lo tanto la única que mantiene a su familia, por todo lo mencionado se le dio la tasa kiva, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como cebolla por quintales, zanahoria, yuca, haba, espinaca, etc. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Ana María sells vegetables at markets in the south and is constantly demonstrating how responsible she is. She is also very hardworking and has already seen her business grow, which allows her to support her 4-person household. She is the only family member with an income, and thus its sole provider. Because of her work she was awarded a Kiva loan. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as onions, carrots, yucca, haba (type of bean), spinach, etc. She is grateful to Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva for giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Resupply merchandise in bulk on a regular basis

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 50 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajo muy duro por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo de 50 años y sus 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Sarita es cultivar zanahorias, papa y arveja, labor que la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta Bolivia, según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene, por ello procura cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas de insectos y cuidarlas con fertilizantes. Con el tiempo espera que sus productividad mejore, para que las ventas sean más rápidas y sus ingresos económicos aumenten. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratará un operario para que trabaje en la siembra.
texts.en:
Sarita is 50 years old and she has always been someone who has worked very hard in her life. She lives in her own home together with her husband Hugo, 50 years old, and their 4 children. They are the reason for all their efforts. Sarita's work is to harvest carrots, potatoes and sweet peas. She works alongside her husband who has also worked very hard to provide their kids with a good education. She has seen it profitable to go to Bolivia with her products as they become available. That is where she gets the best prices. She makes sure to provide only the best care of her plantations, warding against insects and fertilize as needed. In time she hopes to increase her productivity so that her sales will be better and her earnings increase. This is her tenth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is committed to making her payments on time, not wanting to cause any problems to her community group colleagues, where she is very well liked. With the two thousand five hundred soles she requests she will purchase more fertilizers for her fields and she will hire the help she needs in the plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia B. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and is married. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is a married woman who lives in Totong, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: general store, livestock, and farming. Her husband Fortunato A., who is 58 years old, raises livestock and farms to earn his living. They have 1 child who is already married at 25.

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell in her General Store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Lolita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 25 years old. She is married and has one child who is 2 and a half years old. Her husband is a soldier. Jeanne sells green bananas and Irish potatoes. She has had this business for five years. With this loan, she will buy more green bananas and Irish potatoes. She plans to save the profit from her business. She says that her business is well known by all her clients and that is why she has succeeded. In the future, she would like to upgrade her business and start selling new products like clothes.

Jeanne is the leader of a borrowing group called 'Tuzamurane Group'. Tuzamurane is a Kinyarwanda word that means 'Rise Together' in English. She is in the back row with her hand raised.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Itiala

texts.en: Itiala Y. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread like tamia, legemat, etc  and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.  Itiala is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a police man. She has 3 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up restaurant.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of baking flour to bake more bread to sell

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a widow and resides in a city named Mian Chano in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family. She has an extended family, where her brother-in-law also lives with her family.
