She will also need a large display case for the cooked fish and a deep freezer to keep fish fresh before cooking them. Haruna needs funding of $750 to make her plan work.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Ramon R. started out selling snacks out of a cart he would push through the streets of Quisqueya.  With a loan from Esperanza, he was able to open up a permanent storefront where he sells essential foodstuffs like bread, rice, and meats, as well as everyday conveniences like pens and candies.  Ramon is a smart businessman with almost $100 in savings.  However, Ramon's savings are not enough to grow his business.  He will use this new loan to buy a freezer to expand his offerings to include ice, juices, and soft drinks. As soon as Ramon pays off his current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Tereso

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished construction. I need to add protection and an iron door, mainly for the safety of my family during the night. I am requesting $600 to finish the construction by adding the protection and the door."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar, me falta poner protecciones y una puerta de fierro para la seguridad de mi familia sobre todo en las noches”. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para terminar la construcción poner las protecciones y la puerta.

loans.use: To install protection and an iron door

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Mr. Henry O. a 39 year-old man who deals in the construction of iron doors and gates. He learned this business for five years and opened his in the year 1988. Mr. O. is married with two children, lives in Benin and he is a faithful LAPO client. He is in need of a $400 loan to buy materials for the production of iron doors and gates and he thanks you very much.

loans.use: To buy more materials for production

loans.name: Suharni

texts.id:
Using a motorcycle Suharni daily goes to the market about 2 km from her home. She goes to market to buy materials to make meatballs. Arriving at home she process those materials to meatballs ready for sales. Around 2:00 PM she sells those meatballs by motorcycle to the areas surrounding Gianyar until 8:00 PM. Every day she received profit of about Rp15,000.00 (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9000-9,500.00). She runs this business with her husband. One child age 4, with living expense of Rp15,000 could still be paid. However, with time they have to think about their future, and child's future. Income from metballs sales are their only source for their livelihood. To expand their business they needed borrowed capital. They hope the Rp 1000,000 to be loaned would help.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Menggunakan sarana sepeda motor Suharni setiap pagi pergi ke pasar yang terletak ± 2 km dari tempat tinggalnya. Dia pergi ke pasar untuk membeli bahan – bahan membuat bakso. Sesampai di rumah dia mengolah bahan – bahan tersebut sampai menjadi bakso yang siap untuk dijual. Kira – kira pukul 2 siang dia berkeliling menjual bakso dengan mengendarai sepeda motor di daerah sekitar Gianyar sampai dengan pukul 8 malam. Setiap hari keuntungan yang diperoleh senilai Rp 15.000,00. Usaha ini dijalankan berdua bersama suaminya. Satu orang anak berumur 4 tahun dan biaya hidup per hari Rp 15.000,00 masih mampu mereka penuhi. Namun, seiring waktu mereka harus memikirkan masa depan mereka dan anak mereka. Pendapatan yang mereka peroleh dari usaha jual bakso ini merupakan satu - satunya tumpuan hidup mereka. Untuk mengembangkan usaha mereka mereka memerlukan pinjaman modal. Pinjaman senilai Rp 1.000.000,00 yang mereka peroleh diharapkan dapat membantu.

loans.use:
To buy materials to make Meatballs

membeli bahan untuk membuat bakso

loans.name: Kusmawati

texts.en: Kusmawati is a 33-year-old woman who has been selling cosmetics and clothes obtained on credit for a living. She can earn about US$ 5 per day. Her husband, S., has no fixed income.  She needs a loan of US$ 125 to expand her business. Some of the loan will be used to buy more goods and the rest will be spent to expand her husband's business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little sales business and her husband's business

loans.name: Maria Nubia

texts.es:
For the past 14 years, in the city of León in the market at the bus station, María U. has sold clothing of all sizes and for all age groups. She has her own section, which has cost her a sizeable investment, and because she is a married mother with small children to support, she has managed to supply greater quantities of clothing for her business.

She started the business 14 years ago, walking through the market, exposed to the sun and to physical exhaustion from walking so much. Little by little she began to save so she could pay for an area inside the market until she finally got it.

Since she was able to get the section in the market, she has had 12 loans with Ceprodel, which have had a great impact on her because of the fact that she has bought greater quantities of clothing to offer and, in addition, has been able to sustain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 14 años en la ciudad de Leon en el mercado La Terminal, la señora Maria U. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todos tamaños y para todas las edades. Posee un tramo propio el cual le ha costado mucha inversión y por ser una madre casada y con hijos pequeños a que mantener ha logrado surtir de mayores cantidades de ropa su negocio.

El negocio lo comienza hace 14 años vendiendo ambulante en todo el mercado, exponiéndose al sol y al desgaste físico de producidos por el caminar mucho. Poco a poco comenzó a invertir para pagar un local interno en el mercado hasta que lo obtuvo.

Desde que logró obtener el tramo en el mercado, ha realizado 12 créditos en Ceprodel que le han impactado grandemente por el hecho de que ha comprado mayores volúmenes de ropa para ofrecer y además ha podido sostener el núcleo de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Nazrvi

texts.en: T. Nazrvi is a 57-year-old pharmacist who works in a drug store in her city's clinic. Nazrvi loves her job, which consists of helping people select and purchase the right medicines. She has long dreamed of opening her own drug store, and some time ago began saving to make this possible. She now has enough money to strike out on her own if she can secure additional support in the form of a loan. She would like to borrow $1,000 for 12 months, and we are confident she will be able to pay it back because she is a client of our agency and has a long and positive credit history. She would like to thank everyone who chooses to support her.

loans.use: Open a drug store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase Tables and Chairs

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema  M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 30 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of three and 15.  In 1997, Neema established a farming business with the help of Selfina, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers.  She now requires a loan of $425 in order to buy additional stock of cereal crops in bulk.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cereal crops in bulk.

loans.name: Rocio Magali

texts.es:
Doña Rocío, 29 years old, is married with 4 children still depending on her and her husband. She has finished her secondary studies and lives in a rented house in the District of Manuel Arévalo – Trujillo – Peru. She sells cosmetics and beauty products of well-known brands. She got her first loan of S/.200 from Manuela Ramos and invested in a business of disposable diapers but when it was not profitable any more, 6 months ago she started selling cosmetics. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Santa Elena II.” With the loan of S/.1000, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy cosmetics. She delivers the orders directly to the homes of relatives, friends and other clients. Rocío dreams of having her own stand where she can show her products and thus increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rocío, esta casada, tiene 29 años, con 04 hijos dependientes aún de ella y de su esposo, tiene estudios secundarios vive en una casa alquilada en el Distrito de Manuel Arévalo - Trujillo – Perú. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza de reconocidas marcas, Se inició con Manuela Ramos concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.200., el cual lo invirtió en la compra y venta de pañales desechables, pero al sentir que éste ya no es un negocio tan rentable cambió de trabajo y así se dedicó a la venta de los cosméticos, desde hace medio año. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Elena II” Con el préstamo de S/. 1000. el cual cancelará en 6 meses comprará cosméticos, ella utiliza la modalidad de reparto a domicilio de los pedidos que le hacen sus familiares, amigas y demás clientes. Rocío sueña con tener un stand propio donde poder mostrar sus productos y así mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to increase sales.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Ratih

texts.id:
Although Wayan Ratih is elderly, but she still has the stamina to be in pig farming business. This is because her husband's income is not enough to pay for daily expenses, although all of Wayan Ratih's children are already married. To expand her pig farming business, Wayan Ratih borrowed capital from Dinari to buy pig feedsock to increase her pig population, and the rest to buy pig feed. After raising 4 pigs for 4 months, Wayan Ratih sold it for Rp 2,300,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00), and profit obtaines about Rp 500,000 for 3 pigs. From this profit, Wayan Ratih decide to continue for the next loan from DINARI so that her capital increased to buy pig feedstock. Wayan Ratih plans to buy 4 piglets for fattening to be raised for the next 4 months. She hopes that would bring more profit from the next sales, so that it would increase family's economy.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Meskipun Wayan Ratih sudah berusia lanjut tetapi masih sangat bersemangat dalam menekuni usaha beternak babi. Hal ini dikarenakan penghasilan suaminya tidaklah banyak untuk bisa memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari meskipun anak-anak Wayan Ratih semuanya sudah menikah. Untuk mengembangkan usahanya beternak babi, Wayan Ratih meminjam modal ke DINARI supaya bisa membeli bibit babi untuk menambah populasi babi yang telah dimilikinya serta sisanya akan dibelikan pakan babi. Setelah memelihara 3 ekor babi selama 4 bulan, Wayan Ratih menjualnya seharga Rp. 2.300.000,- dan keuntungan yang diperolehnya sebesar Rp. 500.000,- untuk 3 ekor babi. Dari keuntungan ini Wayan Ratih memutuskan untuk melanjutkan pinjaman berikutnya ke DINARI sehingga modalnya akan bertambah lagi untuk membeli bibit babi. Wayan Ratih merencanakan akan membeli 4 ekor bibit babi penggemukan lagi untuk dipelihara selama 4 bulan ke depan. Dan diharapkan akan mendatangkan lebih banyak keuntungan dari hasil penjualan berikutnya sehingga akan mengangkat perekonomian keluarganya

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
I. Anvar is 35 years old and is married. He and his wife are raising five children. His wife is a housekeeper and she takes care of their children. Anvar is a farmer. He has been farming since he was a young boy. 

He has 8 years of experience, and he has been able to support his family by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season. He produces potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkins, cabbage and other vegetables. Each year, his yield is sufficient for his family's consumption and for selling. 

His business is his family's main source of income, and generating a stable income requires considerable funding. He’s asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300) for a term of 6 months to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Anvar would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and to improve production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale. With your help, he will get ahead. He thanks all supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: This is the third loan that Mrs. Kong K. S. has sought in order to improve her business. She is a fishmonger in Dork Pon Village in Kampong Chhnan Province. Previously, Mrs. Kong K. S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business and has since paid it back in full. Because her business is prospering, she is asking for a loan purchase more fish for her custopmers. Her husband, Mr. Hor Phorn, helps her with the business. Mrs. Kong K. S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại gia đình chị L. đang chăn nuôi vịt, cá và trồng cây ăn quả  theo mô hình trang trại hàng tháng cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và mua thêm cá giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L. is 45 years old. She has two grown children. In 1996, she joined the TYM Fund and received a loan to invest in raising livestock. Today, Mrs. L.'s family is raising pigs, fish, and growing fruit-bearing trees. Depending on conditions at the farm, their month income can be 5,000,000 VND. For this loan cycle, her family has requested 15,000,000 VND to invest in raising egg-producing ducks and to buy more fish to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks and fish

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Sat S., 23, is married and lives with two young children and her husband in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has a business selling bananas, earning a profit of $5 each day. Actually, she rents the banana farm from the villagers and then carries the fruit to sell at the market. Her husband, Phoeun Thon, 27, is a horse-cart driver. On average, he makes $3 per day to support the family as well. Mrs. Sat S. would like to take out a loan of $800 to rent a banana farm. With this loan, she would be able to carry more fruit than ever before to sell to the market.

loans.use: To rent banana farm.

loans.name: Nanci

texts.en: Nanci is a member of the Aleli Village Bank.  Nanci is 42 years old, widowed and has two children. She is a teacher, and works in an educational center in the Quinua district. Nanci has an internet café in her house, located in the Ciudad de Cumana Association, a neighborhood near several schools. In the morning an employee runs the café, and Nanci runs it in the afternoon. She also sells sweets, office supplies and photocopies.  Nancy needs a loan of 900 soles to buy Christmas gifts to resell in her store.  Nanci dreams of expanding her business and that her children will grow up to be working professionals.

loans.use: Buy Christmas gifts to sell

loans.name: Dennise

texts.es: Dennise tiene 23 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanas. Ella es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, por ello trabaja diariamente en la crianza de sus propios animales, los cuida con dedicación para luego venderlos, los fines de semana, en la feria ganadera, ahora ella quiere seguir creciendo con lo que se ha proyectado, y aumentar  la cantidad de animales que con su capital de trabajo, con el paso del tiempo a visto que la mejor manera de adquirir buenos animales es siendo muy minuciosa en la revisión, pues muchas veces está el riesgo de comprar un animal enfermo, pero con estos 4 años de experiencia ha podido tener estos conocimientos. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero de este crédito, Dennise comprará animales para tener mayor capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Dennise is 23 years old and lives with her mother and her sisters. She is a young women with great desire to get ahead and she works every day raising her own animals. She is very dedicated about caring for them so she can later sell them at weekend livestock markets. Currently, Dennise would like to expand her business by increasing the number of animals she owns. Since there is always the risk of buying a sick animal, she has realized that the best way to choose healthy animals is by being very picky about inspecting them. With four years of experience in this field, Dennise knows how to chose wisely.

This is Dennise's first loan with Kiva's partner MFP, and she promises to be on-time with her payments. With this loan, she will purchase animals to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of animals owned

loans.name: Mrs. Phanny Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
ElevE. people in Soupy village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan and Mrs. Phanny S. is the village bank president. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. PhE. Yun, is a basket maker. Mrs. Phanny S. is 24 years old and the mother of two childrE. who are too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy two more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua S., 50, is married with four children -- two boys and two girls. Her children have finished the village elementary school, but have not attended any schooling after that, instead just roaming the village. Akosua is concerned that her husband is not taking enough responsibility in caring for their children. The family lives in her husband's family house in Abofour, a farming community in Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Akosua is a dynamic innovator and self-starter when it comes to her work. She sells bush meat in her community. Her suppliers provide her with bush meats such as grass cutter, antelope, deer and more, all of which have a big market share in Ghana. People from the big cities place orders with Akosua, which they then come pick up when the order is ready.

Demand for her products has been high, so Akosua is applying for a loan to purchase more bush meats and increase her inventory. It is her dream to be able to provide enough support and financial assistance for her children to return to school.

loans.use: To buy fresh bush meats and firewood.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Amin has owned a restaurant for two years. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her restaurant. This is the first time that Amina has requested a loan.

Amina is special because she knows how to treat her clients. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the start-up capital. She decided on doing her business because she always wanted to open a restaurant and she always wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: Amina will use the loan purchase merchandise for her restaurant.

loans.name: Florista

texts.es: Florisa tiene 55 años, enviudó hace 25 años, tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales 3 viven en su casa y con una nieta. En vida, su esposo y ella trabajaban en la chacra con sus hijos, pero desD. que falleció su pareja ya no cultiva en grandes extensiones, sus hijos salieron del hogar y se quedó si apoyo para el cultivo. Entonces empezó a dedicarse además, a la venta D. comida los días sábados y domingos en el parque D. su pueblo, así como también en las diferentes festividades, como semana santa o los carnavales, el resto D. días venD. salchipapas (platillo a base D. papas y salchichas fritas) en la puerta D. su casa. Adicionalmente venD. ropa según la temporada, estos negocios le han permitido brindar una educación a todos sus hijos. Florisa está muy contenta con su labor, la dificultad es que ahora siente algunos malestares musculares que a veces dificultan su actividad, y eso le causa mucha pena; pero tiene el mismo entusiasmo D. seguir trabajando. Florisa es una D. la clientes fundadoras D. su banco comunal, en los ciclos anteriores ha pasado por varios cargos D. la junta directiva y los cumplió con mucha responsabilidad. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo no ha caído en mora. El dinero que solicita es para que restaure su máquina salchipapera, y otra cantidad para comprar abonos para los pequeños terrenos que tiene cultivados.
texts.en:
Florisa is 55 years old. She was widowed when she was 25 years old and has 7 seven children. Three of her children as well as one of her grandaughters live in her home. When her husband was living, he worked with her and her children at their ranch. Since her husband passed away, Florisa does not farm in large plots of land since her children left home and she was left without help for farming. At that time she started to also started selling food on Saturdays and Sundays at the park in her town. She also sells her food during the different holidays such as Easter and during festivals. The rest of the week she sells "salchipapas" (a dish maD. with potatoes and fried sausages) which she sells at the door of her home. In addition, she also sells clothing depending on the season. These businesses have allowed her to proviD. all of her children with a good education. Florisa is very happy with her work. The difficulty she is currently facing is that she has had some muscle pains that sometimes make her work difficult and cause her pain. However, she has the same enthusiasm to keep working. Florisa is one of the founding clients of her community bank. In past cycles, she has held various positions on the board and has met them responsibly. This is Florisa's 11th loan with MFP and in all of this time she has not been behind on her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to repair her machine that she uses to make salchipapas and to purchase fertilizers for the small plots of land that she farms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair machine that she uses to make salchipapas

loans.name: Sapi

texts.en:
Sapi U., 38, is married with 3 children.  She has 5 years of experience selling cabbages and cucumbers to the village people and public 3 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1,400 WST ($560 USD). Sapi has also used her pool table as another means of generating income for her to improve her family's financial situation.

SPBD loans are Sapi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She has had a previous loan of 750 WST, and this is her second loan request. This loan of 1,400 WST will be used for home improvement.

loans.use: To purchase cement, iron roofing, iron, and timber for home improvement

loans.name: Judy

texts.es:
Judy  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Judy es conviviente  tiene 49 años, tres hijos de 15, 14 y 12 años que están en la escuela estatal. 
Judy trabajaba en el en un kiosco un colegio vendiendo  menú por dos años, salio del colegio y alquilo un puesto, se puso a vender menú, hace cuatro meses decidió  cerrar su puesto y abrir su casa para vender  menú. Ya tiene clientes y le esta le yendo bien. 
Judy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mercadería, pescado, cerveza.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió  a ser responsable, para avanzar en el negocio, con las charlas a prendió a como debe de atender a las clientas de manera especial para poder conservarlas, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio.  
El sueño de Judy es juntar sus ahorros para poner una polleria.
texts.en:
Judy is a member of La Fortaleza community bank. Judy, 49, is in a common law marriage. She has three children, 15, 14, and 12. The children attend public school. For two years Judy worked in a kiosk by the school selling meals. She left the school and rented a place to sell meals. After four months she decided to close that place and open her house to sell meals. She now has customers and is doing well. Judy needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy merchandise, fish, and beer. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to be responsible in order to advance in business. The talks have taught her how to wait on customers in a special way to be able to keep them. Her children help her with the business. Judy’s dream is to gather enough savings to open a place to sell chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, fish, and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena D. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through senior-high school. Philomena sells shoes and bags in Abura, which she has done for two years. Her husband works with Ghana Education Services. Philomena uses her income for feeding the children and taking care of other financial needs of the family. Philomena will use the loan to purchase more varieties of bags and shoes to resell. Philomena plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of bags and shoes to resell

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor D. Los Milagros” ubicado en la Comunidad D. Imicati, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno. Tiene 70 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 04 hijos, no tiene estudios y vive en la comunidad D. Imicati.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años, estuvo trabajando en otro Banco Comunal, luego se cambio para el Banco Comunal Señor D. los Milagros con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, tiene su negocio D. venta D. productos D. la zona.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio comprando variedad D. productos que se producen en la zona como: papa, quinua, habas, ocas, etc.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades D. los préstamos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Magdalena belongs to the communal bank, "Señor D. los Milagros," which is located in the community of Imicati, in the district of Yunguyo, in the province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno. She is 70, a widow, and the mother of 4 children. She didn't go to school and lives in the community of Imicati. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for many years. She used to work with another communal bank and later switched to "Señor D. los Milagros" with an initial loan of 300 PEN. She has her business in the area. Currently she is requesting a loan of 700 PEN to be able to invest in her business and to purchase a variety of products that are produced in the area like potatoes, quinoa, beans, geese, etc. Her biggest dream is to keep working. She is pleased with the ease of receiving a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, quinoa, beans, geese, and other products from the area

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mr. Chann K., 25 years old, is a local taxi driver who picks up tourists who need to visit Angkor Wat Temple. He is married with one teenage, school-aged child. His wife works as a fruit vendor. Chann K. is applying for a loan for his wife to use as capital in ordering various fruits, at bulk pricing, from farmers. They will purchase the fruit this approaching mature-fruit season and then resell them at retail prices at the market to gain income. Note: Mr. Chann K. was not available for photograph, so his wife is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To order various fruits in bulk from farmers during this approaching mature-fruit season.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la tresse, mais ne gagnant pas suffisamment de revenu de son activité, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de détail de mèches. Cela lui permet de gagner un meilleur revenu. Elle a une ancienneté de 5 ans dans ce commerce, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Voulant reconstituer son stock qui s’épuise, elle sollicite  de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une trentaine de mèches et divers.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un  enfant.
texts.en:
Akossiwa C. learned to braid hair, but this activity did not generate sufficient income, so she started a retail business selling hairpieces. This allows her to earn more money. She has been doing this for five years,selling her goods door-to-door and stocking up in the big market at Lomé. Wishing to build up her diminishing stock, she is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 30 hairpieces and various other items. Mrs. C. is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hairpieces

loans.name: One Banana Tree Group

texts.en: Joseph is a 29 year old, young Liberian father with the educational level of a high school student and has four children. He is also engaged in the sale of dry goods for the past four years now.  He anticipates to expand his dry goods table to a larger one so that he can accommodate more goods. He wishes to have a home for himself and to be able to send all of his children to school.

loans.use: To purchase a larger table so that he can sell addition bags of rice, onions, salt, etc

loans.name: Celia Virginia

texts.en:
Celia is 41 years old and is married with two children. Celia sells chickens. Her husband works as a security guard.  Celia and her family live in the city of Pucallpa. 

Celia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Natividad.”  She plans to use this loan of 2,000 soles (about $660) to purchase chickens for sale.  

Celia feels that Manuela Ramos has helped her very much by providing capital with which to finance her business.  Celia also feels that the organization has helped her to learn and develop more as a person through the educational and life planning sessions given by Manuela Ramos loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank.

Celia’s goal is to eventually set up another business selling candies and grocery goods.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for resale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all sons, who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso in the Western Region. She works hard to support her husband and to provide for their family.

Nana is a trader. She runs a roadside shop selling provisions in her community. Nana buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices. She is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business. She has been in business for five years.

loans.use: To buy provisions for resale in her roadside shop.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es: Ligia es una mujer creativa y emprendedora, de 41 años de edad, tiene un hijo mayor de edad y se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y productos de bellezas, tiene vendedoras a su cargo, y viaja por diferentes caseríos  ofreciendo estos productos. Para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es chofer de auto (propio). Ligia también es cosmetóloga, atiende solamente a domicilio a sus clientes por no contar con un local para este trabajo. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” desde hace seis años, empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles que invirtió en joyas. Ahora requiere un préstamo de 3000 soles que invertirá una parte en la compra de productos de belleza y otra parte en gaseosas. La meta de Ligia es construir habitaciones para solteras con el fin de alquilar.

loans.use: Invertirá una parte en la compra de productos de belleza y otra parte en gaseosas.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: El señor Silvio Bermúdez de 56 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado, tiene seis hijos todos trabajan y tiene ya sus propias familias. Planes para su familia es que crezca su negocio para brindarles su ayuda a los hijos que la necesiten. Inició su propio negocio de venta de granos básicos y lácteos. Unos de los primeros productos que ha vendido es el fríjol, el viaja a los departamento de Matagalpa, Estile donde compra el fríjol barato y así darlo a menor precio y vender mas, como lo compra a buen precio le saca buena ganancia,  desde hace diecisiete años  vende y con el paso del tiempo a renovado las venta con nuevos productos como son los productos de lácteos. Agradece a la Institución por este nuevo ciclo del préstamo otorgado para la compra de producto como: queso, crema, frijoles, arroz, maíz y cacao. Permitiendo mayor captación de clientes generandole mayores utilidades y beneficio para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos, lacteos, y cacao

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen D. is from Pagadian City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daniel Alfonso

texts.es:
el sr. Daniel Alfonso D. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre con  la Sra. Gladys Marina Molina quien se dedica a ser ama de casa. el sr. D. se dedica a la pesca y venta de curiles y pescado, el necesita el credito para comprar una lancha pequeña sin motor, ya que el tiene un motor en muy buen estado que no lo esta utilizando y teniendo una lancha es mejor para realizar su trabajo de pesca.
nos comento que con esta lancha todo va a ser mas facil y va a sacar mas producto del mar.
texts.en:
Daniel Alfonso D., 40, is in a common-law relationship with Gladys Marina Molina, who is a housewife. Mr. D. is a fisherman who sells fish and curiles {Curiles are a local clam with a dark, iron-rich blood. The clams are served raw in their blood mixed with chismol (salsa) and lime juice}. He needs financing to buy a small, motorless boat since he already owns an engine that is in good condition that he hasn't used. Having a boat will help him fish more efficiently. He told us that with this boat everything will be easier and he will be able to extract more product from the sea.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods for her shop

loans.name: Salimatu

texts.en: Salimatu sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, fish, plantain and groceries.  Her husband is a commercial driver, who does the best he can to put food on the table.  Salimatu is a 38 year old mother of four children who sometimes pays part of her children’s school fees.  She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to expand her business and attract more customers by purchasing more foodstuffs and groceries to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Gantumur is 70 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder son, who is 7 years old, attends a local secondary school while his younger son, who is 4 years old, goes to kindergarten. His wife is unemployed and stays at home watching after their younger son, Gan-Ochir. Gantumur operates a gold and silver product making business in his town. He makes a variety of jewelery that satisfies his customers' needs. He started his business in 2000. He has built a stable operation over the years and the successful operation has allowed him to provide for his family. In the future, to further support his family, he hopes to grow his business further by increasing the quantity and quality of products he produces. He also wishes to build a house, which will make his living situation more comfortable. He is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase more gold and silver for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more gold and silver

loans.name: Douglas

texts.es: El señor Douglas tiene una pulpería la cual esta ubicada en su casa, el crédito lo invertirá en su negocio para incrementarlo mas ya que sus cliente quieren variedad en el negocio y el les podrá brindar una mejor atención esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos para su familia ha tenido dos créditos con CEPRODEL  y dos años el negocio, el señor dice que estos créditos le han beneficiado bastante ya que su negocio a crecido mas y ha podido ayudar a sus padres con lo gastos de la familia y además con sus estudios universitario ya que  el es soltero todavía.
texts.en:
Señor Douglas has a small grocery store that is located in his house. He will invest his loan in his business to supply it more since his customers want more variety. He will be able to offer them better service, which will help him improve his income for his family. He has had two loans with Ceprodel in the two years he has had his business. He says that these loans have benefited him a lot and that his business has grown more. He has been able to help his parents with their family's expenses and also with the costs of his college education since he is still a bachelor.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, rice, oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bags of beans, sorghum, sugar and cans of oil

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una carismática y encantadora mujer D. 54 años, está casada con José D. 55 años y tiene dos hijos, pero sólo viven con Cici D. 13 años. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en una zona céntrica D. la selva central del Perú.

DesD. hace 7 años labora ofreciendo productos para el hogar, asimismo trabaja en el transporte público trasladando personas en su moto carro, pero lo que más le gusta es el comercio. 
Para ella, su negocio es bastante rentable y tranquilo porque compra al por mayor y los comercializa por unidades, y gracias a estas ganancias compró una moto lineal, artefactos para su vivienda y logra cubrir los gastos domiciliarios. Con el tiempo desea instalar y administrar su propio negocio D. venta D. enseres para el hogar, pues asegura que en este negocio tiene mucha experiencia.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está feliz D. continuar con los integrantes D. su banco comunal, a quienes considera gente muy unida y sobre todo responsable. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará decenas D. tollas, cubre camas, cortinas, adornos florales, entre otros artículos, para su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a charismatic and charming woman. She is 54 years old, is married to José (55) and has two children, though only one, Cici (13) lives with them. She owns her own home, which is located in a central region in the central forests of Peru. For the last seven years, María has been selling household products and driving people around in her moto-taxi; what she likes best, however, is her commercial activity. Her business makes good profit - she buys wholesale and sells retail. Thanks to her earnings, she has bought a motorcycle and household appliances for herself, and she is able to sustain her family. In time, she would like to start and manage her own store selling household items, an area in which she already has a lot of experience. This is the fourth loan she requests from Kiva partner MFP. She is happy to remain a part of her communal bank since she likes her fellow members, whom she considers close friends and above all, responsible borrowers. With the the money she is requesting, she will buy towels, bedspreads, curtains, floral centerpieces, among other items, to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her stock of products

loans.name: Mirna Consuelo

texts.es: Mirna Consuelo M. S. de 40 años reside en Armenia, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su única hija la cual le ayuda en el negocio. Mirna posee una venta de medicina natural, la cual comercializa a las afueras del mercado de Armenia. Desde hace muchos años que ella se dedica a este tipo de trabajo en el cual se inicio debido a la enorme necesidad a la que se enfrentaba junto a su hija, la cual ha dependido de ella toda su vida, ya que Mirna ha tenido que trabajar muy arduamente por sacarla adelante, ya que ella es madre soltera. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de medicinas, sobre todo aquellas las cuales tienen más demanda por parte de las personas lo que es muy importante para Mirna ya que de esta manera complace a sus clientes y se asegura que sean constantes en las compras con ella. Mirna es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual tiene grandes deseos de seguir adelante, mejorar su negocio, de manera que pueda obtener mayor ganancias, y así obtener una mejor estabilidad económica, teniendo una vida más estable y de esta manera seguir adelante con su hija quien es la que le da las fuerzas necesarias y la incentiva a querer ser mejor cada día.
texts.en:
Mirna Consuelo M. S., 40 years old, lives in Armenia, located in the Sonsonate district. She lives with her only daugher, who helps her in the business. Mirna sells natural medicines outside the market in Armenia. For many years she has done this kind of work, which she began because of the enormous needs which confronted her and her daughter, who has depended on her for her entire life. Mirna has had to work very hard to bring her up, since she is a single mother. She is applying for a loan so that she will be able to buy a bigger quantity of medicines, especially those for which people have the greatest demand, which is very important for Mirna, since in this way she satisfies her clients and assures herself that they will be her steady customers. Mirna is a very hard-working woman who has great desires to advance herself and improve her business so that she can obtain better earnings and thus greater economic stability, have a more stable life and thus advance herself and her daughter, who is the one who gives her the necessary strength and the incentive to want to be better every day.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Magda Petrona

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente tiene 18 años de laborar como profesora y vive en la comunidad Pueblo Redondo.
Con el salario devengado mas los ingresos de su marido ellos han venido construyendo su hogar y además cubriendo la salud de sus hijos y de ellos mismos pero hoy tiene necesidad para este gasto que es mayor.
Por otro lado ellos crianza ganado y animales domésticos los que venden para pequeñas necesidades.
texts.en:
Magda is 18 years old and a teacher. She lives in the community of Pueblo Redondo. With the salary she earns and her husband's income, they have managed to build a home and also pay the family's health expenses. However, they now need help with this major expense. As well as teaching, Magda and her husband raise cattle and domestic animals which they sell in order to buy small necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for a scan, medicines, and medical expensesPago de tomografia, medicamentos, gastos medicos.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more lappas and used clothes

loans.name: Karole

texts.en: Karole is a 43-year-old man living in Hoima, Uganda. He is a father to seven children for whom he is responsible for school fees and welfare. He has a lorry which he uses in his transport business and has been in the business for 15 years now, having started as a mechanic. He says the current vehicle he has is old, meaning he is always in and out of the garage, but he hopes to buy a new one in the near future. This is his fourth loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to use the loan funds to buy new tires and repair the vehicle's engine.

loans.use: buying new tires and repairing the vehicle's engine

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Mr. Meng P., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Chan Lach, 49, have been married since 1980 and have seven children: six sons and one daughter. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, one is a monk, two assist their parents in the farming business and another one attends school. The family lives along National Road Number 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Meng and his wife are farmers. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village and sell their products to a middleman who comes to their home. Meng does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. So, he is asking for his first loan of $600 to use for the purpose. 

The couple is pictured above.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina K. is married and has two children. She has been through senior high school. Her husband is a security guard.

Georgina is a seamstress and sells cloth as well at Abura. She has been sewing for some time now and uses her income to support her husband in providing the basic needs of her children.

Georgina will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials for her sewing work and more cloth to sell. She plans to keep the new profits to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials for her sewing work and more cloth to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 20 year old single man  from Lebanon. He's owned a phone mobile shop in his town since 2009. He buys all models of mobile phones in addition to buying rechargeable cards. He also sells phone accessories. 
 Hassan is asking for a loan to change the décor of his shop and improve his showcases. He hopes that these changes will improve his sales and attract more clients so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora B. is currently in the business of selling crates of beer to retailers and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  She is 39 years old and is married to a businessman. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build another room for a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of trays, tables, and handicrafts

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria Castellón (vestida de color rosado en la fotografia que aperece con su asesora de credito) es una mujer trabajadora que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hijo de 28 años que  aun estudia; ella tiene un negocio donde ofrece servicios que embellecen la imagen de  damas caballeros y niños.

Gloria  inició su negocio siendo muy joven cuando aprendió el oficio de belleza, que al principio fue a domicilio y gradualmente implementó su infraestructura  donde también comenzó a vender productos cosméticos embellecedores de imagen como aun lo hace. Entre su oferta de servicios también está el manicure, pedicure corte, blower  y tintura de cabellos, que realiza con las mejores técnicas y por eso lo hace con gran excelencia, así  su clientela de San Fernando, el barrio donde está ubicada y los alrededores la  esperan y siempre la buscan.

Este es su segundo crédito con   la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , organización que la ha apoyado y desde ese momento  ha logrado mejorías en  los servicios que ofrece, además de que su hogar tiene mejores ingresos producto de su trabajo y puede ayudar un poco  a sus padres y a su hermana, esta última, en condición de discapacidad. Su credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para tratamientos de cabello y de rostro y también para mejorar su vivienda y darle mejor imagen al local donde tiene su negocio.

Su sueño es justamente continuar creciendo y cada día aumentar su nivel de vida y el de su familia al lado de su cónyuge y su único hijo.
texts.en:
Gloria Castellón (seen dressed in pink in the photograph, and appearing with her loan advisor) is a hard working woman who lives in the city of Cartagena, along with her husband and 28 year old son who attends school. She runs a business where she offers beauty services to ladies, gentlemen, and children. Gloria started when she was very young and learned the beauty business. She started working from her home, but gradually she built up her infrastructure and also began selling beauty products. Among her services are manicures, pedicures, haircuts, styling, and coloring. She uses the best techniques and experience, so her customers in her neighborhood of San Fernando, and the surrounding neighborhoods, wait for her and constantly seek her. This will be her second loan through “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,” which has supported her and made it possible for her to realize the improvements that she now exhibits in her service. Her place also provides improved revenue, the product of her hard work, and she can afford to help her parents and sister. Her sister is disabled. She will use the money from this Kiva loan to buy hair and face treatment supplies, and also to improve her home to give her workspace a better image. She hopes continue growing the business and improve her and her family’s lot in life, alongside her husband and her only son.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and inventory

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Carlos Cliente que vive en la ciudad de la paz,  en la zona denominada Tembladerani. La casa donde vive es familiar heredada por los Padres, cuenta con un niño de aproximadamente 4 años de edad es concubino con la señora Jaqueline  que se dedica a la venta de mariscos en los diferentes restaurantes de la zona sur. Nuestro cliente tiene como actividad principal el servicio de transporte mismo que lo viene realizando hace 4 años cuenta con dos móviles afiliados al sindicato litoral (trufis), el crédito será destinado a comprar un motor nuevo y realizar el chapeado de los vehículos como previsión para futuras fallas, el Sr. en la foto posa junto a su pareja.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives in the city of La Paz in an area called Tembladerani. The house where he lives is a family inheritance from his parents. He has a four year old son. He lives with Jaqueline, and she sells seafood to the different restaurants in the southern area. His main activity is providing transportation service. He has been doing this for four years, and he has two automobiles with the Litoral Syndicate (“trufis”: a taxi that travels along a specific route and has fixed stops). The loan is to buy a new motor and to veneer his two vehicles to prevent future problems He can be seen in the photo with his life partner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance (buy a motor and veneers)

loans.name: Telmo Cristian

texts.es:
Telmo tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su padre, en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte), el brinda este servicio dentro de su distrito y se vale de los ingresos que percibe para solventar sus gastos personales y colaborar con la economía de su familia. Este medio de transporte tiene bastante acogida entre los pobladores del distrito debido a su bajo costo y rapidez.

Debido al constante uso brindado, la unidad móvil de Telmo está empezando a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Como no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Telmo es un joven trabajador y emprendedor, el desea seguir trabajando para poder obtener una nueva mototaxi y así seguir creciendo como empresario. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran un joven responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Telmo is 25 years old, single and lives in his father’s house in the Chepén district, an agricultural area of considerable commercial activity belonging to the province of the same name. Chepén is located in the region of La Libertad, and is one hour’s drive from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. He provides a freight and passenger transportation service, using a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a cab attachment permitting transport activities). He offers this service within his district and uses his earnings to cover his own expenses while contributing towards his family’s finances. This means of transport is quite popular among district residents because of its low cost and swiftness. Due to its sustained use, Telmo’s mobile unit is beginning to suffer some damage which requires urgent repairs to ensure proper operation. As he lacks the funds to do this he has had to request for the first time a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Telmo is a young worker and entrepreneur. He wants to continue working so that he can acquire a new mototaxi and consequently keep on developing as an entrepreneur. People who know him have great esteem for him and regard him as a responsible and reliable young man.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance costs of a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Ruon

texts.en:
Mrs. Ruon E. is 37 years old and lives in a commune in the Battambang province. She leaves home each day to buy vegetables from nearby farmers. She then delivers them by bicycle, door-to-door around her community. She has been engaged in this trade for over a year. 

Ruon E. has a partner in her husband, who is skilled in building wooden houses. The couple works together to feed their three unmarried children. Ruon E. will be using her loan to increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her income

loans.name: Rosalba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosalba C. tiene 41 años de edad y vive en el barrio Olaya de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias,  amenizada por los ritmos musicales afro caribe y cuna de esta cultura. Allí tiene su hogar conformado por ella y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 9 a 20 años y también un  negocio que inició en compañía de su hermano: la venta de    electrodomésticos y muebles plásticos, que iniciaron con poco capital y distribuyendo estos artículos  de pueblo en pueblo, al principio vendían  queso lácteos y luego ampliaron su campo de accione en Maicao, donde llevaban lácteos y traían   mercancía variada aun buen precio para sus clientes; muy pronto su disciplina y sus ganas de salir adelante dio sus primeros resultado: hizo crecer su negocio con mas clientes pero estaban afectados porque su capital no alcanzaba a cubrir los pedidos por los créditos de sus clientes. Fue así como se acercaron a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a su primer credikiva, con el que va a comprar mercancías como electrodomésticos menores, ropa calzado y artículos para el hogar.

 
Su sueño es  desarrollar su microempresa de manera independiente  y fortalecer su venta en otros departamentos, para generar mas ingresos y  sacar adelante a sus hijos. Aunque su mayor desafío son las lluvias, que muchas veces inundan las poblaciones que ella visita y le dificultan  el cobro de su cartera  de manera ordenada,  afortunadamente cuenta con buenos clientes y ellos le guardan lo que debe recoger, porque aprecian  su trabajo y su buena fe..
texts.en:
Rosalía C., age 41, lives in the Olaya neighborhood of the city of Cartagena de Indias.  The city is enlivened by the rhythm of African-Caribbean music, and it is the cradle of its culture.  This is where she has her home and lives with her family, which is comprised of four children from the ages of 9 to 20 and herself.

She also has a business, which she started with her brother.  They sell domestic appliances and plastic furniture.  They started with a little capital, and they distributed these items from town to town.  At first they sold cheese.  Then they expanded their field of operations in Maicao, where they took their dairy products and various merchandise to sell at a good price for their customers.

Very soon her discipline and desire to get ahead produced the first result.  They made her business grow with more customers.  However, it affected her in that she did not have enough capital to cover her customers’ orders on credit.

That is why she approached the Fundación Santo Domingo to apply for her first Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like small domestic appliances, clothes, footwear, and items for the home.

Her dream is to develop her small business in an independent way and to strengthen her sales in other departments.  She wants to do this in order to generate more income and to get her children ahead.

Her greatest challenges are the rains that frequently inundate the towns that she visits and make it difficult to collect payments  in an organized way.  However, she fortunately has good customers, and they put aside what she needs to collect because they appreciate her work and her good faith in them.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like small domestic appliances, clothes, footwear, and items for the home

loans.name: Ma. Delsa

texts.en: Ma. Delsa M. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a restaurant, a general store and buying and selling charcoal. She lives in Prk. Centro 1, Brgy. Sta. Lourdes, Puerto Princesa, Palawan. Since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, Delsa has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Ma. Delsa is now borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Delsa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Cruz De Mayo - Pincha Group

texts.es:
Graciela Isabel U. V., viuda, de 50 años de edad y con 4 hijos. 
Inicio con su bodega hace 5 años a raíz del fallecimiento de su esposo. También se dedica a la agricultura.
Sus hijos se encuentran cursando estudios superiores. 
Ella trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores, de este modo vienen sacando adelante sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Graciela Isabel U. V., age 50, is a widow with four children. She opened a store five years ago after the death of her husband. Graciela also engages in farming. Her children are pursuing their higher education.

She works with the help of her older children, enabling her to move forward with her two businesses.

loans.use: Operating capital to invest in a store

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señorita Esther vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como secretaria en una consultora; es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad.

El crédito que solicita es para inscribirse a la Universidad Tecnología Boliviana en la carrera de auditoria.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO y es primera vez que forma parte de Kiva y por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Esther lives with her parents in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.  She works as a secretary in a law office.  She is 20, and single.

The loan that she is requesting is to register in the Universidad Tecnología Boliviana so that she can study and become an auditor.

This is the first time that she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and it is the first time that she is working through Kiva.  Because of her good reputation she qualifies to receive a loan.

loans.use: The cost of  the registration for the Universidad  Tecnología Boliviana so that she can study and become an auditor.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 51 años, es una valerosa mujer que enviudó hace 7 años. Ella tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). Con la ayuda de sus hijos, Yolanda trabaja arduamente para salir adelante; desde que murió su esposo, tuvo que tomar importantes decisiones en la venta de sus sembríos. Desde que tenía 16 años, Yolanda comenzó a trabajar en el campo, pero cuando consolido su familia, arrendó terrenos agrícolas, que con el tiempo y mucho trabajo pasaron a ser suyas. Sus cultivos de café, plátanos y palta; los vende en la capital del país, donde viaja constantemente. Ahora quiere juntar un capital considerable de dinero, para poder invertir en la siembra de más de 12 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, con los que pueda asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y en está nueva etapa que comienza, donde podrá recibir apoyo y generar nuevos ingresos, gracias a su banco comunal. Espera salir adelante. De adquirir el crédito  solicitado tiene pensado comprar 5 sacos de abono orgánico y, si el dinero le alcanza comprará una mochila fumigadora, cuyo precio oscila entre los 350 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 51, is a valiant woman who was widowed 7 years ago.  She has 7 children but only three still live with her in her own house located in Sanchirio del Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  With help from her children, Yolanda works hard to get ahead.  Since her husband died she has had to make important decisions about the sale of her crops.  

She has worked in the fields since she was 16 years old but when she formed her own family she rented agricultural fields which in time and with much effort became her own property.  She grows coffee, bananas and avocados that she sells in the nation’s capital where she travels to constantly.  Now she wants to gather a significant amount of money to invest in planting more than 12 hectares of farmland with which to assure her children’s future.

This is her first loan from MFP and she is starting a new phase where she will be able to get financial support and generate new income thanks to her communal bank. She hopes to get ahead.

If the requested loan is granted she plans to use it to buy 5 sacks of organic manure and if there is enough money left over she will buy a fumigator which costs around 350 new soles.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of manure and a fumigator.

loans.name: Maximina Esperanza

texts.es:
Maximina de 55 años, decidió ser comerciante informal para poder ayudar a su esposo con la carga familiar que ha tenido ya que él era el único que mantenía el hogar. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ella ha sido conocida por distintas personas como comerciante de arroz.

Su trabajo lo ha venido realizando comprando en un cantón llamado “Daule” ya que en ese lugar la mayoría de los agricultores venden sus sembríos a los comerciantes. Cada saco de arroz los comprar a $ 30.00 y si los comprar al por mayor los comprar a $ 25.00. 

Para seguir con su comercialización ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz y dedicar la mayor parte del dinero a readecuar su casa porque ya se acerca la temporadas de lluvias comprando cemento, bloques. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para tener más movilidad en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maximina, 55 years old, decided to be an informal merchant, to be able to help her husband with the responsibility for the family that he bore as the only earner in the family. She lives in Perimetral, on the city's edge, and has long been known by distinct persons as a rice merchant.

Maximina carries out her work by buying rice in Daule canton, where the majority of farmers sell their harvests directly to merchants. She buys each sack of rice for $30, or at $25 wholesale.

To promote sales, she wants to use  part of the loan to buy rice, then the majority to upgrade her home, since the rainy season is approaching.  She will buy cement and blocks. In the future, Maximina wants to purchase a van so she can have sales mobility.

loans.use: TO BUY CEMENT AND BLOCKS FOR HOME REPAIRS, AND RICE TO SELL

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Shareef and his friends decided to start a small project that would create an additional source of income. The group of friends has created a musical and chanting troupe to perform in weddings. Shareef came to FATEN and took the loan to purchase the musical instruments they need to start the band in addition to the ones they already have. Shareef and his band studied music in school and they have the skills.

Shareef is the one who stands in the middle of the picture here with his band.

loans.use: To purchase musical instruments to form a band

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan Diego G. P., es un chico de 20 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la reparacion de automoviles(mecanica en general),el trabaja junto con su hermano en el mismo taller, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria y decidio dedicarse de lleno altrabajo,en el cual lleva mas de 5 años.
Juan Diego es un joven muy sano y lleno de vida, nos comparte que le gusta su trabajo y que no dia que no se levante con animos, por que el arreglar autos le apasiona, en cuanto a las ganancias no se puede quejar, el y su hermano hermano comparten los gastos del mantenimiento y la renta del lugra donde se ubica su taller.
El tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y comprar algunas hherramientas que les hacen falta asi como algunos materiales extras, el dinero obtenido en este prestamo lo invirtio en lla compra de algunas pinzas, llaves, diferntes lubricante para el motor, filtros, bujias, pistones, liquido de frenos, anticongelante y otros, en especifico el invirtio todo su capital para el mejoramiento del servicio en su negocio, en su taller hacen muy buen trabajo y es por esoq ue los clientes lo buscan y los conocen muy bien a el y su hermano, y ni hablar del padre que tambien se dedica la negocio d las llantas para todo tipo de autos y camiones.
Lo que nos puede decir Juan Diego, es que el mayor reto al que se ha enfrentado es con el mismo, en ser cada dia mejor, ir aprendiendo mas y reter a sus clientes, asi tambien para el es un reto el vivir cada dia, sabiendo que es una oportunidad mas para mejorar y darse a conocer.
Nunca ha esta carente de trabajo y es por eso que el ha estado en un proceso de salir adelante, anhela tener su propio taller mecanico, con el equipo adecuado y aproíado para facilitar su trabajo, el quiere que otros jovenes como el aprendan este oficio y no se vallan por el camino facil del alcohol, del robo o delas drogas, esta dispuesto a ayudar y enseñar a otro chicos mas para que ellos puedan valerce por si mismos y ayudar a sus familias a mejorar sus vidas.
Una de sus esperanzas es que DIOS le otorgue mas vida y salud para que algun dia el pueda tener su propio taller de manera independiente, don de aparte de arreglar autos pueda ofrecer empleo a mas personas, le gustaria tambien tener su casa propia y pues mas adelante formar su propia familia, pero no sin antes tener algo que ofrecerles.
El esta agradecido con los que son instrumentos del financiamiento de su credito, gracias a todos por su apoyo y confianza, y que  sigan apoyando mas a quienes lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Juan is 20 years old, single and works in automotive repair and general mechanics. He and his brother work in the same shop. He left high school after his second year, choosing to work full time, which he has done for 5 years.  Juan is a very upstanding young man who is full of life. He enjoys his work and he approaches each day enthusiastically. He is passionate about fixing cars.

As far as income, he feels like he can't complain given that he and his brother share expenses associated with the rent and maintenance of their shop.   Juan sees the need to improve in his business by purchasing tools he lacks as well as other additional materials. The money from this loan will be put towards buying pliers, wrenches, various kinds of motor oil, filters, spark plugs, pistons, brake fluid, and antifreeze, among other items. Juan invested all of his capital specifically in improving the service provided in his business. At the shop, they do very good work which is why their clients come to them and know him and his brother very well, not to mention their father who also works in the automotive business, selling tires for all kinds of cars and trucks.   

Juan tells us is that the greatest challenge he faces is himself, in striving to improve each day, continuing to learn and retaining his customers. He sees each day as another opportunity to improve and promote his business.   He has never lacked for work and for that reason he has recently been in the process of growing his business. Juan wishes to have his own garage, with the necessary and appropriate equipment to facilitate their work. He wants for other young people, like him, to learn this trade, instead of taking the easy rode of alcohol, thefts and drugs. He is willing to help other young people by teaching them so that they can become self-sufficient and offer assistance to their families to improve their lives.   

One of his hopes is that God will grant him health and more life so that he can one day own his own garage. With that gift, aside from just fixing cars, he could offer employment to other people. He would also like to have his own house and in the future have his own family, but not without having something to offer them.   He is grateful to those who are instrumental in providing his loan. Thanks to all for your support and trust and may you continue supporting those who need it most.

loans.use: To purchase tools and parts for repairing cars, specifically, tires, tire patches, motor oil, brake fluid, antifreeze and some used parts.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo G. y la señora Maria Inés Coazozon son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos de edad escolar, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor. 
A la vivienda le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y hacia poder comprar el material que necesitan y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora.
Don Alfredo trabaja para un taller de herrera como supervisor con este ingreso pagara el préstamo, ya que Doña Maria Inés se encargara de las gastas familiares con el sueldo que obtiene como empleada de limpieza. 
 La persona que nos atendió fue la señora Maria Inés, esposa del señor Alfredo G. hay que por cuestiones de trabajo no pudo El atendernos ese día.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo G. and Mrs. Maria Ines Coazozon are the parents of two school-aged children, to whom they want to provide them with the best. 

There are some repairs that need to take place to the exterior of their home, but they don’t have the necessary funds to carry it out. 

They request a loan in order to purchase the materials they need and to pay for the labor. 

Alfredo is a supervisor in a blacksmith shop. With this income he will repay his loan. Maria Ines takes care of the household expenses with the income she earns providing cleaning services. 

Maria Ines made the request, wife to Alfredo G.. He was not able to attend the interview because he had to be at work that day.

loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro desde hace un tiempo es comerciante, casado su esposa le apoya en la venta de los productos. Se le presento la dificulta de sufrir un accidente el cual ocasionó descuido en el negocio. Lo inicio con ahorros propios. En este ciclo de préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, piedra, bloques, arena, camisa entre otros materiales. Para la construcción de pared que será de división de la casa. Agradece a la financiera para el desarrollo y mejor nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Teodoro is married and has worked as a merchant for some time. His wife helps him by selling products. Teodoro has faced difficulty since suffering an accident that caused him to neglect his business. He started out using his own savings.

In this loan cycle, he will invest his funds in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, stone, blocks, sand, and other items. He plans to build a wall that will act as a divider in his house. Teodoro is grateful for the financing so that he can develop and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to put up a dividing wall in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.en:
Eugénie has recently moved to a new area of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She and her husband Félix look after three of their four children together.

At her food stall, Eugénie sells traditional dishes. She has run this stall for the past three years, and previously taken four loans with ALIDE which she has repaid in full. With this year-long loan, she will buy mutton from the local market to sell at her stand. In the long term she hopes to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: Purchasing mutton for cooking traditional food dishes to sell.

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 40 years old; he is married and has two children – a 10-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son. The family lives in the village of Tsveri, Kartli Region. The family has one milk cow. They produce cheese and sell it in Khashuri, a nearby town. Also they own a 4.3 ha plot of land and grow tomatoes, haricot beans, barley and wheat. The grains and tomatoes are sold locally. In addition to the agriculture,  Kakha and his wife run a retail business. They buy linens on the wholesale market and sell them in the village. 

Kakha got the loan from Credo for agricultural business – to till the land, purchase fertilizers and seeds. Kakha hopes that they will have a good harvest season and plans to invest the profit in their retail business as well as paying for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and pay for tilling the land.

loans.name: Eulalia's Group

texts.en:
Eulalia M. is from the village of Estrada. She is 52 years old. Eulalia is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Eulalia M.'s Group.

Eulalia is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Eulalia runs a food stall/canteen. Eulalia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Eulalia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Eulalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Eulalia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Eulalia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lim
