texts.en: Lim K., 32, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She is a housewife while her husband works in construction, earning $7 a day. Each month, the family spends $75 on food and $35 on other necessities. She is applying for a loan of $500 to buy rubber trees, which she plans to grow and harvest. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-time Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy rubber trees to grow

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely P. is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and works hard to support her family. Emely is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat.  In the future, Emely would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, age 44, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has four children. 

She is engaged in a business as a grocery seller, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. The standard of living has been improved since Chanthorn and her husband have had these businesses. 

Chanthorn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 34 years old. She is married and has 6 children. Vivian works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17000 loan, through NWTF, to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Vivian has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 1 year and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop, farming vegetables and livestock.

Vivian aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 43-year-old business man.  He is married and has 5 children aged 24, 21, 18, 14 and 10 years. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him because they are his nephews.

In 1993, he established his welding, steel doors and windows business. He began his business because he wants to achieve his dream of independence through apprenticeship. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy steel metals rods. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, he plans to develop a plot of land and give his children good educations. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy steel metal rods for his business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 57 year old single mother of one child. Margaret sells clothes in Kongowea, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last four years. 

She is a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase more bails of clothes for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to benefit her family.

Her dream is to own a boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy more bails of clothes for reslae

loans.name: Alfarina Diofilda

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

La señora Alfarina es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace 16 años y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado mucho con los créditos. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero el menor aun vive con ella y estudia en universidad, con ella también vive con una nieta de 5 años de edad que es como su hija y que estudia en  escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella se dedica tanto al hogar como también al comercio,  vende productos naturales de la marca Obnilife, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus productos ya son para entregar ya que tiene muchos clientes que utilizan sus productos para mejorar su salud y su estado de ánimo,  nos cuenta que ella tenía una fábrica de botones pero por motivos de enfermedad tuvo que darle esta fabrica a uno de sus hijos ya que ella no podía hacerse cargo de este trabajo, ahora lleva más de 7 años en el comercio y le está yendo muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales, como vitaminas, adelgazantes, entre otros productos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products like the straw hats famous both nationally and internationally, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every two weeks.

Alfarina is a founding member of the communal bank.  She’s been in it for 16 years and likes it because they have always helped her a lot with the loans.  She’s 52 years old, married and has four children who are all adults now but the youngest one still lives with her and is attending university.  A five-year-old granddaughter, who is like a daughter to her, also lives with her and is going to school.  Her husband’s a farmer.

She is both a housewife and a merchant.  She sells Omnilife brand products door to door although most of her products are for delivery because she has lots of customers that use these products to improve their health and their state of mind.  She tells us that she used to have a button factory but due to illness had to leave it to one of her children because she could no longer do the work.  Now, she’s been a merchant for over 7 years and is doing very well.

This loan is to buy natural products like vitamins and weight loss products, among other things.  Her dream is to stay in business and that her son become a professional.

loans.use: to buy natural products like vitamins and weight loss products.

loans.name: Druscillah

texts.en:
Druscillah is 27 years old and married with one child whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. She operates a general store in which she sells such things as electronics, clothes, household items, shoes and other items to the local people in Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years now and has one employee.

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy heaters, sockets, bulb holders and shoes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and in the future open another shop in the city centre. She describes herself as hardworking, dedicated and honest.

loans.use: to purchase heaters, sockets, bulb holders and shoes

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell for her buying and selling of vegetables business.

Marlene has been in this business for 11 years. Marlene earns more income from buying and selling of crabs.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, que lo inicio por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingreso, Martha tiene 4 hijos de 14,12, 10 y 3 años respectivamente a los cuales tiene que brindarles lo necesario. El financiamiento que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en su negocio como es ropa en general, calzado, cremas, perfumes, calzado, bolsos, billeteras, tratamientos entre otros. Martha tiene una gran variedad de clientes que diariamente le solicitan una gran variedad de pedidos.
texts.en: Martha Lorena is 30. She sells general merchandise. She has had this business for over 10 years, and she started it out of the need to obtain a source of income. Martha has 4 children ages 14, 12, 10 and 3 for whom she provides. The requested loan will be invested in her business: in general items of clothing, shoes, creams, perfumes, bags, wallets, and treatments, among other items. Martha has a large variety of customers who make a large variety of orders every day.

loans.use: to buy general items of clothing, shoes, creams, perfumes, bags, wallets, and treatments, among other items.

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Emmalinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & a variety of beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, canned goods, breads & beverages to sell.

Emmalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emmalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods, breads & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso tiene 53 años de edad, está casado con la señora Ramona, tienen 3 hijos juntos, dos ya mayores de edad.  
El Señor es muy emprendedor, y trabajador, compra productos tales como sabanas, sobrecamas, colchas, hamacas y otros y se encarga de venderlos a cuotas en la localidad de Coronel Oviedo en donde viaja cada semana a buscar clientes y cobrar sus productos recorriendo casa por casa. En su negocio recibe la ayuda de su esposa, ya que ella elabora hamacas y que luego el lo vende junto a sus otros productos.
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerle estudiar, además de eso, dos de sus hijos lo ayudan en sus ventas.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas y frazadas, para la posterior venta ya que tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes y quiere cumplir con ellos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Celso, 53, is married to Ramona.  They have three children together; two of them are already adults.

He is very enterprising and hardworking.  He buys products like sheets, bedspreads, comforters, hammocks and others and then resells them in installments in the town of Coronel Oviedo where he travels to weekly in search of customers and to collect payment for his products door to door.  His wife helps him with the business since she makes hammocks that he then sells along with his other products.

Thanks to his work and effort he was able to provide his children with all comforts as well as an education.  In addition, two of his children also help him with sales.

He requests the loan to buy sheets and blankets for subsequent resale since he has many pending orders from customers and he wants to fulfill them.  He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it provides him.

loans.use: to buy sheets and blankets for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 34 years old, married, and mother of one child. She is a poultry farmer. She has been in the business for the past three years.

This is her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase chicks and chicken feed. Anticipated profits will be used for repayment of her loan and to plough back into the business. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Deoflor

texts.en:
Deoflor is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Deoflor has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Deoflor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Deoflor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 6 children. Florita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Florita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Florita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Tofiq is 60 years old, married and has seven children!  He breeds cattle for milk and meat purposes. Tofiq has 20 years of experience in this field. He is  an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. The income his business generates is 150 AZN per month.  Meat and milk are the most popular products in Azerbaijan and to meet customer demand, Tofiq want to buy more cattle. For this purpose, he applied for a 1500 AZN loan. It will be his second loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows and one beef cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy office and advertising equipment

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 40ans. Elle est célibataire et a 01 enfant.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 1996. Elle vend à Bé Kpota et achète les produits à Lomé.
Afiwa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques.
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa ouvrir d’autres points de vente et assurer un bon avenir à son enfant.
texts.en:
Afiwa is 40 years old, single and the mother of one child. She has been selling cosmetics since 1996. She sells her products in Bé Kpota and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Afiwa is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to restock on cosmetics. In the coming years, she would like to open more shops and provide her child with a solid foundation for a good future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Aleay

texts.en:
Aleay is a 30-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of four and fifteen years old. All of them are in school.

Aleay has been selling food in the south of Sudan for two years. She has requested this loan of 800 SDG through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cabbages and tomatoes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is a farmer from the village Kvishilori, West Georgia. He is 53-years-old, married and lives with his family: wife – Gulnazi, his 29-year-old son, daughter-in-law and 2 grand daughters (3 and 5 years old). Guram’s son works as a worker in the village. His salary is the main source of income for the family. Guram takes care of a milk cow. He produces cheese and sells it at the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Guram requested credit for renovation of the family house as it is already old and needs some improvements. Guram will purchase the renovation materials and his son and he will perform the renovation work. After the renovation the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Pyahu Mba'apora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Pyahu Mba´apora" se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Celia. Actualmente se encuentran  en el primer ciclo, con diez integrantes. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas,y de escasos recursos, por lo que reciben muy pocas antenciones y beneficios, es por ello que está muy contentas por la ayuda que les da la fundación.
Celia, nos cuenta que tiene una modesta despensa en su casa, donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, fideos, lácteos, y demás. Cuenta que la mayoría de sus vecinos compran de ella y que gracias a eso tiene buenos ingresos con los cuales puede mantener la casa y ayudar a su familia. Ella sueña con algún día poder tener una gran despensa mucho mejor surtida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, lácteos, y demás tipos de artículos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Pyahu Mba´apora" committee was started due to the initiative of Señora Celia.  At present they are in their first loan cycle, with ten members.  They are all women who have sacrificed, being of scarce resources, for which they receive very little attention or benefits.  Because of this they are very pleased with the aid that the foundation gives them.  
Celia tells us that she has a modest pantry in her house, where she sells consumer staples such as sugar, noodles, milk, and other things.  She tells us that the majority of her neighbors buy from her and that thanks to that she has a good income with which she can maintain the house and help her family.  She dreams of some day being able to have a great pantry with a lot better assortment of goods.  She requests the loan for the purchase of sugar, noodles, milk, and other types of consumer staples, with which she will be able to be better supplied and to satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, milk, and other consumer staples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Io improve on his implementation.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.en:
I work as a merchant, selling new clothing to people in offices, schools and markets. I travel to Guatemala or El Salvador where I buy my products and I return home to sell them to my own customers. Currently I need to travel to buy summer clothing and I wish to take advantage of the season in order to better my earnings and to finalize the repairs on my home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi trabajo es vender ropa nueva a personas en oficinas, escuelas y mercados, viajo a Guatemala o El Salvador donde compro y vengo a venderles a mis clientes por encargos. Ahora necesito viajar para comprar ropa de verano, quiero aprovechar esta epoca para mejorar mis ganancias y finalizar la reparacion de mi casa.

loans.use: To buy summer clothing.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Mr. Rodríguez has been serving his community for 10 years selling goods at his grocery store. Along with his wife, Mr. Rodríguez takes care of the store and says, "I opened this grocery store with the help of my wife after I retired. We need to keep it well supplied because it is our only source of income. This is way we are asking for a $1,000 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. R. lleva una década sirviéndole a la comunidad con su tienda de abarrotes, él y su esposa son las personas encargadas de atender el negocio. "Desde mi retiro laboral me he dedicado a la venta de abarrotes con la ayuda de mi mujer por eso necesitamos tener bien surtida nuestra tienda pues es nuestra única fuente de ingresos, solicitamos $1,000.00 dlls.

loans.use: Para comprar grandes cantidades de mercancia.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. Yean S. Y., is 42 years old and the mother of one child.  She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living selling vegetables at a market and makes on average $2.5/day. Her husband is self-employed as a taxi driver. 
Currently, Yean S. Y. wants to expand her business by adding different kinds of vegetables to her stall to meet her clients’ demands. She is confident that she can increase her profits as a result of this business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to meet her clients' demands

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is married with three children, ages 13, 10 and the smallest just 1 year old. Her husband is a mechanic. To improve their quality of life, Rosa decided to buy the land next to her house. In order to cover this purchase, Rosa opened up her own business selling tacos six years ago. She began selling them from a small corner and, thanks to the good quality of her products, her sales increase with each day that passes. Later her business was constructed on her new land and with this her business continued to improve.

She now has greater ability to attend to her clients. Rosa needs a bigger grill and a canvas to cover part of the structure out of which she has her business. For this she is asking for a loan of $475 dollars which she promises to payback in 6 months. With your help Rosa will be able to continue to increase her business and she appreciates this opportunity that you have provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Maria está casada y tiene tres hijos, de 13, 10 y el más pequeño de sólo un año de edad. Su esposo es mecánico, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Rosa decidió comprar el terreno de al lado de su casa y para poder cubrir el costo emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de tacos hace seis años, comenzó a vender en un pequeño puesto y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, sus ventas se crecían día con día. Después fue construyendo en el terreno y mejorando el aspecto de su negocio.

Ahora que tiene una mayor capacidad para atender a sus clientes Rosa necesita de una parrilla más grande y una lona para cubrir una parte de la estructura de su negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Rosa podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio y agradece mucho esta oportunidad que le brindas.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr:
Mrs. Viviane A., 25 years old, is a young married woman and mother of 1 child. Loving hairdressing, she very early on cast herself into apprenticeship. Because she loved this activity she mastered it very quickly. After work, she continues to work at home. The enthusiasm and warm welcome she has always shown her clients have contributed to an ever-increasing clientele. To truly enhance what she has learned and to better satisfy her clients, she is requesting a loan of $650 to open a salon, buy a hairdryer and other hairdressing tools. Once this dream is accomplished it will allow her to increase her income and she will be able to better care for her small family. Her husband, a house painter, has a hard time finding enough work to provide for the family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 25 ans, Madame A. Viviane est une jeune femme mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant. Aimant la coiffure, elle s’est très tôt lancée dans l’apprentissage de cette dernière. Par l’amour qu’elle à pour le métier, elle l’a vite maîtrisée. Après sa libération, elle travaille à la maison. Par son dynamisme et par l’accueil qu’elle a toujours réservé à ses clientes, sa clientèle n’a jamais cessé d’augmenter. Pour véritablement mettre en valeur ce qu’elle a appris et mieux satisfaire ses clientes, elle vient solliciter un crédit de $650 pour ouvrir un atelier, s’acheter un séchoir et autres matériels de coiffure. Ce rêve réalisé, lui permettra d’avoir un revenu maximum qui l’aidera à mieux s’occuper de sa petite famille car son mari peintre trouve difficilement du travail pour faire face aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Ouverture d'un salon de coiffure et achat d'un séchoir à cheveux

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosemary E. is 35 years old, lives in Benin City, and is married with 4 children.

She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more books to sell. The loan will go a long way to improve her business. She is an LAPO member.

loans.use: Buy more books to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
In Dar es Salaam there is no government-run public transport, so the equivalent are dalla dallas, minibuses that are owned by private individuals and subject to loose regulations. Mary K. owns a number of dallas and employs drivers and conductors to run the often crowded vehicles. Mary established the business in 2005 and requires a loan of $275 to have some repairs done on the vehicles so that they can continue to run well (a day off the road means big losses). She and her husband, James, have two daughters, Neema, age 8, and Anna, age 3.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To service her business vehicles

loans.name: Enung

texts.en: Enung, 46, and her husband, P., plant banana trees in their garden. They sell the bananas at the market and earn $7 a day. Enung is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of their little banana-growing business

loans.name: Mohinisso

texts.en: K. Mohinisso lives in the J. Rasulov region of Tajikistan and is married with four children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2007. With their help, she has improved her business and opened a trade outlet selling small  household wares. She sells items for everyday use, such as clothespins, pails, and other household goods. Now Mrs. K. is applying for a loan of $625 for 10 months to import goods from suppliers in China.

loans.use: To import small housewares for resale

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
The communal bank of "Light and Life" is the first of its kind in the district of Chicacao in Suchitepequez. The members of this group are very proud to be part of it, and they are very happy that they have been able to keep the group unified, responsible and with good credit after 10 loans. The Friendship Bridge is very proud to have this group in their team.

When I entered the house of Doña Zoila A., our meeting place, I noticed that this group was very mixed. There were a combination of Indigenous and Ladina (Indigenous and Spanish) women. This combination gives the group a very special characteristic since each member brings different aspects from their cultures. Not only that, but there are many types of businesses that these women are doing. In this group, we will find women who will use their loan to raise animals, to purchase inventory for convenience stores, beauty salons, to sell pork meat, to sell hot dogs and refreshments and to run a funeral parlour. Due to the variety of businesses, there is also a variety of personalities in this group such as women who are strong, brave, conservative, extroverts or shy. Even though, there is a lot of variety within the grup, they are still very unified.

The women of "Light and Life" like the idea of working through communal banks because they feel that it unifies the women and motivates them. They also believe that it creates leadership within the group since problems are resolved through the board of directors. Last but not least, they love to work with the Friendship Bridge due to the low interest rates and for all the support they give to all the women in Guatemala.

The dream of all these women is to expand their business and to be profitable. Others want to be able to send their children to college. These women have already made a lot of progress, but they hope for more . They want for their families to be taken care of and to be successful in life, this is why we must help them!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El banco comunal Luz y Vida es el primer banco formado en el distrito de Chicacao, Suchitepequez. Las integrantes de este grupo se sienten realmente orgullosas de ello y no solo de eso. Ellas se dignan de haber sido capaces de mantener un grupo unificado, responsable y cumplidor a lo largo de diez préstamos. The Friendship Bridge también se siente orgulloso de tener este grupo en el equipo.

Al entrar a la casa de doña Zoila A., el lugar de reunión, me di cuenta que este grupo era muy variado. Uno encontraba una combinación de mujeres indígenas y ladinas. Esta combinación le daba al grupo una característica especial al grupo ya que las integrantes llevan consigo los aspectos especiales de sus culturas. No solo eso, sino que también había una variedad de negocios. En este grupo podemos encontrar mujeres que van a invertir su crédito en crianza de pollo, tiendas de consumo diario, perfumería, peluquerías, venta de carne de marrano, venta de hot dogs y gaseosas y una funeraria. Debido a esta variedad, uno podía encontrar distintas personalidades dentro del grupo tales como mujeres aguerridas, valientes, conservadoras, extrovertidas o un poco tímidas. Sin embargo, a pesar de esta variedad la unión del grupo es inigualable.

A las mujeres de Luz y Vida les gusta trabajar bajo la metodología de bancos comunales porque ellas sienten que este estilo de trabajo promueve unidad entre las señoras. Además, creen que promueve liderazgo dentro del grupo ya que cualquier problema es avocado a la junta directiva. Finalmente, a ellas les gusta trabajar con The Friendship Bridge por los bajos intereses y por el apoyo constante que la institución da a las mujeres guatemaltecas.

El sueño de muchas de estas clientas es que su negocio se vuelva sostenible y así ya no tengan que depender de una deuda para poder mantener su negocio. Otras quieren que sus hijos se gradúen del colegio y de la universidad. Estas señoras ya han logrado mucho, sin embargo ellas aspiran a más ¡Ellas quieren que sus familias salgan adelante junto con ellas, es por eso que las tenemos que apoyar!

loans.use: To purchase food supply and refreshments and to raise animals such as pigs and chickens and to run a funeral parlour

loans.name: Idalina's Group

texts.es:
The Committee of Enterprising Women was developed by Fundación Paraguaya as a communal bank that offers credit to enterprising women. This program was formed with consideration for the economic, social, and personal needs of the poorest women in the country.

Thanks to the excellent achievements of past groups, these satisfied women invite other friends or relatives to form a new group. That was how this current group of 17 women was born. They hold many types of commercial activities to generate income for their families.

These women work ceaselessly in order to create a better future for their children, provide them with health and education opportunities that they never had. In this way, their children can have a better quality of life through better jobs. Wives, mothers, and micro entrepreneurs, these women are employed in activities such as: selling food, clothing, lottery tickets and newspapers, fashion, fruit, crafts, chicken; recycling; and managing restaurants.

The loan is an important tool for these women to strengthen their small businesses. The loans will be reinvested in their businesses and the earnings will generate important savings. Today they are asking for a new loan that will be invested in various supplies, such as: fruits, vegetables, chicken, corn, fabrics, threads, plastics and cartons to recycle. They’ll also buy ingredients to make fast food, like: meat, ham, cheese, eggs, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras es un programa desarrollado por Fundación Paraguaya orientado a grupos de mujeres emprendedoras, las cuales crean una banca comunal y a través de la misma reciben que asistencia crediticia. Este programa presta atención a las necesidades económicas, sociales y personales de mujeres de menores recursos en el país.

Gracias a los excelentes logros de los grupos formados, estas señoras satisfechas con su trabajo invitan a otras señoras amigas o parientes a formar sus grupo, es así como nace este comité que hoy día está compuesto por 17 señoras que desempeñan distintos tipos de actividades comerciales para generar ingresos a sus familias.

Estas mujeres trabajan incansablemente con el fin de brindar a sus hijos un porvenir mejor, oportunidades de estudio y salud que ellas no pudieron acceder, de este modo ellos podrán mejorar su calidad de vida obteniendo mejores trabajos. Esposas, madres y microempresarias, estas mujeres desarrollan distintas actividades como: venta de comestibles, venta de ropa, venta de loterías y diarios, modistas, venta de frutas, venta de artesanías, reciclaje, cantinas, venta de pollos, entre otras cosas.

El crédito es una herramienta muy importante para estas mujeres ya que esto ayuda a fortalecer sus micro empresas; los creditos solicitados son reinvertidos en sus negocios y con las ganancias obtenidas ellas generan ahorros importantes. Hoy ellas solicitan un crédito nuevo que será invertido para la compra de mercaderías e insumos varios como: frutas, verduras, pollos, maíz, telas, hilos, plásticos y cartones para recliclar, ingredientes para preparar comidas rápidas como carne, jamón, queso, huevos, harina, etc.

loans.use: Various supplies, such as: fruits, vegetables, chicken, corn, fabrics, threads, plastics and cartons to recycle. Also ingredients to make fast food, like: meat, ham, cheese, eggs, flour, etc.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Approximately 2 months ago, I qualified to obtain low income housing. These are the most affordable houses, which is why they lack window security bars and security doors. I want my parents, who are now elderly, to move into this house because they do not have a steady place in which to live. I am requesting a loan of $1,000.00 in order to install security doors and safety bars on the windows.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace aproximadamente 2 meses que califique para la casa. Estas casas son de las económicas y le esta haciendo falta los protecciones en las ventanas y puertas. Para poderla abitar ya que esa casa lo quiero para mis padres ya que son unas personas grandes de edad y no tiene un lugar estable donde vivir. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la colocación de protecciones en ventanas y puertas.

loans.use: Installation of security doors and window safety bars

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi B., after married to her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Thuy, has been living separately. At first, they did not have starting money for either any business or to raise animals. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund. At first, she borrowed 125 USD to invest in breeding pigs. Since her business went well, she was able to borrow more money to start breeding even ducks and chickens. Her family economy improved and she was able to have a 2-storey house. Currently, she uses the profit from raising the animals to repay weekly. Her family is an examplary one in the Minh Phu town. She has 3 children who are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD. Her family average income is 400 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Khi xây dựng gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Bình cùng anh Nguyễn Văn Thủy được gia đình cho ra ở riêng, ban đầu kinh tế còn gặp nhiều khó khăn, không có vốn làm ăn cũng như chăn nuôi. Năm 2003 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ, vòng vốn ban đầu chị xin vay 2.000.000 đồng đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, bước đầu cho thu nhập. Nhờ chăn nuôi phát triển, gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn cao nhất để mở rộng chăn nuôi như lợn, gà, vịt đẻ trứng nên kinh tế đã phát triển mạnh, gia đình chị hiện đã xây được nhà 2 tầng khang trang và con cái đi học đầy đủ. Hiện tại chị vẫn đang mở rộng chăn nuôi, việc hoàn trả tiền tuần được lấy từ chăn nuôi. Gia đình chị là một điển hình về chăn nuôi của xã Minh Phú, chị có 3 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 6.000.000đ / tháng

loans.use: Buy food for raising animals

loans.name: Rebeca's Edeni Group

texts.en:
Rebeca is 30 years old, married and has three children, ages 11, 9 and 4. She owns a small general store, which she opened in 2005. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m and can earn a monthly profit of about $50.

Rebeca has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She will share this loan with the other member of her group, who runs a small business selling bananas.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of items she has to sell from her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that Ahmad has truly taken to heart. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his two children, for whom he cares with much love. He does this in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him. Ahmad works in farming and also has some cattle. He cultivates potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables depending on the growing season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping care for their cows, and she also sells their milk. They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their two children.

Ahmad and his wife would also like to open a small business some day; until then, they will continue working in their fields. To improve their farming and save money for this future endeavor, Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1000 USD, that he plans to repay in ten months, to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Let’s support Ahmad in his continuous efforts to provide for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Behija

texts.en:
Behija B., born in 1950, lives in Miričina with her husband. Although both retired,  they are busy on their land producing flowers, vegetables and fruits as well as raising livestock.  Behija and her husband are very satisfied with their lives, doing work they enjoy and being well remunerated. 

This is Behija’s first loan request in the amount of $750  to buy reserve food for the cows and calves because they are awaiting new calves. Behija and her husband wish to buy more calves and cows in the future and find good customers for them.

loans.use: To buy food for cattle.

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng H., aged 47, is a widow who lives with three children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling groceries to the people in the village and makes approximately $4.50 each day. Her income is supplemented by two of her children who work at a construction site. Mrs. Theng H. would like to take out a loan of $700 to add more groceries to her inventory.

loans.use: To add groceries to her inventory.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Rosas ubicado en la Av. Yarinacocha Nº 2500, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. En las mañanas se va al mercado a comprar sus productos para su bodega y por las tardes atiende su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, gaseosas, ¼ de huevos, golosinas, etc.

Bertha es una mujer trabajadora y gracias a la ayuda de Manuela Ramos, su negocio ha crecido y desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha R. is a member of the Las Rosas (The Roses) microfinance institute, located on Nº 2500 Yarinacocha Avenue, in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and has 3 grown-up children. She is married, and her husband is self-employed. She decided to invest the first 300.00 loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in soft drink sales. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 3 years.

She currently owns an in-home general store. In the morning, she goes to the market to purchase products for her store, and in the evening, she runs her business.

With this 1,300.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 crates of milk, soft drinks, eggs, candy, etc. Bertha is a hard-working woman who wishes to keep advancing in life. Thanks to Manuela Ramos’ support, her business has grown.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, eggs, candy, etc.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
El negocio al que se dedica la señora Juana J. es a la venta de calcomanías comercializadas en su propio tramo en la ciudad de Chinandega en el mercado central. A este negocio le ha dedicado 14 años de su vida y estas calcomanías son usadas por lo general en los automóviles.

Debido a que ya casi se le agotan las calcomanías, requiere comprar más para comercializarlas y para esto ha solicitado un préstamo en Ceprodel para lograr comprar dichos productos y así ofrecerlos en su sector en el mercado de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana J. sells decals in the Central Market of the city of Chinandega. She has been in business for 14 years of her life, and these decals are generally used on automobiles.

Because she is close to running out of decals, she needs to purchase more, which is why she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel so that she can sell the aforesaid products in her area in the market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase decorative decals

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 54-year-old rice farmer who lives in Boeng Bassac Village in Kampong Cham Province. She has been farming since 1990 and can earn around US$ 2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Lim, 54, works at farming rice with S.. They have two children, both of whom are young and are in school. For another source of income, S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase piglets to raise for sale and pig feed. She expects that the loan will help to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise for sale and pig feed

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Natural de Pusi (Distrito de Huancane), Ana de 31 años ha pasado gran parte de su vida, queriendo salir adelante, es soltera y vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más quiere es que su negocio progrese y así de esta manera mejorar su futuro. Cuando Ana llegó a Juliaca, solo tenia 14 años, pero traía consigo muchos deseos de superarse, así fue que años después, logró poner un negocio de venta de comida y ya son 9 años que lleva en este negocio, atendiendo con las mismas ganas de siempre, es una cocinera con una sazón muy exquisita, lo que hace que su pequeña carretilla de comida, sea la más visitada del mercado. Ella se divierte mucho cocinando para la gente, puesto que le encanta cocinar, anhela que su negocio prospere y poner un restaurante donde pueda atender mucho mejor a sus clientes y es que los días lluviosos le traen a Ana, muchas dificultades en sus ventas y no la dejan progresar como ella quisiera. Es el primer préstamo que Ana adquiere en Microfinanzas PRISMA y quiere cumplir con todas sus cuotas, porque sabe que ha adquirido una responsabilidad con su banco comunal y con ella misma. Ana quiere aumentar su capital y así poder comprar más víveres, para cocinar para más gente, además necesita arreglar su triciclo, ya que el paso de los años ha desgastado su funcionamiento.
texts.en:
Born in Pusi (District of Huancane), 31-year-old Ana, has spent most of her life trying to make ends meet. She is single. She lives at a rented house and her biggest dream is to see her business grow, to have a better future. When Ana arrived to Juliaca, she was only 14 years old, but she was committed to succeed. That is how years later she managed to open a food shop, which she’s been running for 9 years. She is an exquisite cook, which makes her small food wheelbarrow the most popular of the market. She has a great time cooking for other people. As she loves what she does, she also hopes her business would improve and even to have a restaurant in the future where she can still serve her customers during rainy days when it’s very difficult to make sales. This is the first loan she is requesting from Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is very confident she will make all payments in time, as she knows this is an important responsibility for her. Ana would like to increase her capital to purchase more provisions to be able to cook for more people. She also needs to fix her tricycle due to wear and tear.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions to prepare food for her customers

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced with one daughter. She sells women's clothing at several locations. She started her business 13 years ago. At that time there were few people with similar goods. Today Galina understands that having several locations is a real advantage over her competitors. Galina is very entrepreneurial and a hard-working person. Recently, she started new business - selling small home equipment. She is thinking about developing it further, provided sales are good.

Galina would like to receive a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase her inventories. Her business is the only source of income for Galina and her daughter.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Orquídeas”, vive en el Jr. Huascar - Colegio Tarapoto,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos independientes. 

Se inició, con S/. 50.00 y fue por iniciativa propia decidió emprender su negocio y empezó vendiendo refrigerios en un Colegio. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un Kiosco especialmente  acondicionado, dentro del Colegio; donde vende comidas preparadas como juanes, tamalitos, arroz  chaufa,  arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, canchitas y en bebidas gaseosas, refrescos y jugos. 

Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará en un  plazo de 06  meses, comprará productos como arroz y azúcar en sacos; aceites en galones y gaseosas en paquetes; para la prepación de sus alimentos diarios. Sus principales clientes son los alumnos, docentes y administrativos.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que ahora es muy independiente, seguro y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Juana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to "Orchids" community bank. She lives in Jr. Huascar in the Tarapoto district in the department of San Martín, Peru. She's a 44-year-old married mother of three, all grown up and independent. She started with 50 soles and on her own initiative decided to start her business and began selling snacks at a local school. Currently she continues doing the same job and now has a specially arranged kiosk inside the school where she sells prepared food such as tamales, different rice dishes, candy and other snacks, fried bananas, popcorn, along with soft drinks, juices and other beverages. With the loan of 3,000 soles, which she plans to repay in six months, she will purchase products such as sacks of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, and packages of soft drinks for her daily food preparation. Her main customers are the students, teachers and administrators at the school, and she makes the decisions of what to do with the earnings. Personally, she tells us that now she is very independent, secure and responsible with her payments. Juana gives her thanks to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and a person.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as sacks of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, and packages of soft drinks for her daily food preparation

loans.name: Ruqaiya M.aslam Group

texts.en:
My name is Ruqaiya. I am 37 years old and reside in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its Punjabi foods and historical places. I am uneducated because my parents couldn’t pay for my education. My husband's name is M. Aslam. He also lives in Lahore and has run a rented motorbikes business for the last 5 years. I have three kids: two sons and one daughter. My elder son works in a factory on a monthly wage and my younger son works in a shoe shop as a salesman. My daughter reads in the 10th standard. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now I am applying again for a loan to buy another motorbike to expand my husband’s rented motorbikes business. 

I am the group leader of one other woman from my locality. Najma baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for rented bikes business

loans.name: Carmel Joy

texts.en:
Ms. Carmel Joy A., 25 years of age, is single and has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for almost two years. She lives with her parents but she has an existing sari-sari store to generate her own income.

Now she has obtained another loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 intended for the purchase of assorted grocery stocks for display. She dreams that someday she can expand her business and have more income to help her parents financially.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Mme T. Akouwa est âgée d’une quarantaine d’années avec cinq (05) enfants en charge. Elle réussit  bien dans son commerce de charbon de bois, lequel commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et surtout à la scolarisation de ses enfants. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour stocker en grande quantité du charbon et satisfaire régulièrement sa clientèle. Avec le revenu de son commerce, elle contribuera aux conditions d’existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Akouwa is 40-something and has 5 children to support. Her business is successful, and this enables her to provide for her family, especially for schooling for her children. This is why she's requesting financing, so as to build up a large quantity of charcoal and to satisfy her customers regularly. With the revenues from her commerce, she will help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell charcoal

loans.name: Herry

texts.en: Herry A. A. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through senior high. Herry has been selling Mobile Phones and their accessories, in Abura, for 2 years. Herry uses his income to pay for feeding himself and for other personal expenses. Herry will use the loan to purchase a variety of more modern mobile phones to resell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Herry plans to re-invest into his business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of more modern mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia C. is forty-four years old and married with seven children, three sons and four daughters. They are in the senior high, junior high and the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Felicia and her husband run a chop bar business (outdoor food vending) by the roadside in her community. She has two hired hands who work for her. Felicia has been in business for twenty-one years and wants a loan to buy food stuffs and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
Y. Phạm THị (1047061258) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. Married with two school-aged children, Y. raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising water buffalo for sale. Y. has been engaged in this business for over six years, earning approximately 2500000 VND a month.

In 2003, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be her sixth from TYM Fund, and Y. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: James

texts.en: Since 2004, James A. has been selling car engine oil and other lubricants in Abura. James has received a junior high school education.  He is married and has one child. His wife is a trader. She is responsible for paying fees. His loan will be used to buy more engine oil for resale. He hopes to save the new profits from his business to re-invest.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for resale.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza es socia, del Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 5 hijos y presenta estudios de primaria completa, vive en el Urb. Asiruni.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 06 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de frutas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de plátanos, piñas, naranjas, mandarinas, papayas, plátanos  y otras frutas.

Su sueño es poner un Kiosco de frutas bien surtido y vender al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros además la puntualidad de sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the 3 De Mayo II Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 38, married, and has five children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Urb. Asiruni. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost six years. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to buy fruit. She now needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy bananas, pineapples, oranges, tangerines, papayas, and other fruit. Her dream is to set up a well stocked kiosk and to sell wholesale. She likes the savings and get-togethers (of her community bank). She also likes her colleagues’ punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, pineapples, oranges, tangerines, papayas, and other fruit

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo, quien trabaja en las minas y sus hijas: Lucero de 14, Katherine de 7 y  Carolina de un año y medio, en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedido, actividad que es un soporte para su familia, ya que muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo no es suficiente para todos los gastos del hogar. Es por ello que Rosa se siente feliz, pues se siente independiente y de utilidad para el desarrollo de su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que visita a sus vecinas y amigas y de paso va vendiendo su mercadería, aunque muchas veces algunas de sus clientas se demoran en los pagos y tiene que visitarlas muy frecuentemente. Pero con la experiencia, ya está manejando este aspecto mucho mejor, por lo que ahora sus ventas son muy rentables. En un futuro Rosa quisiera tener una tienda grande donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería, pero lamentablemente la zona en la que vive aun no es muy comercial. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual con todas sus cuotas, al igual que todo su grupo, el cual es muy estricto a la hora de los pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar sus ventas y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes  es una mujer sencilla y dinámica, tiene 62 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad que la apoyan mucho. Ella tiene una bodega y trabaja junto a una de sus hijas, también es propietaria de un motokar que la ayuda a generar un poco más de ingresos económicos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Guadalupe”, desde hace cuatro años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo invirtió en la apertura de su bodega. 
Con este crédito de S/ 1,700 nuevos soles, comprará un motokar y algunos productos para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.
La meta de Mercedes es seguir trabajando para poderse comprar otro motokar y de esta manera apoyar en los estudios a su sobrino que aún es menor de edad.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a very down to earth and dynamic woman. She is 62, and she has seven grown children who give her a lot of support. She has a convenience store, and she works with one of her daughters. She also has a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart), which helps her generate a little more income. She has been a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank for four years. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to open her store. With this loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy a motocarro and some products like rice, sugar, noodles, and milk, etc. for her store. Mercedes’ goal is to keep working to be able to buy another motocarro. This way she can help her nephew, who is still a minor, with his education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store and buy a motocarro

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, se dedica a la actividad de la pesca junto a su esposo y también a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, ella vende pescado al por mayor en el puerto de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Esmeraldas” desde hace tres años, donde se caracteriza  por estar siempre alegre, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en ropa de segundo uso.
Con este préstamo de 1800 soles, piensa invertirlo en la compra de un motor para su bote. La meta de Milena es poder comprarse otro bote que le facilita el transporte de su pescado.
texts.en:
Milena is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She is 52 years old and the mother of 7 adult children who are independent. Milena and her husband work together selling fish, while she also has another business selling secondhand clothing. Her wholesale fish business is located in the port city of Pucallpa. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Esmeraldas” for 3 years, where she is known for always being in a good mood. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy secondhand clothing.

With this loan of 1800 soles, Milena will buy a motor for her boat. Her goal is to be able to buy another boat to help her transport fish.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for her boat

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Née le 18 Septembre 1975 à Dassa-Zoumè au centre du Bénin, T. Emilienne a arrêté très tôt les classes au primaire. Emilienne réside depuis trente ans dans le quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Emilienne est mariée à ALLOVOGBEGNON Prosper, un électricien bâtiment. Le couple a un enfant qui n’a pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. Les charges de la famille sont supportées à la fois par Emilienne et son mari. Emilienne est une couturière de formation qui vend des habits et du charbon qu’elle distribue. Emilienne a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs obtenus à ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son activité en s’approvisionnant en tissus pour la conception d’habits, Emilienne sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Emilienne envisage plus tard vendre des sacs de charbon.
texts.en:
Born on 18 September 1975 in Dassa-Zoumè in central Benin, Emilienne T. stopped going to school very early on in primary school. Emilienne has been living for thirty years in the Agbodjèdo district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Emilienne is married to Prosper Allovogbegnon, a building electrician. The couple has one child who is not yet old enough to go to school. The household expenses are taken care of by both Emilienne and her husband. Emilienne is a dressmaker by training and sells clothing and charcoal. Emilienne repaid the previous loans she obtained through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) without problems. With the goal of strengthening her business by supplying herself with fabric to make dresses, Emilienne is seeking a new loan through ALIDÉ. In the future, Emilienne foresees selling bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) to make and sew clothing

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en: Jumanne S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and married man. He runs a business of selling coconuts at Kariakoo city market. He purchases the business goods direct from the producers in wholesale, and he sells them to retail customers. He has five children; four are in primary school, and one is in secondary school. He lives in a rented house. The business income meets the daily family demand and also meets the children's school fees. He needs a loan of 600,000 TZS to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to meet customer demand

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA CONCEPCIÓN G. V. tiene 41 años, vive en el distrito de FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Maria estudió hasta 5º de secundaria. La socia es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Maria se dedica a la preparación y venta de bocaditos, le hacen pedidos y los lleva a repartir. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró moldes, harina (en sacos), vainilla, pasas, guindones, chocolate en barra, pasas, etc  para cubrir sus pedidos, los cuales aumentan cada día mas.  Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará moldes para vender panetones grandes y pequeños, los cuales los venderá recorriendo las calles de Trujillo y abastecera bodegas de su distrito. 
Maria sueña con tener su propio stand donde vender sus bocaditos y panetones para la navidad.
texts.en:
MARIA CONCEPCIÓN G. V. is 41 years old, and lives in the FLORENCIA DE MORA district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. Maria studied until the 5th year of secondary school. This member is single, and has 3 children who depend on her financially. Maria dedicates herself to making and selling baked snacks, which she creates on order and then delivers to customers. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles, she bought molds, flour (in sacks), vanilla, raisins, prunes, baking chocolate, etc., to cover her orders which grow each day. With this loan of 500 soles, she will buy molds to make large and small panetones (loaf-like cake, typically served during holidays), which she will sell throughout the streets of Trujillo and to grocery stores in her district. Maria dreams of having her own food stand where she can sell her snacks and panetones for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase molds to make large and small panetones.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
S. Batdorj is 25 years old and lives with his wife and infant son in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife is currently unemployed and watches after 1-year-old Batstooj. Batdorj operates a meat and dairy trading business in his town. His work is seasonal as he sells meat mainly in the spring months and dairy products in the winter. Batdorj started his business in 2008 and has made progress in his first year of operation. As the winter months are quickly approaching, he is currently busy prepping his dairy business for a successful season. Batdorj is a very hardworking entrepreneur and has very good character. He is focused on growing his business in the future and providing a quality life for his new son. He recently used his earnings to begin construction on a new house for his family. Batdorj is requesting a 705,000 tugrug (~496 USD) loan to purchase dairy products to sell this winter season.



About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh A. is a 43-year-old entrepreneur who sells spare parts in his own spare parts shop. He is married and has 2 children, who are the apple of his eye. He started his business in 1998, when he couldn’t find a job in his city. He borrowed money from his friends, and with starting capital of $100 he began selling car headlights. He says that his main goal is to save enough money to build his own store, so he doesn't need to spent money on rent. He wishes to provide his children with the best education, and for this purpose he applied for a 1,600 AZN loan. This loan will help him to improve his living conditions and save money for his children’s future education.

loans.use: To purchase more car spare parts

loans.name: Creselene

texts.en:
Creselene D. is from the village of Mansabay Alto Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Creselene is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Creselene owns & operates a business growing and selling dried coconut "copra" in the local community. Creselene has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Creselene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Creselene is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Creselene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase coconut fertilizer

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn B. is from the village of Catarman in Camiguin {rovince. She is 30 years old. Genalyn is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Genalyn sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand business. This will be Genalyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 32 años, ella es profesional en turismo, ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes como recepcionista, ya son 5 años que trabaja en la agencia. Rocio también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de joyas de material de oro y plata, ella nos cuenta que elabora las joyas en su pequeño taller que implemento es su domicilio. Rocio forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, desde hace un año, ella requiere el préstamo de los 1300 soles, que invertirá en la compra de oro y plata. Rocio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Rocio is an enterprising woman and worker. She lives in the city of Cusco, is 32 years of age and is a professional in the tourism industry. She has been working in a tourist agency as a receptionist for 5 years. Rocio also has a small business selling jewelry and gold and silver. She tells us that she makes the jewelry in her small workshop that she created in her home. Rocio has belonged to the community bank, Inti (a word from the Quechua language that means “Sun”) of the Arariwa Association for one year. She needs a loan of 1300 PEN that she will invest in the buying of gold and silver. Rocio is thankful for the opportunity through this means and is committed to paying back her loan on time and according to the payment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying gold and silver for the making of jewelry

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita V. lives in Barangay 18A, Purok 3, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Crestita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Crestita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Crestita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Crestita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crestita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Crestita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Crestita's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhem N. is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Pongro village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Dieng Long, are farmers who own a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice.

In her farming, Mrs. Nhem N. does not have enough money to support her field. Thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crop.

Aside from farming her husband is also a duck breeder who is able to make a small income to support the family. This couple has five children between the ages of 1 and 17. Three of their children are currently in school and help their parents in this business. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice field

loans.name: Margarita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Margarita está integrado por Manuela M., Yolanda M. y Perla D. tres féminas emprendedoras. La coordinadora  del grupo es la señora Manuela M., quien recuerda como si fuera ayer como en 1994 sus compañeros de trabajo pensando que ella vendía cosas y le encargaban ropa, zapatos, cosméticos…etc., de  ese hecho le surge la idea de empezar a comercializar ropa y cosméticos por encargo en lo cual le ha ido muy bien. 

Su compañera de grupo Perla D. desde hace ocho años comenzó realizando cobertores de tiras actualmente por medio de los préstamo además de producir mayor cantidad de dicho producto, realiza y vende ropa de cama (sabanas, fundas, cubrecamas) y cojines.  Mientras Yolanda M. se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras.

 Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios Manuela con el comprara mayor cantidad de mercadería especialmente veraniega por la temporada, Perla invertirá en materiales como telas, hilos, elásticos…etc. y Yolanda en la compra de cosechas de frutas y verduras de temporada.
texts.en:
The Margarita group is made up of Manuela M., Yolanda M., and Perla D., three entrepreneurial women. The coordinator of the group is Manuela M., who remembers like it was yesterday when in 1994 her co-workers asked her to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for them. From this experience she decided to start a business selling clothing and cosmetics by orders, and she has had a lot of success. Fellow group member Perla D. has worked for eight years making blankets. With the loan money she will make more blankets as well as making and selling linens (sheets and bed covers) and cushions. Meanwhile, Yolonad M. works selling fruits and vegetables. They will use the loan money on their respective business. Manuela will buy more merchandise for the summer season. Perla will buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other products, and Yolanda will buy fruits and vegetables that are in season.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, sewing materials, and fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with a boy, 10, and a girl, 4, who both attend school. She rents her home and cites school fees, electricity, water, and rent as her greatest expenses.  Her husband is a driver and she is a matatu (taxi van) operator.  She also owns two matatus of her own. 

Florence would like to open another business selling dry fish and mitumba (second-hand clothes) with her 80,000 KES loan.  She hopes to provide her children with a good education and with assets. She decided to join Yehu because she believes that it is a good microfinance institution that can help women who are low-income earners.

loans.use: Dry fish and second hand clothes

loans.name: God Willing Group

texts.en:
Comfort H. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called 'God Willing'. She is 31 years old, single, and has two children who are 7 and 13 years old. She was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 15 years, Comfort has been selling foodstuffs such as rice and oil in the Fiamah Community in Monrovia, Liberia. She has good human relations with her customers which keeps them returning.

Comfort started by selling cola nuts but now sells on a table and hopes to improve to a better standard in the near future.  She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice, oil, and peppers.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Comfort is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and pepper

loans.name: Chinheng

texts.en: Mr. Chinheng M. is a villager in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province. He was born in 1955. He is a farmer who owns more than a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Cheav Hor Khuy, is a rice and coffee seller in the local village. They try to work hard with their careers, but they can't earn enough income. So to improve their family living conditions, Mr. Chinheng M. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets and pig food to start a new business breeding pigs. He is the father of five children. One of the children is a fruit seller, one is a motorbike taxi driver,  one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending the local public school. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig food

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 17 años que se dedica en la venta de medicinas y productos naturales, es por ello que viaja constantemente, en compañía de su esposo, a varias ciudades para venderlos en las ferias comerciales. A cada ciudad que va, tiene un puesto de venta, eso le da ventaja para establecerse el tiempo que dura las ferias en dicha localidad. En tanto cuando tiene que abastecerse de estos productos, tiene que viajar a la ciudad capital para adquirirlos. Con el manejo adecuado de sus ganancias ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo, debido a que sus productos tienen mucha demanda, por tal motivo desea tener una movilidad propia para transportar sus productos a otras ciudades. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y de esa manera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Alicia is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. For the past 17 years she has sold medicine and natural products. For this reason, she is constantly travelling, along with her husband, to various cities in order to sell products at commercial markets. In each city where she goes she has a booth, which gives her an advantage by allowing her to establish herself in the time that the market lasts in each location.
