When she needs to stock up on products, she has to travel to the capital city to acquire them. With careful management of her earnings, she has been able to increase her working capital. Because her products are in great demand, she would like to have her own vehicle in order to transport her products to other cities. This is her sixth credit with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. She considers this loan to be instrumental in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is soliciting, she will buy more merchandise and in this way increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more natural products.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina trabaja como educadora en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz; esta es su única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Mallasilla  de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa de su tía.
El crédito será destinado para educación (trámites y pago de docente, para titulo de licenciatura en ciencias de la educación).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  y con este crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yanina works as an educator in the Alto Obrajes area of the city of La Paz. This is the only source of income that she has. Her address is located in the Mallasilla area of the city of La Paz, in her aunt's house. This loan will be used for education (processing and staff payment for the BA degree in Educational Science). This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from Impro, and she can improve her income and quality of life with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The cost of the processing to obtain her degree in Communication Science.

loans.name: Alet

texts.en:
Alet D. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize flour, rice and beans, and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Alet is 39 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Walter Ufredo

texts.es:
Walter Ufredo A. T. tiene 37 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. No tiene  hijos. 

Walter es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar un terreno. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta cuidar animales.
texts.en:
Walter Ufredo A. T. is 37 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes Canton, Recinto San Jose, Estero Salado Parish. He does not have children. Walter is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank. It is located fifteen minutes from Estero Salado Parish and two hours from the agency in Chillanes. This bank has 19 members. The Community works in agriculture. Walter works in agriculture, growing cocoa beans. He makes his purchases every month in Matilde Esther. He also makes his sales in Matilde Esther. Walter is requesting the loan to buy cocoa beans for planting to expand his business. He thinks the loan is a chance to get ahead. His dream is to have money to buy land. The challenge he faces is at harvest time, since the access roads are damaged by the rain. He likes taking care of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cocoa beans to plant

loans.name: Zoila Blanca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Zoila; ella tiene 56 años de edad y La socia es casada ella tiene 2 hijos, ella trabaja en el INPE, instituto nacional y penitencial del estado; ella está aún en servicio y ayuda a sus hijos en sus estudios superiores, La socia está mejorando su casita comprando algunos nuevos muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un par de muebles.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite mejorar su casita y su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Mrs Zoila; she is 56, married, and has 2 children. She works in the INPE, a national institute and the state penitentiary. She is in service and helps her children in their higher studies. She is improving her small house through buying various new furniture. She is requesting this loan to purchase some furniture. She infinitely appreciates and values this loan, since it will allow her to improve her small home and her quality of life. She also promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of furniture

loans.name: Fiapule

texts.en: Fiapule T. is 34 and married with three children. She plants and harvests taro for sale. Fiapule has five years of experience in this business. Fiapule needs a loan of 2,500 Samoan talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or $146 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family. In 2007, Fiapule joined SPBD. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fiapule's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela L. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada. 
Al negocio le está haciendo variedad de mercancía ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir, es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar la mercancía.
Planea pagarlo con el ingreso que obtiene de su negocio, ya que sus dos hijos que tiene le ayudaran con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Estela L. has been selling used clothes for over five years. Her business lacks a variety of merchandise. However, at this time she does not have the money to invest in her business. That is why she is requesting a loan to be able to buy the merchandise. She plans on paying for the loan with the income from her business. Her two children will help with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas O. is 33 years old, married to a tailor and has two children: ages 2 and 3 years old. They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. His business is located in a busy market in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for the production of sugar cane. He has been selling sugar, soft drinks, cooking fat and salt for four years now and has one employee. Silas says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to restock. He hopes to purchase a plot of land and build his own house in the future. He describes himself as very hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soft drinks, cooking fat and salt

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José Manuel es guardia D. seguridad D. un centro comercial al cual le ha prestado 4 años D. su servicio con lealtad. Ahora el se ve en la necesidad D. hacer mejoras a su vivienda como lo es poner piso cerámico en uno D. los cuartos para que D. mejor vista a su casa.
texts.en: Jose Manuel is a security guard in a shopping center where he has served with loyalty for 4 years. Now he feels the need to make improvements to his house, such as putting in a ceramic tile floor in one of the rooms, so that the house looks better.

loans.use: floor tile

loans.name: Galdis Karina

texts.es:
Gladis de 32 años, tiene una tienda de víveres y dulces en la parte delantera de su casa, es madre soltera con dos hijas y viven en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Empezó en 1995 con la venta de un terreno en la ciudad de Esmeraldas ya que decidió vivir en Guayaquil y tener una pequeña tienda. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ha podido aumentar su tienda con vivieres, trabaja desde las 06h00am después de enviar a su hija a la escuela. Vende la libra de arroz $ 0.30, la libra de azúcar a $ 0.25, el litro de aceite a $ 1.10 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas y ropa para tener otro ingreso adicional en la tienda y arroz. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y que sus hijas obtengan una beca estudiantil.
texts.en:
Gladis, 32, has a grocery and candy store in the front part of her house.  She is a single mother of two daughters.  They live in a periurban area called Fortín that is noted for its hilly, unpaved streets.

She started out in 1995 when she sold a lot in the city of Esmeraldas having decided to move to Guayaquil and open a small store.  Gradually she’s been able to stock her store with foodstuffs.  She opens her business at 6am after sending her daughter to school.  She sells a pound of rice for $0.30, a pound of sugar for $0.25 and a liter of cooking oil for $1.10, etc.

She wants to use to loan both to buy display cases and clothes so that she can have an additional source of income in the store and to buy rice.

In the future she’d like finish building her house and that her daughters obtain a scholarship.

loans.use: For display cases, rice and clothes.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende”, perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Él  tiene un puesto de verduras hace 30 años en la misma feria, cercana a su hogar.  Padece de sordera debido a un asalto, hace varios años atrás, en el que sufrió  golpes en su cabeza. 
Trabaja 2 días a la semana y lo acompañan a vender, a veces, su esposa o una de sus hijas. Con este préstamo comprará verduras. 
Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ya que la que arrendaba, se derrumbó por completo debido al terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, Vivió entonces por casi dos meses a la intemperie junto a su familia, es decir su esposa, su hija, su yerno y sus 2 nietas de 15 y 5 años,  hasta que por medio de Fondo Esperanza obtuvo una mediagua (vivienda temporal hecha de paneles de madera). 
Está muy agradecido de Fondo Esperanza, no solo por la gran ayuda que le han sido los préstamos, por sus bajos intereses, sino que también por el apoyo después del terremoto. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Pedro is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in the district of San Vicente de Tagua Tagua.  He has had a vegetable stall in the same market near his home for 30 years.  He suffers from deafness because he was assaulted several years ago and suffered blows to the head.

He works 2 days a week and sometimes his wife or one of his daughters will accompany him and help him with his sales.  He will use this loan to buy vegetables.

Pedro's dream is to have his own home since the one which he was renting completely collapsed as a result of the earthquake which occurred on the 27th of February this year.  Following the earthquake, he lived for two months in the open air together with his family, that is to say his wife, his daughter, his son-in-law and his 2 granddaughters aged 15 and 5, until he obtained a 'mediagua' (a temporary dwelling made from wood boards) through Fondo Esperanza.

Pedro is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza not only for the great help which they have been to him with their loans and their low interest rates but also for the support they gave him after the earthquake.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia M. A. is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is a very active and supportive lady. She has given birth to two daughters and two sons. Her first two children are enrolled in school and getting their education while the younger ones are younger than four years of age. 

Razia has applied for a loan for her husband’s cosmetics shop. He sells ladies' cosmetic products. He rents the shop, which is located in the busy market. With the loan, he will buy a variety of cosmetics products such as foundation, eye shadow, mascara and blusher for selling through his shop. The cosmetic products will allow him to offer more variety to his customers and make more sales and income. He has been in this business for the past 10 years and Razia is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for his business.
 
Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Edelma Esperanza

texts.es:
EDELMA ESPERANZA M. O. 
  es casada  tiene 49 años de edad, , tiene 3 hijos  todos mayores de edad los cuales trabajan por su cuenta. hace 12 años cuando ella y su esposo iniciaron su negocio  con un pequeño ahorro vendiendo regalos los cuales  le generaban buenas ganancia las cuales pudo  invertir  en la  compra de ropa de niños y adultos, trastes colchas vajilla, agradece primeramente a Dios y Fape que le brinden la oportunidad en  darle un crédito para  invertirlo en productos de usos domesticos,ropa,zapatos, colchas, para su tienda y poder salir adelante con su familia, el sueño que ella tiene es poderle comprar un terreno a cado uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edelma Esperanza M. O. is 49 years old, married, and has three grown children who work on their own. Twelve years ago, she and her husband started their business with a small amount of savings. They sell gifts that generate good profits and invest the funds in the purchase of clothing for children and adults, blankets, dishes, and silverware.

Edelma is primarily grateful to God and to FAPE for providing her this credit opportunity to invest in household products, clothing, shoes, and blankets for her store so that she can move her family forward. Her dream is to buy a plot of land for each of her children.

loans.use: Purchase household products, clothing, shoes, and blankets

loans.name: Sacro Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "SACRO"; la socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Qollana distrito de Chincheros y provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eulalia: ella tiene 44 años de edad ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos;  la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos agrícolas, la socia tiene sus terrenos y siembra maíz, papa, verduras y los vende al por mayor y menor, la socia también cría animale smenores y los engorda y los vende luego de procrearse, la socia tiene en cruz pata sus ganados y desde el año 2000 ella viene comprando cada ves que puede ganados pequeños y los cría y divide su tiempo con mucho esmero y cariñoi en estas sus tres actividades, La socia ahora desea ahorrar un poco para poder comprar otro animal vacuno para aumentar su producción y venta de animales y también invertirá en la compra de semillas para la agricultura. La foto tiene anexada a ela tres socios uno es el Sr Doroteo, que por motivos de salud no pudo estar presente el día de la reunión, y vino hasta la oficina en Cusco para que se le otorgue el permiso; Las otras dos Sras: son Valeria y Fidelia, las socias se fueron a sus chacras muy temprano por la mañana cuando aún el grupo no se reunia y esta foto fué tomada tres días despues de igual modo a la otra socia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de un pequeño ganado y de semillas para la agricultura.
Los otros socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la crianza de animales menores, a la venta de comidas, a las obras de gasfitería y albañilería.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulalia belongs to the “SACRO” community bank.  She lives in the rural community of Qollana, in Chincheros district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Eulalia is 44 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She buys and sells farming products.  She has land of her own where she grows corn, potatoes and vegetables which she sells wholesale and retail.  She also raises young animals that she fattens and then sells.  She has cattle in Cruz Pata and since the year 2000 she has been buying young cattle as often as she can to raise.  She divides her time with great care between her three business activities.  She would now like to save a little so that she can buy another cow to increase her animal production and sale business.  She will also invest in buying seeds for her farm.

Eulalia is requesting her loan to invest in buying a young cow and seeds.  The other members of the group work in livestock farming, crop farming, raising young animals, selling meals, plumbing and construction work.

Eulalia is grateful for the loan that she is being offered and she pledges to continue working hard so that she can make her repayments and improve her business.

loans.use: To invest in each of her three businesses

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, es madre soleta, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad. Maximiliana es feriante. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería, vende ropas como: buzos, blusas, faldas, entre otros para damas caballeros y niños.
Viaja a la feria de Seccelambras los días sábados, a Allpachaca los días jueves y Pampa cangallo los días miércoles. Le gusta Finca, porque le capacitan en negocio, familia, salud, le dan créditos y ahorra.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 15 and 12. Maximiliana is a saleswoman.  

The loan that she seeks will be invested in buying clothing to stock her merchandise; she sells clothing such as : track suits, blouses, skirts and other items for men, women and children.

She travels to the Seccelambras market on Saturdays, to Allpachaca on Thursdays, and Pampa Cangallo on Wednesdays. She likes Finca because Finca educates her about business, family, health, provides loans and she can save money.

Her dream is that her business grows and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Buy a variety of seasonal clothing

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mr. Suon R. is a villager who lives in Reang Dek village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Doeuk Vann, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice for family living. With this farming, they don’t have enough money for growing crop. So Mr. Suon R. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, and gasoline for cultivating rice. Aside from farmer, Mr. Suon R. is also earns his living through fishing in the local village.
This couple has four children; two of whom are attending in the local school and the others are too young to study or work. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, and gasoline for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Degddorj

texts.en:
Degddorj, 34, is married and lives with his wife and 3 children in a 'ger', Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His oldest daughter attends  a local primary school. They have been living in the same place for 6 years. He has been operating firewood trading business for 2 years. He buys the wood which comes loaded on a big truck and sells it in a local market. He owns a mini truck on which he transports the wood to the market. He transports one truckload of wood with 5 or 6 trips in his own vehicle. 

Degddorj wants to buy a new and bigger truck that he can transport the wood easily and reduce his expenses for petrol. He is eager to enlarge his business so that he can make more profit to support his family without difficulty. He is a hard-working and active person who wants to become an independent businessman in the future. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his truck and more firewood.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Pav

texts.en:
Pav S. is a 47-year-old farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Pav S. is married to Chea Kosal, age 48. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has five children: two are now married and three are single. One of their children is a sewing worker at the garment factory in Phnom Penh City. 

Pav S. used her land to plant rice crop and vegetables two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and gasoline. With the rest of the funds she will pay for harvesting costs (renting a few laborers).

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline and to pay for harvesting costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing additional stock for making food to sell

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Teopista has been in the pub business for 3 years, and she works 7 days a week.  She sells her products from her home by means of retail. She also generates additional income by renting rooms.  She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin. The main business challenge for Teopista is seasonality .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase of firewood to bake his bricks.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 22-year-old married woman who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has one child.  After realizing that her husband could not solely provide for the family, she decided to venture into shoe selling.  Her dream is to set up a stable income-generating activity.

Priscilla has been in this kind of business for four years and the business is profitable despite the challenge of irregular sales.  Nonetheless, she desires to set up a boutique.  Priscilla is seeking the loan to buy shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell.

loans.name: Adelanta's Group

texts.en:
Adelanta C. is from the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Adelanta is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Adelanta is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Adelanta owns & operates a general store selling food & daily use products in the local community. Adelanta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 19000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Adelanta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional groceries to sell. 

Adelanta is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP to purchase more groceries inventory to sell. This will be her 11th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is widowed, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Rosalina has a banana business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her stall.

Rosalina has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her stall

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Jariatu is 42 years old and married with three children who are 8, 12 and 15 years old.  In 2005, Jariatu established her assorted drink business.  She started the business to help her husband support their family.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month. 

Jariatu requests a Le 4,000,000 loan.  She has received and successfully repaid one loan and needs the new loan to buy more assorted drinks to sell.  Specifically, she will buy 60 crates of canned soft drinks that cost Le 24,000 each, 30 crates of hard drinks at Le 60,000 each, and 20 crates of bottled drinks at Le 48,000 each.  Jariatu hopes this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Jariatu plans to educate her children to the university level. She is very determined and hardworking.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase 114 crates of assorted drinks for sale.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 39 years old. She is a married woman who has 7 children. She is engaged in rice and animal farming. She tills her land to grow rice crops. She also raises chickens to sell. Corazon works hard to provide for the needs of her household.

Corazon has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and chickens to raise. She hopes that this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chickens to raise.

loans.name: No One Knows Tomorrow Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born 45 years ago in Magburaka. She is married to a trader and the couple has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. With nearly thirty years of experience in business, Fatmata sells biscuits, batteries, soap, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. 

This is not the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this new loan, however, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business; she will buy biscuits, batteries, soap, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, batteries, soap, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and a mother of three grown children. Juliet has a small market at home. She sells grocery items to earn a living. She sells basic food items, food ingredients, laundry soap and dish washing bars. She has been engaged in this type of business for over three years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 from these activities. Juliet has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to purchase grocery stock and soft drinks to sell.

Juliet has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Juliet hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more stock and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Alexandra

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lidia, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 9, 7 y 1 año de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. Lleva seis años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por la ayuda que le dan.

Ella es una ama de casa que desde muchos años atrás se ha dedicado al trabajo con el fin de ganarse algo propio, nos cuenta que ella trabajaba en una fábrica de botones de tagua y que con los créditos que ha recibido poco a poco fue comprando lo necesario para poder poner su propia empresa y fue hasta hace tres años que al fin empezó a elaborar botones de tagua por su propia cuenta, empezó con muy poco y en la actualidad ya cuenta con dos maquinas que sirven para elaborar estos productos, nos comenta que todas las semanas ella entrega sus productos a comerciantes que luego los venden a exportadores para que los lleven  a otros países y les den el terminado a los botones. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ayuda de una hermana a quien le paga un sueldo mensual.

Este crédito es para comprar tagua y otros mariales para elaborar los botones.

Sus sueños son tener una empresa mucho más grande y maquinarias para dar un producto terminado.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Lidia. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children (ages 9, 7, and 1). The two older children are in school. Her husband is a merchant. Lidia has been with the Communal Bank for six years and enjoys the convenience of requesting loans and the help they provide.

She is a homemaker who has worked for many years to earn her own income. Lidia says she worked at a factory that produces buttons made of “tagua” (a material derived from a certain palm tree that has the appearance of elephant ivory). Using the loans she received, Lidia gradually bought what she needed to start her own business. Three years ago, she started making tagua buttons on her own. Lidia started with very little and now she has two machines that are used for making her products. Every week she delivers her products to merchants who eventually sell them to exporters that ship them to other countries where finishing touches are added to the buttons. Lidia works Monday through Saturday with the help of her sister, who is paid a monthly salary.

This loan will be used to buy tagua and other materials for making buttons. Her dreams are to have a much larger business and to acquire machines for adding finishing touches to her products.

loans.use: to purchase tagua and other materials for making buttons.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 36 years old. She is married and has three children aged between 11 and 18. 
Everlyne runs a grocery shop at Makongeni in Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years now and says her major challenge is financial constraints. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to add stock of onions, eggs and potatoes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to wholesale in future. She describes herself as social, ambitious and God-fearing.

loans.use: to purchase onions, eggs and potatoes.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is a 45-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a driver in a locA. company since 2009. In parallel, he also works as a part-timer in another company to earn extra money. He is thankful for his income, even if it hardly helps him satisfy the heavy life expenses and pay his children's schooling. With his requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will pay his children's education fees. His intention is to allow his children to continue their education properly without facing any financiA. issues.

loans.use: to pay his children's education fees

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es: Hilda de 47 años es una mujer de carácter creativo y emprendedor que vive al sur de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 16 a 24 años. Desde allí se dedica a la venta de productos mediante guías especializadas, negocio que inició hace dos años por intermedio de su hermana, quien la animó para que ella se dedicara a la venta y apoyara el desarrollo de su unidad familiar. Ella dice que aunque los productos que vende (cremas dentales, jabones, vitaminas, minerales etc.) son costosos tienen una excelente calidad y este es la razón por la cual tiene muchos clientes, que cada día le remiten otros y en muchas oportunidades su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para responder esta gran demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cremas dentales especializadas, productos energéticos, vitaminas, hierro con ácido fólico, jabones detergentes que salieron en promoción en su revista y que tienen una gran demanda entre su clientela,  especialmente si los vende con precios de oportunidad. Su sueño y por el cual trabaja y se esmera, es tener más adelante su propia casa y proyectar con ella el crecimiento y la estabilización de su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 47, is a creative and enterprising woman who lives in the south of the city with her husband and 4 children between the ages of 16 and 24.
She sells products through specialized guides. She started this business two years ago because of her sister, who encouraged her to go into sales and supported her in her family's development. She says that even though the products that she sells (toothpastes, soaps, vitamins, minerals, etc.) are expensive, they are of high quality and this is why she has so many customers. Every day others are referred to her, and often her working capital is insufficient to respond to the high demand. This is why she has turned to this Kiva loan, her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will purchase specialized toothpastes, energy products, vitamins, iron with folic acid, soaps, and detergents that are on sale in her magazine and are in great demand from her customers, especially if she sells them at sale prices. Her dream, which she is striving toward, is to have her own home in the future and for her business to grow and stabilize.

loans.use: to purchase specialized toothpastes, energy products, vitamins, iron with folic acid, and soaps and detergents that are on sale in her magazine.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai was born in 1973. She lives in Xom Huong village, Co Loa commune. She is married and has three children who are still small. Her husband is a carpenter. He has an income of about 3,000,000 VND. Mrs. Mai has a general store. She sells everything for everybody in her village. She has a daily income of about 100,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2005. Her last loan was for 6,322,000 VND, and she repaid the loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to repair her store.

loans.use: to repair her store.

loans.name: Flor Elisa

texts.es:
Flor Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal "Mujeres Valerosas II“ del distrito Tarapoto del departamento San Martín y tiene 24 años. Vive en la casa de su madre junto a su pareja y su hijo de 6 años. 

La idea de ser independiente le ha gustado desde siempre y ya desde niña le gustaba vender, vendía platanos en la calle. Inició su negocio con S/. 100.00 y desde hace 4 años tiene su propia bodega, cuenta con clientela fija y la frecuentan muchos transeúntes de la zona, como su local se encuentra en el camino de unas chacras que estàn cerca de su casa tiene mucha demanda. 
Su sueño es ser mayorista, así que piensa construir una nueva casa. 
El nuevo prestamo de S/. 3,000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de  nuevos productos para su bodega, comprará productos de primeta necesidad.

Le agradece a Manuela Ramos el apoyo y dice que le gusta los plazos cortos.  También le gustado mucho el módulo educativo, sobre todo lo referente a la atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Flor Elisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Valiant Women II) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Department of San Martín. She is 24 years old and lives at her mother’s house with her partner and their six-year-old son.

Flor has always liked the idea of being independent. As a young girl, she enjoyed selling bananas on the street. Flor started her own store four years ago with 100 PEN. She has an established customer base and many pedestrians who pass through the area since her shop is located along the road in front of some farms near her home. There is great demand for her business. Her dream is to become a wholesaler so she plans to build a new house.

This new loan of 3000 PEN will be invested in the purchase of new products for her store, such as basic necessities. Flor is grateful for the support Manuela Ramos has provided and says that she likes the short repayment terms. She also enjoys the educational classes, especially the ones that focus on customer service.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 31 years old, resides in Siem Reap, Cambodia, which is a province known for ancient temples and tourism. She is working for the government and earns $4 per day. Her husband, who is also working for the government, earns $5 per day. They have two children, 12 and 8 years old, who are studying. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a plot of land for doing farming. This loan will help her family because she won’t have to buy rice from the market. She plans to buy pigs to feed and sell when she has enough money. She wants to send her children to study at the university and she hopes they can get jobs in a bank.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for doing farming.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 31 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Angelie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Angelie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Angelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La  señora Eugenia, es D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene una despensa bien surtida, el cual es su local propio. Ella vive en su casa propia. Comenta que cuenta con clientela bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro, pues hace 7 años que está trabajando en el mismo ramo, anteriormente tenia un comedor parrillada, pero quedo viuda y cambio D. trabajo. Tiene buena referencia comercial y financiera.
Ella se define como una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora que pese a todos los problemas y contratiempos ha logrado salir adelante y ser una buena comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. bebidas, cárnicos, embutidos, lácteos y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y llenar su negocio con productos que diariamente se venden.
texts.en:
Sra. Eugenia is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She has her own location where she manages a well-stocked food pantry. Eugenia lives in her own home. She says that she has an established customer base because of her seven years of experience in this line of work. Eugenia previously managed a diner where she sold grilled foods, but she changed businesses after she became a widow. She has good business and credit references.

Eugenia defines herself as an enterprising and determined woman. Despite all of the problems and setbacks she has faced, Eugenia has been able to move forward and become a good businesswoman. She is requesting a loan to buy beverages, meats, sausages, dairy products, and other items so that her business will be stocked and filled with merchandise that she can sell on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meats, sausages, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mae de 5 filhos  todos ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 5ª classe  e nao continuou por falta de condicoes financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ela. 
É negociante ha mais de 10 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e consegue um um rendimento de cerca 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, farinha, arroz, caldos, refrescos e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende criar frangos de corte para aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julieta was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children; all the children still attend school. Julieta finished fifth grade but did not continue because her parents had financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her parents, who live with her.

She has been a businesswoman for more than ten years, and she sells staple goods. Julieta earns around 5,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Julieta's first Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 26,000 meticais to buy products (oil, flour, rice, broth, soft drink and other products) to increase her inventory.

She promises to make her payments promptly, and in the future she intends to raise chickens for meat to increase her income. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (oil, flour, rice, broth, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Mildred Atieno

texts.en: Mildred is 44 years old and is married to a businessman. They have six children ranging from fifteen to twenty-four years old. She has sold tablecloths for the last seven years to frequent customers at the Kangemi shopping centre in Nairobi. She wants a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy materials for embroidery. Mildred sees herself as a wholesaler of tablecloths. She describes herself as a focused woman.

loans.use: to buy materials for embroidery

loans.name: Kon Koun Doien Group

texts.fr:
Mme DJENEB.  est la responsable du groupe KON KOUN DOIEN. Elle est veuve  et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 22ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de l’igname depuis 2006(05ans). Elle s’approvisionne  à Léo au BURKINA. Ses clients sont  les  femmes et les restauratrices.

Elle veut  s’acheter  1/2 sac (54 ignames).

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices et s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  devenir une grande commerçante pour acheter et revendre les ignames en grande quantité et aussi ajouter des pains de singe (tedo).
texts.en:
Ms. DjénéB. is the group leader of the Kon Koun Doien group. She is a widow and the mother of two children. The oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 22. One child attends school. She has three persons under her care.

She has been selling yams for the past five years (since 2006). She resupplies in Leo in Burkina Faso. Her customers are women and restaurant operators.

She wants to buy one half-bag of yams (54 yams).

She puts her profits into savings and cares for her family. She aims to become a great retail merchant, buying and selling large quantities of yams and also baobab juice (Tedo).

loans.use: buy one half-bag of yams (54 yams)

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is a coconut supplier in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has four children. Six years ago, Nathaniel sold one of his cattle to raise the capital required to start the business, but it was not sufficient to run the business. 

Since being introduced to Milango, he has decided to apply for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more coconuts to sell. December is a busy month, and he foresees a good business opportunity. The coastal people grate the coconut and add it into many meals during this period. 

Nathaniel looks forward to supplying other regions within Kenya. He intends to use the extra income obtained from this loan to pay school fees for his child who is in the seventh grade.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane est agriculteur depuis quinze ans .Il accompagnait son père aux champs dès le bas âge ; c’est comme cela qu’il a appris le métier .Il habite un village qui se trouve à  peu près à  16 km de la ville principale.
Avec le crédit il va acheter des semences et des intrants agricoles.
Dans le futur il envisage d’ exploiter d’ autres domaine avec une quantité supérieur à celui qu’il a maintenant.
texts.en:
Ousmane has worked as a farmer for fifteen years. He accompanied his father to the fields beginning when he was very young; this is how he learned the profession. He lives in a village that is about 16 km from the main city.
With this loan, he is going to buy seeds and farm inputs.
In the future, he plans to farm more fields in greater quantity than he does now.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Miluska Anali

texts.es: Miluska es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas, tiene 24 años, se dedica a la venta de celulares, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, desde joven ha trabajado mucho, empezó de muy poco con 6 celulares y ahora ya tiene mas de 50 celulares, esta muy feliz con todo lo que esta logrando, su mayor deseo es poder tener una tienda, y también crecer como mujer y seguir progresando, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de celulares de Bolivia.
texts.en:
Miluska is a member of the "Hormigas" communal bank. She is 24, and sells cell phones. She has been a member of Finca Perú for two years. 

She has worked hard since she was young. She began with very little; with six cell phones, and now she has more than 50 cell phones. She is very happy with everything that she is achieving. 

Her greatest desire is to be able to have a store, and also to grow as a woman, and continue progressing. Now, with the loan, she will invest in the purchase of cell phones from Bolivia.

loans.use: To buy cell phones.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza is a fifty-two-year-old married woman with nine children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been farming for the past twenty years and this has enabled her to educate her children. Her family dream is to educate her children and have a sustainable income source. She has challenges of price fluctuation and her dream is buying more land to grow crops on. Roza intends to use the loan facility to pay workers to weed her garden.

loans.use: to pay workers to weed her garden.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una entidad financiera,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiena varios años en este negocio,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio.La socia solicita le credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel continues working for a financial entity.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has been working in this business for several years.  She has already been working in this business for five years.

She is requesting to loan to buy a television for her house.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Emoinu Group

texts.en: Devala, the group leader, is a 47 year old married woman. She lives with her family of 3 in Imphal East district of Manipur state in the Eastern part of India. She is engaged in embroidery work and makes blouses, salwars, shirts, petticoats and mekhalas and then sell the final products. As the income from the present scale of business is not enough to meet both ends, she has to expand her business. The other members of the group are also engaged in various income generation activities like cloth selling, mirror making, hotel etc. Similarly, the other members will use the loan to buy more stock and raw materials to expand their respective businesses. Therefore, they all joined hands to form a group and applied for a loan. They are well aware of the group rules and agreed to abide by them. They are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand her embroidery business and sell blouses, salwars, shirts, petticoats, etc.

loans.name: Irma Lorena

texts.en:
Irma is a very active and hard-working woman, she is married and her husband works in the hospital of the town, they have four children, of 18, 17, 7 and 2 years old respectively. She began her business one year ago. She invested some capital and she had make it grow. Her necessity in that moment was contribute to the family economy and offer to her children a good education, the biggest young guys study the preparatory and they help in the business in their free time, also Irma’s small business offers employment to two people.

Their business requires work capital, and for that reason she is requesting for a loan of $475 USD to purchase and provide better merchandise to her clients, she promise to repay this loan in a term of 4-8 months.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Irma es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, esta casada y su esposo trabaja en el hospital del pueblo, tienen cuatro hijos, de 18, 17, 7 y 2 años respectivamente. Ella inició su negocio hace un año, invirtió un poco de capital y lo ha hecho crecer. Su necesidad en ese entonces era poder contribuir a la economía familiar y poder brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación, los dos más grandes estudian la preparatoria y ayudan en el negocio en sus ratos libres. Además su pequeño negocio brinda empleo a dos personas más.

Su negocio requiere de capital de trabajo, es por eso que solicita un préstamo por $ 475 USD para poder surtir mejor y contar con las mercancías que le solicitan sus clientes, ella espera pagarlo en un plazo de 4-8 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
N. is married and has two children. One child is going to school. He started his business with $100 from his previous employer four years ago. Since then, the business has grown, enabling him to meet the financial needs of the family.

With the loan, he wants to buy more garments to meet the ever-increasing demands of his customers. He intends to use the profits to buy a plot and build a house for the family.

loans.use: Investing in business

loans.name: Dang

texts.en: Dang is 28 years old and married. Her son is attending first grade. Her family's business is making bamboo baskets and their income is $8 per person per month. They want to receive a loan of $75 to purchase bamboo and they will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Dang would like to purchase bamboo in order to make baskets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy extra plastic plates and cups.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Tha was married in 2000 and has one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her sister-in-law in 1998 and she started her silk production business in 2001. Her husband  also assists her in weaving. In addition, he sometimes cooks for  wedding ceremonies, which he learned from his brother in 2001.   

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA  five times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $150. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.name: Victoria Zorida

texts.en:
Victoria Zorida V. T. belongs to a village bank called “Nobleza,” which is a Spanish word for “Nobility.”

Victoria spent the majority of her professional life as a practicing obstetrician in the outskirts of Ayacucho, Peru. When she moved into the city some years ago, however, she could only find work sporadically which was not enough to provide for her newborn son. Victoria was eventually able to find work in “Rosita’s Pharmacy,” which she inherited from the owner eight months ago.

Now the owner/manager of a small pharmacy, Victoria hopes to be able to hire an employee so that she can spend more time with her five-year-old son, Fabio Fernando. Her long-term goal, however, is to one day run a health clinic for adolescents which would provide health advice and care, as well as a pharmacy.

Within her village bank, Victoria says she has been able to utilize her knowledge as an OB-GYN by advising the many mothers within her group. Victoria is asking for a $1000 loan with which she will buy more reliable name brand drugs for her pharmacy to replace the generic brands stocked by the previous owner.

loans.use: buy more reliable name brand drugs to replace the generic brands she presently sells

loans.name: Makhluga

texts.en: Ms. Makhluga S. is a 29 year old single woman who lives in a village called Yenikand, which is situated in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan with her father (pictured). She first started her farming business seven years ago. She is now applying for this $1200 loan in order to buy pesticides to help protect her crops and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a young mother of a small six year old daughter. Upon noticing that the situation with the father of the small girl was very uncomfortable and damaging to the young one, she decided to separate from him. Since then, her small girl Emily has given her strength to move forward. She works incessantly selling ceviche, a type of seafood salad, and chicken broth in a small space that she has rented. Thanks to the effort, dedication and patience that she invests in the preparation of her delicious dishes, she is achieving good results in a short period of time. The wishes of this hard working mother is to further fix up her small place of business to make it more comfortable and elegant for her customers. This is the reason she is requesting this loan which she promises to repay in six months. Thanks to her perseverance and your support she will be able to see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Vilma es una joven madre de una pequeña niña de seis años., Al observar que la situación con el padre de su pequeña era muy incómoda y perjudicial para su pequeña, decidió separase en común acuerdo con éste. Desde entonces su pequeña niña Emily le da fuerzas suficientes para seguir adelante, trabaja incansablemente vendiendo ceviche y caldo de pollo en un pequeño local que alquiló. Gracias al empeño, dedicación y paciencia que pone diariamente en la preparación de sus agradables platos, está obteniendo en poco tiempo muy buenos resultados.El deseo de esta trabajadora madre es implementar aún más su pequeño espacio de ventas con el fin de brindarles mayor comodidad y elegancia a sus clientes. Por esa razón desea obtener un préstamo de dinero que se compromete a reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses.Gracias a su perseverancia y a tu importante apoyo podrá contemplar el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Expansion of her small place of business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with a 5-year-old son. She lives in Uzhgorod and sells women’s lingerie in the local market called “Belochka.” She always offers only the best quality, trendy merchandise. Her inventory is always in high demand among women customers. Nataliya is very enterprising and confident. She has been in this business for 2 years. Currently, her turnover captial is about $2400.

Nataliya rarely uses lending services, and she normally uses her own capital to make wholesale purchases of inventory to sell in the market. This time, however, she is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase new, more expensive lingerie before the spring season. We believe Nataliya’s willingness to offer her customers greater value and a wider choice of merchandise, combined with her excellent service, will secure the successful growth of her trade and guarantee good profits from sales. She hopes one day to have enough savings to fulfill her desire to open her own larger lingerie store in the city of Uzhgorod.

loans.use: Purchase new, more expensive inventory

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en: I am Shahnaz S., married and a mother of nine: five boys and four girls. My husband manufactures shoes in his small shoe factory. I also help him decorate these shoes with beads and sequins. We need a loan to invest in our shoe business so that our income can increase. With the loan he will purchase leather, gum and beads in a suitable quantity. I would like to borrow in a group of few other women who are: Rukshanda  B. is a beautician and needs to purchase few items for her salon. Yasmeen B. needs this loan for her husband’s bicycle store. Lastly, Saima T. will use the loan for  fixing of her husband’s rickshaw.

loans.use: Buy leather, gum and beads in a large quantity

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia has belonged to the Solidarity Communal Bank for 1 year.

She is 21 years old and has 2 children 2 and 7 years old. Amelia is an artisan. She weaves quilts and other goods. She learned her craft from her parents, and sells her crafts the Ayacucho city market. She is planning to travel to the city of Huancayo to buy thread at a good price.

Amelia needs a loan of 2000 soles so that she can invest yarn, wool, and dyes.

She hopes to have her own house, and that her kids can do better than her. She also wants to improve her business and directly export her products.

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Amelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Solidaridad hace 1 año.

Amelia es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 2 hijos de 7, 2 años, Amelia realiza artesanía en telar como pisos, frazadas, pasadizos, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, sus ventas lo realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Amelia tiene proyectado viajar a la ciudad de Huancayo para comprar los hilos a un precio mas cómodo.

Amelia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilo, lana y tintes.

Los sueños de Amelia son tener casa propia, que sus hijos sean mejores que ella, mejorar su negocio y exportar directamente sus productos.

loans.use: Amelia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilo, lana y tintes.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Luân, 48, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband. They have a son who is attending university away from home. Mrs Luân opened a clothing store 5 years ago. Today, her business is striving. Her annual income is 3000-4000 USD after expenses. According to her, this type of business requires a lot of capital to keep a high level of inventory. For the last 7 years with TYM, she has totaled a few thousands of dollars in loans. Every sum that is invested in her business brings her good profit. This is why she is seeking a new loan of 1200 USD to buy new clothes for her shop

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Luân, 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng tại huyện Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Anh chị có một cháu trai đang học cao đẳng trên tỉnh. Cách đây 5 năm chị Luân mở cửa hàng kinh doanh quần áo. Công việc hiện nay đang rất phát triển, sau khi trừ chi phí thu nhập mỗi năm của gia đình khoảng 3 đến 4 nghìn USD. Chị Luân tâm sự với nghề nghiệp này thì lúc nào chị cũng cần vốn. Trong 7 năm tham gia chị đã vay của Quỹ vài nghìn USD. Số vốn vay luôn mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế nên vòng vốn này chị Luân quyết định xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Lisset Judith

texts.es:
Señora Lisset V. lives with her partner. She was born on October 29, 1982 and is 25 years old. She has three children who depend upon her and her husband. She has completed her high school studies and lives with her in-laws in Prolongación Cesar Vallejo in El Palomar, Trujillo, Perú.

Since 2007, she has sold clothing for women, men, children, and babies. At a minimum she has done this to help her husband financially with the household expenses.

She received her first loan of 300.00 Soles from the Manuela Ramos Movement which she used entirely to buy merchandise. She belongs to the group “Mientras Tanto Estrellas De Jesus.”

With a loan of 1200.00 Soles ($425) that she will repay in 4 months, she will buy clothing for the winter season like Peruvian alpaca sweaters, jackets, turtlenecks, overalls, etc. She delivers orders placed by her relatives, friends, and even clients to their homes.

Judith dreams of having a more stable business with a store where she can sell in better conditions and, later on, build a house for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lisset V., es conviviente, nació el 29 de octubre del año 1982, tiene 25 años, con 03 hijos dependientes aún de ella y de su esposo, tiene estudios secundarios completos, y vive junto a sus suegros en la Prolongación Cesar Vallejo en la Urb. El Palomar - Trujillo – Perú.

Desde el año 2007, se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas, caballeros, niños y de bebe, al por menor como un medio para ayudar a su pareja económicamente en los gastos del hogar.

Recibió un primer préstamo otorgado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, de S/.300.oo, lo invertio completamente en la compra de mercadería. Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Estrellas De Jesus”.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1200. el cual cancelará en 4 meses lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de temporada invierno esto es chompas, casacas, cafarenas, buzos, etc. ella trabaja la modalidad de reparto a domicilio de los pedidos que le hacen sus familiares, amigas y demás clientes.

Judith sueña con tener un negocio más estable con un local donde pueda vender en mejores condiciones, y así más adelante construir su casa para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), Ms. Nguyen Thi T. didn't have much fund. Thus, her family's life is very difficult. In 1997, she joined TYM Fund. Her first loan of 35USD was used to buy coal for her brick factory. Making brick was very difficult, yet it didn't bring back much profit. Thus, in 2001, Ms. T. switched to breed chickens and hens. At the moment, her farm has about 500 hens. Each day there are about 300 eggs, which is sold for 28USD. After deducting all other expenses, Ms. T.'s daily income is about 10 USD. Ms. T. has 3 children who are still going to school. This loan cycle, she would like to borrow 1150 USD to invest in her farm. Her monthly income is 375 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ, do không có vốn làm ăn nên kinh tế gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Thơm còn rất eo hẹp. Năm 1997 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ để được vay vốn, vòng 1 chị vay 500.000 đồng mua than đốt lò gạch. Việc sản xuất gạch vất vả mà hiệu quả không cao nên năm 2001 chị chuyển sang chăn nuôi gà thịt, gà đẻ trứng. Hiện nay trang trại chăn nuôi gà của gia đình chị có khoảng 500 con gà đẻ trứng bình quân mỗi ngày thu hoạch 300 quả trứng với giá trứng hiện tại thì thu nhập hàng ngày là 450.000đ, trừ chi phí mỗi ngày gia đình cũng lãi được 150.000 đồng. Chị có 3 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising chicken

loans.name: Rahel's Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Rahel is 48 years old, married and has three children ages 30, 25 and 15. She went into business selling clothes in 2005. Every day, she works from 10 a.m. to midnight at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rahel has applied for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will share this loan with the other member of her group, who makes a living running a cafe.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 64 years old. She is married with 6 children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. Rose sells clothes, and also she is a tailor and a hair stylist. She has been in this business for the past 25 years. She is also a LAPO client  and needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 38 years old, and she is married with 2 children, ages 6 and 3. She has run her own shop since 2004. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Nuru is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu has been in business in Zanzibar since 2007. She sells both firewood and kanga, a local fabric used for clothing and household needs. By diversifying her business ventures she has been able to earn approximately $45 each month. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day. With her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, she will buy more inventory of both of her products so that she can increase her sales and profit.

Saumu is 25 years old, married, and has two children, ages 1 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and kanga for her businesses.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 45 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos de 7,9 y 22 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, doña Martha junto a su esposo administra el negocio que es una micelania y videos juegos, lo cual iniciaron vendiendo ropa por encargos y una sala de video juego lo cual ahora tiene mas amplia y con mas equipo de video juego, con las solicitudes que hace a Afodenic se ha beneficiado por que en cada préstamo invierte mas con esta solicitud es su quinta, la cual quiere para comprar productos varios como una planta telefónica, para brindar un nuevo servicios a sus clientes, también desea invertir en útiles escolares, invertir en mas carne blanca, que es la venta de pollo que se consume bastante por los nicaragüense por ser mas barata y mas saludable.  A largo plazo desea captar más clientes y dar estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old. She lives in the 380 neighborhood in Managua. She has three children ages 7, 9 and 22, who are still in school. Martha and her husband run a small general store and a video game store. They initially started business by selling clothes on demand, but currently, they also own a video game room that has been growing, as they buy more video game equipment. She has taken advantage of every request she has made to Afodenic, as she can invent more with each loan she obtains. This is her fifth loan request, which she will use to buy miscellaneous products as well a phone switchboard, to provide her customers with a new service. She would also like to invest in school supplies. And, she would like to invest in more white meat, specially chicken, as it is largely consumed by people in Nigaragua because it is less expensive and healthier than other types of meat. In the long term, she would like to attract more customers and to be able to pay for school fees for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a PBX and more store supplies

loans.name: Clarial Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Clarial P. se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y calzados en su propio establecimiento en el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana abre el establecimiento ofreciendo ropa para caballeros, damas y niños con diferentes estilos y diferentes tamaños.

Hoy en día ella espera la respuesta de Ceprodel por la razón de que ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y muy confiadamente asegura que su crédito será otorgado de inmediato para proceder a la compra de la ropa brindada por sus proveedores.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clarial P. works selling clothing and shoes in her store in the central market of the city of Chinandega where she opens early every morning to offer various styles and sizes of clothing for men, women, and children. Today, she is hoping to receive a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase additional merchandise. She is confident that she will receive the loan quickly to be able to purchase the clothing from her suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Eman has owned a clothing shop for five years. She has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Eman has requested a loan.
Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she faced livelihood expenses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es: Don Juan Pedro G. P.  con 24 años de edad, es casado, de oficios Talabartero “elaboración de Zapatos para hombres”, habita junto a sus hijos, cuentan con la ayuda de su esposa para elaborar zapatos para  la misma actividad, lleva 5 años de trabajar  en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en el Paraje Xepatan, de la Aldea de ChiP., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela ha aumentado y debido  a sus condiciones  económicas en que se encuentra no, son suficientes para que el pueda  aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar material para tejeduria y de esa manera poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Juan Pedro G. P. is 24 years old, married, and works producing men's shoes. He lives with his wife and children, and his wife helps him make the shoes at home. He has been working out of his home for 5 years, located in the Xepatan area in the village of ChiP. in the Totonicapan department in Guatemala. The demand from his customers has risen, but due to economic conditions, he is not able to raise enough money to purchase materials to meet this demand. For this reason, he came to the ASDIR association to request a loan in order to purchase weaving materials so he can continue making shoes to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Esubio

texts.es:
El Sr.EUSEBIO T. P., es nuestro socio, el nació en de la comunidad de Urquillos de la provincia de Calca, Este socio tiene 49 años de edad, es padre de 05 hijos, los cuales tienen 21, 19, 17, 15, 13 y 9 años de edad; todos ellos estudiantes.

El socio EUSEBIO, trabaja desde hace 38 años la tierra, a los 11 años el apoyaba a su padre al cultivo de los diferentes productos que la zona produce; entre los que se tiene, el mejor maíz del mundo, de granos grandes y ricos, la papa en sus diferentes variedades, las habas, y verduras, las hortalizas, calabazas; esta actividad le permite al socio dar una adecuada educación a sus hijos y llevar el sustento diario a casa.

El socio agradece muy gentilmente el préstamo que a él le permitirá tener las herramientas necesarias para iniciar su nueva producción, de modo tal que le permitirá tener una buena cosecha, este socio está comprometido y valora el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Mr. Eusebio T. P. was born in the community of Urquillos in the province of Calca. He is 49 years old and the father of five children (aged 21, 19, 17, 15, 13 and 9), all of whom are students. Eusebio has been farming for 38 years, and for 11 years, he helped his father grow various crops that are produced in the area, including the best corn in the world, high-quality grain, many kinds of potatoes, beans, greens, pumpkins and other vegetables. Eusebio's work allows him to provide for his children and helps them obtain their education. Eusebio is thankful for this loan, which will allow him to acquire the tools necessary to improve production and have a good harvest; he is committed to honoring the terms of his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds, and rent a tractor.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Née le 26 Mars 1973 à Tsévié dans le Zio, Mme Catherine A. est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Son activité principale est la culture et la vente de piments très utilisés dans l’art culinaire au Togo. Elle pratique cette culture depuis plus de sept (07) ans avec beaucoup de succès.  Afin d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais, elle sollicite un crédit. Cela lui permettra d’obtenir de meilleurs rendements, d’augmenter ses recettes et améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on March 26, 1973 in Tsévié, in Zio prefecture, Ms. Catherine A. is married and the mother of six. Her main work involves growing and selling chili peppers, which are used a lot in the culinary arts of Togo. She has been in this business very successfully for over seven years. To extend her arable lands and to buy fertilizer, she's requesting a loan. This will allow her to obtain better yields, to increase her receipts, and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing chili peppers

loans.name: Matagi

texts.en: Matagi L., 30, is married with four children. She has five years of experience in the taro plantation business and sells to the village people and public four days per week. Her children also help out with her business. Matagi has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 140 tala ($56 USD). SPBD loans are Matagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase knives, fertilizers, and chemicals for farming

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married to Antonio, who operates their passenger tricycle. The couple was blessed with three children: Magie, 27; Jun-Jun, 25; and Analyn, 24. They are all high-school graduates; however, due to lack of financial resources, they were not able to pursue their college education.

Edna wants to help her husband earn an income for their daily needs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 9,000.00 for the maintenance of their passenger tricycle. Aside from their tricycle, she is also planning to invest some of the amount in her piggery and poultry-raising business. Her goal is to have a progressive business through the financial assistance that she would like to have.

She is wishing to have a better way of life by working hard. She believes that in every sacrifice, there is a reward ahead waiting, that is why she is doing her best to achieve her simple dreams.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria Gómez , tiene la edad de 34 años , habita en el barrio la Francia numero uno , ubicado en las afueras del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo seis hijos , todos menores de edad , ellos actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace 25 años trabaja como agricultora y comerciante , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la cenizas del volcán , con el financiamiento obtenido va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicárselo al cultivo y obtener mejores ganancias al venderlas a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Gómez is 34 and lives in the Francia Número Uno neighborhood, which is located on the outskirts of the city of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband, who helps her support their home. They have six children, all of whom are minors and who are in school. Their plans for their family are to improve their living conditions. She has worked for 25 years as a farmer and merchant. The most difficult thing she faces is the lack of financing and the ashes from the volcano. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crops so she can have a better crop and sell it at a better price.
