Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Edoh Abla

texts.fr: Cette dame est une veuve qui pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, a ouvert une débit de boissons en 2003, elle s’approvisionne auprès de la société de la brasserie"BB" à lomé. Elle livre les boissons aux tenanciers de bars. Une partie de son stock est épuisée, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 7 casiers de GUINNESS, 8 casiers de EKU et AWOYO, 15 casiers de sucrerie et autres.
texts.en:
This lady is a widow who opened a drinks depot in 2003 so as to support her family. She gets her merchandise from the brewery BB in Lomé. She delivers drinks to bar owners. A part of her stock is expended, so she needs to stock up and has asked WAGES for a first loan to buy 7 crates of Guinness, 8 crates of Eku and Awoyo, and 15 cases of soft drinks and other items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of crates of drinks

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie O. has been working as a traditional gold miner for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from this activity. Her main source of income is from selling gold dust in her community. Elsie also raises livestock such as chicken and carabao (water buffalo). Her earnings from raising farm animals help a lot in supporting her family. Elsie wants to open up a simple food stall in which she'll be selling cooked rice and viand. Elsie is 41 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. They are from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City.

In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to start up her food vending business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start up a food vending business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1047071477) is a 32 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, H. operates a family member's business manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. H. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND to be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 6th loan taken out by H. from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Marily

texts.es: Marily tiene 24 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 pequeños hijos. Hace algunos años atrás pudo comprar un motocarro con el que su esposo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y se encarga de mantener el vehículo en perfectas condiciones. Por otro lado, Marily se dedica a la venta de ropa por los distintos lugares de su zona de forma ambulante, en el horario que ella misma se ha establecido, de 6 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde; trabajar la hace sentirse útil, menciona. Esta joven pareja está luchando por salir adelante y forjarse un futuro, pues su deseo es poder brindarles a sus hijos una adecuada educación. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros y compañeras son personas tranquilas y bien organizadas. El dinero que solicita será usado en el mantenimiento y reparación de su motocarro, lo que le costará un aproximado de 800 soles, lo restante será invertido en la compra de más ropa.
texts.en:
Marily is 24 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of her two young children. Some years ago, she was able to buy a motorcar, with which her husband transports passengers. He also takes care of the vehicle and keeps it in perfect condition. Marily sells clothes in different places in the area by traveling; she has set her schedule so that she works from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening. She says that working makes her feel useful. This young couple is fighting to overcome their problems and create a future, because their dream is to offer their children a good education. She has already gotten three loans from MFP, and what she likes most about her community bank is that her colleagues are calm and well-organized people. The money that she is requesting will be used to maintain and repair her motorcar, which will cost approximately 800 soles. The rest of the loan will be invested to buy more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her motorcar and increase her merchandise

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es comerciante de dulces, galletas y otros; tiene un puesto en la  ciudad de el Alto, su esposo es chofer asalariado, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de ella, pues los menores todavía se encuentran estudiando y no pueden ayudar o colaborar con los quehaceres; vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona 16 de Febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (galletas, dulces) y así poder vender mas y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Elsa.
texts.en:
Elsa sells sweets, cookies, and other things. She has a stand in the city of El Alto. Her husband is a salaried chauffer. This is the source of income with which she takes care of her three children, who are dependent on her. The younger children are still studying and can’t help with the chores. She lives in her own house, located in the 16 de Febrero area in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (cookies and sweets), so that she can sell more and can improve her income. This is her first loan with Impro. An evaluation qualified her for the approval of her loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies and sweets for her business

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es: Rene Antonio M. C. de 40 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, Departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales asisten a la escuela de Ilopango. Rene se dedica a la extracción de piedras en su propia mina, la cual también esta ubicada en el municipio de Ilopango. El solícita un préstamo, ya que desea  mejorar sus negocio y así obtener el dinero para la compra de dinamita y otras herramientas que se utilizan para la extracción de piedras en las minas.
texts.en:
Rene Antonio M. C. is 40 years old and lives in Ilopango, which is in the District of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who takes charge of the household chores and the care of their three school-aged children who attend classes in Ilopango. Rene extracts stones from his own mine, which is also located in the town of Ilopango.

He is requesting a loan in order to improve his business. He plans to buy dynamite and other tools needed to extract stone from his mines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dynamite & tools for extracting stones from a mine

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly es una mujer emprendedora que lucha por sus ideales. Tiene 20 años de edad y un hijo de 2 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado de San Fernando, esta actividad la realiza por las mañanas y por las tardes sale a ofrecer su pescado en su motokar por algunas zonas alejadas del  centro de la ciudad. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es chofer de motokar. Merly es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Corajes”, desde hace 2 años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo invirtió en la compra de pescado; Con este préstamo de 1000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más pescado y el financiamiento para adquirir otro motokar, que le permita tener otra fuente de ingresos. Su meta es llegar a tener un kiosco bien surtido y de esta manera ayudar a su esposo en la economía de su  hogar.
texts.en:
Merly is an enterprising woman who fights for her ideals. She is 20 years old and has a two-year-old child. She sells fish in the morning at the market in San Fernando. In the evenings she sells fish from her motorcar in the outskirts of the city with the support of her husband, who drives. Merly has been a member of the "Mujeres Corajes" Village Bank for the past two years. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in the purchase of fish. The loan of 1000 soles she requests now will be invested in the purchase of even more fish and to finance the acquisition of another motorcar, which will give her another source of income. Her goal is to have a well-stocked kiosk so that in this way she can help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fish and a motorcar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos, de 13 años, en su casa propia. Cuenta con más de 30 años de experiencia en las labores agrícolas, pues desde su niñez aprendió la dinámica del trabajo. En la actualidad cultiva papa, maíz, olluco, arveja y otros productos, los cuales lleva a vender al mercado principal de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad. Asimismo, cría animales, los cuales lleva todos los días a pastorear a lugares  lejanos, como a dos horas de caminata. Lo único que desea Teofila es continuar con sus actividades agrícolas hasta donde le sigan dando sus fuerzas.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete firmemente a ser puntual en sus pagos y a las reuniones que realice su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para sus próximas siembras.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Eylin

texts.es: Eylin es casada, trabaja en la Fundaciòn Josè Nieborowski desde hace 6 años como contadora, tiene dos hijas la mayor tiene 13 años estudia su 6to de educaciòn primaria y la menor de 10 años de edad estudia su 5to grado de educaciòn primaria, su esposo trabaja como analista de crèdito de un banco y asume los gastos familiares, viven en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para repellar la habitación  en su casa  para tener condicones en el hogar.  Eylin se ha caracterizado por ser una profesional muy responsable, honesta a demostrado capacidad y voluntad de pago,  esta familia profesa la iglesia catòlica son muy unidos,  esta clienta con el crédito anterior logro satisfactoriamente construir una habitación para una mejor comodidad, ella aspira aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, que sus hijas estudien y salud.
texts.en:
Eylin is married and has worked for the Fundación José Nieborowski as an accountant for the past 6 years. She has two daughters; the eldest is 13 years old and is in the 6th grade and the youngest is 10 years old and is in the 5th grade. Her husband is a credit analyst at a bank and takes care of the family expenses. They live in Zone #6 of Nueva Guinea and she is requesting her third loan from AFODENIC to plaster the room in her house to improve her living conditions. Eylin is noted as a very responsible, professional person; she's honest and has demonstrated capacity and will to repay her loans in a timely fashion. This is a very close, Catholic family. With her previous loan, she managed to successfully build a room for more comfort. She aims to have a home with better living conditions, to have stable employment, and that her daughters study and are healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on corn and ensure a constant supply of fish

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.pt:
Erasmo nasceu na vila de namaacha na fronteira da suazilandia tem 32 anos de idade vive maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 6 a 9 anos, todos vão à escola. Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue por mês poupar 2.000.00MT, porque conta com ajuda de 4 empregados.

Erasmo apos concluir o ensino médio (12 classe) não consegue ingressar na faculdade e com ajuda do seu pai que é um grande agricultor, deu lhe uma parte de terra e ele inicia com a pratica de agricultura. A primeira cultura lançada foi o morango, mas porque ele tinha falta de um sistema de rega (gota a gota) que facilita nos regadios para a diversificação das culturas, ele aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00MT para aumentar o volume de produção de mais culturas.

Anos depois sai da casa dos seus pais alegando que vivia longe da sua machamba e que sofria roubos frequentes, então passa a viver numa vivenda abandonada que foi dos seus avos. Tem como melhor produto o (feijão verde, repolho, tomate e pepinos) gastando uma media de 35.000.00MT e tendo de lucro 50.000.00MT quando tem vendido a kilo e de 65.000.00MT quando tem vendido a grosso, pois não tem muitos gastos e assegura que as culturas cheguem a bom estado.   

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Erasmo na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva, o primeiro de 25.000.00MT foi usado para comprar um sistema de rega gota a gota e sementes para a machamba, o segundo de 45.000.00MT foi usado para aplicar na machamba, mas não teve muito sucesso devido à falta de água e estes 25.000.00MT serão usados para o mesmo fim, está confiante que vai pagar antes do prazo determinado e pedir um outro empréstimo para construção de um armazém de luz difusa para armazenamento da semente da batata para fornecer semente ao nível do distrito.
texts.en:
Erasmo was born in the village of Nammacha in the frontier of Suazilandia, he is 32 years old and lives with his wife and they have two children who are 6 and 9 years old, they all go to school. He is not responsible for anyone besides her family and gets an income of 2.000MT because he has the help of four employees. After finishing middle school (12 grade) Erasmo wasn't able to get into college and with his father's help who is a great farmer, and gave Erasmo a piece of his land, he started farming. His first produce was strawberry but because he didn't have any irrigation system (drop by drop) which enables diversification of produce, he contacted Hluvuku requesting a loan for 25.000MT to increase the volume of production. Years later this is his 3rd loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva, his first of 25.000MT was used to buy an irrigation system drop by drop for seeds of his farm, the second of 45.000MT was used for the farm, but wasn't very successful due to the lack of water and this new one for 25.000MT will be used for the same, he is confident he will be able to pay in the determined period of time and request another loan to build a warehouse of diffuse light to store potatoes seeds to provide seeds at district level.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production of strawberry and other produce

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. is 38 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his family. He and his wife have four children between the ages of 3 and 17, all of which attend school.  Mr. Chea S. and his wife own a small plot of land on the outskirts of the city on which they farm vegetables such as cucumbers and lettuce.  He has requested his first loan of $1,200 from CREDIT to expand his business by buying additional seeds and purchasing his neighbors’ surplus vegetables to sell them at the market alongside his own produce.  

In the future, Chea S. would like to continue to slowly increase the capacity of his farm.  Eventually he would like to expand his house to provide more room for himself, his wife and their children.  Finally, even though the bulk of his income already goes towards his children’s education, he hopes that as his business becomes more profitable, he can send all of them to better schools so that they may have more opportunities.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Samardin

texts.ru: Самардин Сабуров проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Сабуров более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа крупно рогатого скота. У него имеются постоянные клиенты, мясники.
texts.en:
Samardin S. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. S. has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. He raises and sells livestock. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase cattle. He has consistent customers, butchers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou R. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Marilou is single and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Rosa Venturana

texts.es: CLIENTE RECURRENTE QUE CANCELO EN FORMA PUNTUAL SU CREDITO SOLICITA UN NUEVO CREDITO PARA CAPITAL  D. TRABAJO CUENTA CON TRES PUESTOS EN LA ASOCIACION D. COMERCIANTES  DEL MERCADO D. LA TINGUIÑA UNO FUNCIONA LA VENTA D. COMIDA, OTRO D. ABARROTES, UNO DEL SERVICIO D. ARREGLO D. CALZADOS, SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA IMPLEMENTAR SU TERCER PUESTO D. LA VENTA D. ABARROTES , CUENTA CON EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA CON CREDITOS VIGENTES EN LA CMAC 3 CREDITOS EL CUAL PAGA PUNTUALMENTE, Y UNO EN EL SCOTIABANK, EL CUEL FUE INVERTIDO EN  SU NEGOCIO EN MEJORAS DEL LOCAL Y CAPITAL D. TRABAJO, SE PROPONE EL CREDITO POR CONTAR CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO D. PAGO.
texts.en:
Rosa is a returning client who paid her previous loan on time. She is requesting a new loan to use as operating capital. She manages three vending posts at the market of La Tinguiña as part of the local merchants’ association: from one she sells food, from another she sells groceries, and the from the third she provides shoe repair services.

The loan she is requesting will be used to keep her grocery stand in operation. She has credit experience since she repaid three existing loans with CMAC on time and another one with ScotiaBank. The proceeds from these loans were invested in capital improvements to her business. She was recommended for this loan because of her excellent loan repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her grocery business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma N. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Norma is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Norma runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products. She also sells dried fish and some kinds of fruits. Norma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bengina

texts.en:
Bengina I. is married with two sons and three daughters.  As a busy entrepreneur, she has been making and selling doormats for almost three years.  Her husband, Rodrigo is also an entrepreneur selling vegetables in the community.  Building her business, Maxima would like to receive a loan amounting 20,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold in her doormat-making business.  She is planning to purchase additional products such as cotton and other supplies.  Maxima believes that offering a wide assortment of doormat products to customers will increase their daily income and maintain customer loyalty in the community.

A committed member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2008 Bengina has been model member, demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her dreams are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her business, and start a savings account for her children and support them while they finish their studies until they complete college.  Through hard work and determination, Bengina is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and with support from ASHI and Kiva lenders.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as cotton  and other supplies

loans.name: Reuben Alenga

texts.en:
Reuben is a fifty-four-year-old married man with eight children. He farms in Lusweti and has been farming for the last twenty-five years. He not only grows maize but also does dairy farming to enable him to feed and clothe his family.

Reuben was introduced to KADET by an employee of KADET. This will be Reuben’s second loan in KADET and he plans to use the loan for the planting, weed-spraying and fertilizing of maize on his land. 

Reuben's goal is to employ more people to work for him on his farm and thus eradicating poverty in and around his home area.

loans.use: To use for the planting, weed-spraying and fertilizing of his farm

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites E. is a 38-year old married woman who lives in Barangay Culipapa Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and fish vending.

Marites’s husband, Vito, is a fisherman, and they have 6 children who are between 3 mos and 20 years old. 5 of her children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Marites joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fishing and fish vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000 from her business activities.

Marites is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used to fund operations of her fish vending and fishing businesses, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 16th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 15,000, which she intends to use on her business activities. Marites is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.
